loans.name: Tatiana Sinuk’S Group

texts.en:
Tatiana S. (the first person on the left in the photograph) organized a retirement home called “Sunshine” for people between the ages 60-90 years old. She started 5 months ago, after her mother’s death. “I didn’t give all the warmth and care I could to my own parents, so I am giving it today to my new guests,” Tatiana says. Today, Tatiana has 11 elderly people in the home and 5 staff workers.

Tatiana financed the retirement home entirely with her own money. The local government provided an old building (a former kindergarten) to use free of charge for fifteen years. Tatiana managed to make some small renovations in the building. She bought 20 beds (the total capacity is 60 people) and purchased equipment for the kitchen and dining room. Because “Sunshine” does not have enough cash assets, all of the workers work for free and hope to be paid a salary when better times come. Nowadays, the retirement home exists only with the aid of the retiree’s pensions.

Tatiana hopes to use loan money to purchase a cow and two sheep. Milk and meat from the livestock will be used for cooking. Also, some amount of milk and meat can be sold in the market. Additional food and all the necessary materials will be purchased. Also, Tatiana expects the older people to participate in the process of livestock breeding in order to fill their free time with an interesting hobby.

Tatiana S. is married and has three sons. She and her husband operate the retirement home and their sons try to help whenever they have free time. Tatiana comments: “I love this house. I feel like someone is protecting it.”

loans.use: To breed livestock, which will supply her retirement home with milk and meat

loans.name: Lulai

texts.en: Lulai T., 45, is married with 5 children.  She has 6 years of experience in the plantation business.  She sells to the general public 6 days per week.  She has no previous loans with SPBD.  Lulai expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala.  SPBD loans are Lulai’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, knifes, weedkiller chemical and fertilizer.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine started her fish business three years ago in a community market near where she lives. She is 42 years old, divorced and a mother with eight children. She prepares and serves her customers with very tasty fish in the market and she is one among many. She buys fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Many people buy from her in the marketplace.

All Josephine's children are currently in school. She supports her children from her business proceeds. She depends on that for their food, school bills and sometimes their medical bills. She needs this loan to increase her stock of assorted fish so she can increase sales and income to support her children's education and business growth. She hopes to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To increase stock of smoked and dried fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds for his farm

loans.name: Lila

texts.en:
Mrs. Lila S., 30 years old, lives in Bholdhoka, Lalitpur. She lives in a joint family household with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, her husband, sister-in-law, brother-in-law and a daughter. The economic condition of her family is very weak. They are unable to even fulfill the basic needs of the family and can't provide a better education for her daughter.

Her husband, Suresh S., is a driver for a private office and her daughter is studying in grade 6.

Mrs. S. opened her vegetable shop two years ago to improve the living standards of her family. She also sells grocery goods in her shop. Now she is requesting Rs 20,000.00 to buy green vegetables and grocery goods for her shop.

Her family's economic condition is very poor, so Mrs Lila would like to grow her business continually and improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Fulberto Antonio

texts.es: Fulberto Antonio M. Pérez tiene la edad de 41 años. Es un hombre casado y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. El se dedica a una pulpería. El tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, ya que todos los financiamientos que ha realizado han servido de mucha ayuda para su negocio. El es un hombre muy trabajador y disfruta mucho de su trabajo. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, jugos, gaseosas y pan. A pesar de las dificultades que atravesó como fueron la falta de de capital propio. Su deseo es ampliar su negocio para que el día de mañana logre ser una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Fulberto Antonio is a 41-year-old married father of three dependent children. He owns and manages a small corner shop and has worked a lot with Fundación León 2000, since all of his repaid loans have helped his business a great deal. He is a very hard-working man and really enjoys his work. The loan that he requests is for working capital to buy sweets, juices, sodas, and bread. Despite the difficulties that he has encountered, such as a lack of capital, his wish is to expand his business so that in the future he can be a distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Due to difficulties of life, Eduardo A. did not able pursue his studies in college. He helped his father in cultivating their farm lot by plating rice and vegetables after he graduated in high school. At the age of 21 he decided to marry Ludilyn of whom they are gifted with four children. At present, the two eldest is now in their secondary level of education while the two youngest are in their elementary grades. Being a responsible parent, they wanted to give their children a better future by giving them the best education they needed so long as they afford it. 

In this regard, the couple manages to help each other in earning income to support the needs of their children. Eduardo uses his tricycle transport to earn income while his wife engaged in selling food snacks and vegetables in their village. In this connection, Eduardo is asking to borrow loan from KIVA lenders the amount of PHP5, 000 for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle and maintenance of his wife vending business. He hopes that lenders will provide them support that will somehow lead to the progress of their business.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en: This is Joselito P., a 42 year old businessman from Pooc II, Silang, Cavite. He is married to Adarna, 38, a factory worker. Two of their four children are in school: one in college, the other in pre-school. Joselito has operated a general store for eight years and, over the years, his business has grown steadily. Recently, he ventured into a scrap-buying business. Along with managing his general store, he buys all kinds of used metal scraps, used bottles, cartons, and old newspapers and sells them to bigger buyers who in turn sell them to bigger recycling plants and foundries. Joselito earns close to P15,000 a month from these business activities. Joselito is now on his 10th loan with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative. He became a member in 2006. He has applied for a new loan of P15,000 to buy more items to sell at his store. In the future, Joselito wants to see his general store be bigger than what it is now, so he can help employ some of his neighbors. He is also saving a lot from his earnings to support his children’s education. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell at his store

loans.name: Urchig

texts.en: E. is 27 years old and lives with his mother in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. He and his mother live together in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent). With the help of his sister, E. operates a traditional boots and clothing business in his town. He and his sister began their business with working capital of 300,000 tugrugs (~210 USD); since then, their working capital has grown to reach 600,000 tugrugs (~420 USD). His dream is to keep expanding his business and to, eventually, be able to afford to build his own house. E. is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan in order so that he can purchase necessary fabrics and finishing materials for his clothes and shoes.

loans.use: purchasing fabrics and finishing materials for his clothes and shoes

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda Mayug, 51, earns a living through her sari-sari (retail) store. She also has a business in dress making in her neighborhood in Norala, South Cotabato.  She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc., to obtain a loan necessary for her business with a low interest rate. She has requested an amount of 12,000 PHP as additional capital for her sari-sari store.

loans.use: Groceries

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is managing his farm lot in the village where they live. He is married to Marilyn and they have been blessed with four children: Jhon Mazel, 14, a high school student; Jezel Anne, 12; Jezza, 4 years old and Jhonnel, 2 years old.

Albert dreams of having high yields because this is the main source of their income. He hopes to borrow additional capital from KIVA lenders for the maintenance of his rice farming business. He wishes to get a loan amounting PHP 30,000 in order to purchase fertilizer, pesticides and other important things needed in his rice farming business. This amount of loan will be a big help in growing his business.

loans.use: Buy farming supplies

loans.name: Onyero

texts.en:
Onyero has a big store where she sells clothes and jewelry at retail prices to her customers. Onyero puts more hours in her business attending to her customers; she also has a good customer relationship with her customers. Onyero has two (2) children and her husband is a contractor.

This is the high season for her business and Onyero hopes to make more profits during this season. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more clothes and jewelry to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
El Sr. Rafael Insaurralde nació en Luque, vive con su madre en el barrio Ykaa de dicha ciudad, se dedica a realizar trabajos de plomería a domicilio, como por ejemplo todas las instalaciones de cañería de la cocina, baño, piletas y arreglo en general, también realiza trabajos de construcción de todo tipo.
El último crédito lo destinó a la compra de artículos sanitarios entre otros accesorios para terminar una obra. Opera con La Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2008 mostrando una buena referencia de pago
El Sr. Rafael agradece la ayuda brindada por la Fundación ya que mediante la misma también pudo comprar herramientas para facilitar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Rafael Insaurralde was born in Luque. He lives with his mother in the Ykaa neighborhood of the same city. He works as a household plumber. For example, he does things like install pipes in the kitchen, bathroom, sinks; and he does general repairs. He also does all types of construction jobs. He used his last loan to by sanitary items and other accessories to finish a job. He has worked with the Paraguaya Foundation since 2008, and he has a good history of payment. Rafael is grateful for the help offered by the Foundation. With this help he was also able to buy tools to facilitate his work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy plumbing items and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Wcsl Makama/mabanta Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the WCSL Makama/Mabanta Primary Schools. These schools, WCSL Makama and WCSL Mabanta, were established by the Wesleyan Church of Sierra Leone. Since both schools from the villages of Mabanta and Makama operate on the same payroll, they have merged to seek a loan from Kiva through SMT.

Teachers from these institutions, like many other teachers within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Fifty-four-year-old Solomon S. K. (right) is the head master at the school. He was born in a village called Rogbin. He is married with 3 children, 2 of whom are in Junior Secondary Schools II (JSS II) while the eldest is in a Teachers' Training College pursuing a Higher Teachers’ Certificate. With his share of the loan, he will buy house-building materials to complete the house-building project he has started.

loans.use: Buy house-building materials

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 49-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Mahmoud has been selling fruits and vegetables since 2003. He sells oranges, apples, tangerines, lemons, iceberg lettuce, cucumbers, tomatoes, radishes and more, depending on the season. Mahmoud decided on doing his business because he wanted to improve his family’s business. His family has been working as farmers. Therefore, he decided to open his fruits and vegetables shop in order to sell the things his family produces. This is the first time he has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. With his loan, he intends to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell from other farmers so that he can increase and diversify his sales. His clients are people from his region, but mainly his friends and neighbors. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his work and his income.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Linus

texts.en:
Linus M. is a businessman who makes and sells bricks within the community where he lives. He started his business in 1998 after he finished his studies as a source of income. He is 38 years old and married with four (4) children living with him in Nambale Busia District. This is where he also does his business.

Linus wants to increase his brick production. That will enable him to achieve his goal of going large scale to be able to attain a profit that will ensure him economic sustainability and a better future for his family. To do this, he requires a loan of Ksh.10,000 that he will be repaying. He will save the profits generated from his business.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita B., 40, is from the village of Balatacan Bonifacio. She is married with five school-aged children. Jovita operates a store selling seafood including fish and shrimp. She has been in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Jovita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from GDMPC and is now requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Jovita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's school fees. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Mrs. Rima B. is a resident of Sainbu-Bhashipati which is located in Lalitpur district. It is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in agriculture.

Mrs. Rima B. lives with her husband and one son. Her husband, Mr. Rajendra, is in the Nepal army and her son is studying in pre-primary school.

Mrs. B. started her goat-raising business three years ago to help her husband financially. Now she has five goats. She buys baby goats and sells them in the local market after four to five months. This business helps her to improve the economic conditions of her family.

Now, Mrs. B. is requesting an Rs 30,000 loan to buy ten more baby goats for her business. She will also use the loan to buy feed for her goats.

loans.use: To buy ten baby goats and goat feed

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce en détail des articles scolaires, comme la rentrée du troisième trimestre est proche, elle voudrait gonfler son stock d’articles scolaires pour mieux vendre c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de règles, bics, cahiers et autres. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman has an income-generating retail business involving school supplies.  Since the third trimester will be starting soon, she would like to expand her inventory of school supplies in order to have better sales.  This why she's requesting a loan from WAGES for buying rulers, pens, notebooks, and more.  She is married and the mother of three children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying school supplies

loans.name: Loda

texts.en:
Poverty has inspired Loda to continue her studies in college until she graduates and earns her degree. She is 26 years of age now and married to a 40-year-old security guard at one of the offices in town. Loda’s marriage union has blessed her with two sweet and loving children, ages three and seven years old. Though Loda’s husband supports her and her children financially, the woman still wants to be productive in her own way to support her own education and the needs of her children. Her husband’s income is yet too small to support things her family needs to be able to experience life beyond poverty.

When Loda joined ASHI in 2003, she requested a loan to start a “sari-sari” (variety) store, selling inventories of foodstuffs, beverages and other basic commodities for people in their village to purchase conveniently. Frequently her business can't be sustained and she has had to periodically shut it down. The loans she has received have been a great help in restoring her business. Despite those circumstances, Loda makes sure that she maintains an excellent repayment record with ASHI and attends the weekly ASHI center meetings. Assisted by her husband in fulfilling her responsibilities to ASHI, Loda is now requesting a loan to improve her business and to fully achieve her dream of making it sustainable and profitable to be able to support her needs in her studies as well as the needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase a larger volume of grocery items and other basic commodities for her store inventories.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn N. is from the village of Research Minante in Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 59 years old. Evelyn is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a general store where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Evelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 33000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Evelyn's fifth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Uuganchimeg

texts.en:
Uuganchimeg T., age 39, lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Currently, she lives in a house with her family and parents near Narantuul market which is close to her workplace.

Uuganchimeg has been selling Korean secondhand mattresses, bedding and linen since 2006. She is a modest, silent and responsible woman. She says, “When summer comes, tourist camps, resorts and hotels need bedding and linen so the sale of goods improves. I am thinking of saving revenue to repair my fence and build a house in Gachuurt Horoo, Bayanzurh district.”

Uuganchimeg is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more second hand goods at a wholesale price to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia, de 54 años, vive en su casa, que es propia en compañía de sus 4 jóvenes hijos.Desde hace 7 años, empezó a fabricar billeteras artesanalmente, y sus hijos aun  pequeños le ayudaban en lo que podían. Hoy en día, uno de sus hijos diseña, el otro remacha y graba los dibujos a las billeteras y  ella es la  costurera oficial, que termina con el acabado de cada una de las billeteras, es así que trabajan en conjunto. Y cuando le realizan grandes pedidos, todos se esfuerzan para la entrega oportuna. Uno de sus hijos, es el encargado de guardar los diversos modelos que realizan, para mostrarlos a sus nuevos  compradores. Sus clientes asiduos, son los comerciantes informales, que semanalmente acuden a su casa para solicitar mas  pedidos, porque las billeteras que realiza son de buena calidad. Para mas adelante tiene planeado ampliar su negocio de fabricación de billeteras, además de construir su casa.Es el  doceavo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente como hasta hoy, además esta muy satisfecha de trabajar con los integrantes de su grupo comunal, porque son muy responsables en el pago de sus cuotas.Alicia tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de cueros y telas, para continuar trabajando en la confección de billeteras, pues desea  continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Alicia is 54 years old and lives in her own home with her four teenage children. Seven years ago, she began making handcrafted wallets and even her children helped out in whatever way they could. Today one of her children is responsible for making the designs, another secures the studs and etches the designs, and she handles the sewing and making the finishing touches to each of the wallets. Whenever they receive large orders, they must work together and strive to deliver on time. One of her children is in charge of maintaining samples of what they have created in order to show to new buyers. Her regular customers are informal merchants who come to her home on a weekly basis to place more orders because the wallets she produces are of good quality. In order to stay ahead, she plans to expand her wallet manufacturing business as well as build a house.

This is her twelfth loan with MFP. She commits to submitting her loan payments on time, like she does today. Alicia is very satisfied with the work of the members of her Communal Bank because they are responsible with their payments. She plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of leather and fabrics so that she can continue manufacturing wallets and making progress.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase leather & fabric

loans.name: Jose Abraham

texts.es: José es de 63 años de edad es casado, tiene siete hijos cuatro varones y tres mujeres, cinco de ellos ya no dependen de él, junto con su esposa tienen establecido un negocio de venta de papas fritas y atol de arroz con leche es su localidad, sus ventas lo realizan todos los días por las tardes, durante el día presta sus servicio como albañil, juntos han sacado adelante su familia, solicita su segundo préstamo para incrementar su capital de trabajo, el crédito anterior lo cancelo puntualmente.
texts.en:
José, 63, is married and has seven children, four boys and three girls. Five of them no longer depend on him. With his wife he has set up a fried potato and atol de arroz (a drink made with rice and sugar) business in their location. They are open for business every evening. During the day he works as a bricklayer. Together they have succeeded in raising their family. He is asking for his 2nd loan to increase his working capital. He repaid his previous loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda Y. is from the village of San Pablo, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 42 years old. Brenda is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Brenda raises pigs for fattening and sale. Brenda has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Brenda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Brenda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Brenda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby pigs

loans.name: Seiylkan's Group

texts.en:
Seiylkan S. is the leader of the group. She is 47 and married. She has raised three sons and two daughters; her two older sons and first daughter study at university and the other children are at school. Seiylkan is engaged in cattle breeding and her husband works as a taxi driver; when he is free he helps his wife with her work. Seiylkan started to breed cattle two years ago with an initial investment of 15,000 soms. With that money she purchased two bulls and resold them at a higher price (23,000 soms) after fattening them. With money received from the loan, Seiylkan wants to purchase farm animals to increase the number of cattle. In the future she wants to improve her living conditions and give her children a good education.

Gulbaira K., 48, is married. She has a son and a daughter; the son is a private entrepreneur and the daughter is of preschool age (under 7). Gulbaira and her husband are engaged in cattle breeding; they started this activity two years ago with an initial investment of 20,000 soms. They bought a cow and then after a month that cow was resold at the higher price (30,000 soms). With money received from the loan, Gulbaira wants to purchase cattle for breeding and some part of the loan she will spend to purchase hay.

Guljan I., 54, is married. Her husband works as a teacher at school and Guljan is engaged in livestock breeding. She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase farm animals in order to increase the number of livestock. In the future she wants to improve her living conditions.

Roza M. is the treasurer of the group.  She is 45 and married. She has two sons and a daughter; the first son studies at university, the second is at school and the daughter is of preschool age (under 7). Roza is engaged in cattle breeding and her husband works as an electrician. In 2009, Roza bought a bull for 8,000 soms and then, after fattening it, resold it for 11,000 soms. And since then she has been breeding cattle. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase farm animals in order to increase the number of cattle. In the future, she wants to expand her business activity and provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase farm animals.

loans.name: Nimecio Walter

texts.es: Nimecio se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno cuya producción de leche lo vende a Pil Andina (Planta industrializadota  de leche), vive junto a su   esposa y sus hijos  los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar. Es su primer  crédito en Impro y el primero vía Kiva. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de ganado vacuno.
texts.en:
Nimecio raises dairy cows. He sells their production to Pil Andina (an industrialized milk plant). He lives with his wife and children. The children are school age. This is his first loan with Impro and his first through Kiva. He will use the requested loan to buy a dairy cow.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna M. is 55 years old and a widow. She is from the village of Calamagui within San Pablo municipality, a part of Isabela province on the Luzon islands. Edna raises pigs to fatten and sell. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3500 PHP whenever she sells one of her pigs.

In 2009 Edna joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI which she used to purchase piglets to raise and sell in the future. Edna is requesting a new loan, her fourth from ASKI, of 8000 PHP that will be used to purchase more piglets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Justo Santos

texts.es:
Justo tiene 52 años, es casado, y tiene un hijo menor de edad, vive en el Pueblo Joven Garces, una zona urbano marginal que pertenece al distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, el distrito más grande de la región, es también el distrito con mayores índices de probreza. Actualmente es una comunidad  grande ya que con el paso de los años su poblacion ha ido incrementándose y de igual manera su movimiento comercial.

Justo trabaja como chofer en una empresa de transportes de la zona, encargada de transporte de pasajeros y también de transporte de encomiendas. El ya tiene más de dos años de antigüedad en este trabajo y gracias a el ha podido sacar adelante a su familia.

Actualmente Justo necesita realizar algunas mejoras en la vivienda donde reside ya que esta esta sufriendo algunos daños y las personas que residen en ella no pueden vivir cómodamente. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Justo es una persona bastante trabajadora y que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a su familia. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y los ha cancelado de un modo puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Justo is 52 years old.  He is married, has one young son, and lives in Pueblo Joven Garces, a marginal urban zone, belonging to the José Leonardo Ortiz district, the largest in the region.  It’s also the district with the highest incidents of poverty.  It is currently a large community, and its population and commercial state have been growing over the years.

Justo works as a driver for a transportation company in the zone.  He transports passengers and runs errands.  He’s been doing this work for two years and thanks to it, he’s been able to get ahead with his family.

Now Justo needs to make some improvements to his home.  Because it’s in need of repair, they cannot live comfortably in it, so he has seen fit to request a loan of 2,000 PEN ($725) through Edpyme Alternativa (E.A.).  Justo is very hard working and always gives his best to get his family ahead.  He’s had previous loans through E.A. and has repaid them responsibly and punctually.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Mireille Clarisse

texts.fr: G. Mireille Clarisse est née en Décembre 1983 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à OUSSOUKPEVI Rodrigue, Mireille Clarisse n’a pas encore d’enfant. Mireille Clarisse s’est installée depuis une dizaine d’année au quartier Sènadé à Cotonou, où elle vit avec son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les dépenses du foyer. Mireille Clarisse a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Depuis près de sept ans, Mireille Clarisse vend des céréales (maïs, riz, haricot) et des divers (biscuits, bombons, sucre, lait, etc.) dans sa boutique size à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Mireille Clarisse vend des cartes de recharges téléphoniques. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Mireille Clarisse achète ses produits.  Mireille Clarisse a déjà bénéficié une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé et a bien effectué le remboursement. Face à la demande un peu plus importante de sa clientèle, Mireille Clarisse sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un second prêt, en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: Mireille Clarisse G. was born in December of 1983 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Married to Rodrigue Oussoukpevi, Mireille Clarisse does not yet have a child.  Mireille Clarisse settled in the Sènadé neighborhood in Cotounou about twelve years ago, where she now lives with her husband.  The couple works together to secure the household expenses.  Mireille Clarisse quit school at the secondary level.  For nearly seven years, Mireille Clarisse has sold cereals (cornmeal, rice, beans) and various foodstuffs (cookies, candy, sugar, milk, etc.) in a small shop next to her home.  She also sells rechargeable telephone cards.  It is in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, that Mireille Clarisse purchases her products.  Mireille Clarisse has already benefited once from a loan from ALIDé and repaid it in full.  In the face of greater needs of her clientele, Mireille Clarisse is asking for a second loan from ALIDé, looking to enhance the quality of her business and better satisfy her clientele.

loans.use: Buying sacks of cereals and various food items (cookies, candy, etc.)

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro vive en casa propia cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad Chijipina Chico. El es productor lechero y su esposa le colabora en todas las actividades agrícolas. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención.
Pedro y su esposa tienen dos hijos. 
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de una vaca lechera. Esto le permitirá aumentar su producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro y el análisis socio-económico indican que Pedro es sujeto de crédito.
texts.en:
Pedro lives in his own home in the Chijipina Chico community.  He is a dairy producer and his wife works with him in all his farming activities.  It is the main source of income for himself, his wife and his two children.

This loan will be used to buy a dairy cow.  This will allow Pedro to increase his milk production and improve his income.

This is his first loan from Impro and our socio-economic analysis indicates that Pedro is suitable to receive a loan.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase his milk production

loans.name: Gualberta

texts.en:
Gualberta S. is from the village of Cebuano Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 56 years old. Gualberta is married and has 11 adult children. To make a living, Gualberta owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, biscuits, detergents, toothpaste, and junk foods in the local community. Gualberta has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gualberta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gualberta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Gualberta is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Gualberta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

location.town: Cebuano Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana T. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 56 years old. Marciana is married. To make a living, Marciana owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marciana also provides general alteration & tailoring services to her neighborhood. 

Marciana joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marciana has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Marciana is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase cloth and additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and additional products to sell

loans.name: Patricia Del Carmen

texts.es: Patricia del Carmen A. D. M. D. 29 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Guadalupe en el departamento D. San Vicente, en donD. vive junto a sus dos hijos D. 10 y 4 años D. edad. Patricia es una madre soltera, muy responsable, quien posee un depósito D. bebidas gaseosas, y jugos enlatados. DesD. hace 2 años que ella trabaja D. esta manera, lo cual le ha traído varios beneficios como trabajar al mismo tiempo que se dedica a su hogar, ya que el negocio esta ubicado en su casa D. habitación. Patricia desea mucho poder darles todo lo mejor a sus hijos, por esta razón solicita n préstamo a través del cual, tenga la capacidad económica D. invertir en el negocio comprando mayor cantidad D. sodas y jugos y D. esta forma atender a más clientes lo cual le permita contar con más ingresos.
texts.en:
Patricia del Carmen A. D. M., 29, lives in Guadalupe, San Vicente department, with her two children who are 10 and 4 years of age.  Patricia is a very responsible single mother who has a soft drink and canned fruit juices warehouse.  For the last two years she has worked like this creating several benefits such as working while tending to her home since the business is located in her home.

Patricia would very much like to proviD. all the best for her children and for this reason is asking for a loan that will give her the economic capacity to invest in the business buying larger amounts of soft drinks and juices so that she can take care of more customers thus leading to higher income.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and juices to sell.

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.en: Stephanie is a 52-year-old widow who has seven children. Three of her children are currently in school, and she makes a living selling local juice, rice, sugar, salt and cooking oil. She has been in this line of work for 29 years. Stephanie has applied for this loan to buy more products to sell to her customers. She will use the extra revenue made possible by this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila tiene 54 años D. edad, es casada, y resiD. junto a su esposo, hijos y una nieta en el distrito D. TambogranD., un distrito D. la provincia D. Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo D. frutas.

Se dedica a la venta D. productos naturales, a base D. plantas y vegetales en su propio domicilio. Ella por el conocimiento que posee sobre las bondades D. los productos D. la naturaleza tiene bastante clientela a quien orienta para la majora D. su salud. El negocio le permite ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento D. su economía diaria.  Asimismo su esposo se dedica a la venta D. productos D. abarrotes en un puesto en el mercado D. su localidad.

Lucila siempre se esfuerza para poder sacar adelante su negocio. Actualmente ella desea comprar más plantas y vegetales para realizar mayor cantidad D. preparados medicinales. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Lucila is 54 years old, married and lives with her spouse, children and granddaughter in the TambogranD. district, in the province and region of Piura. A region characterized by its inhabitants who mainly dedicate themselves to the cultivation of fruit.

From her home she sells natural products that are plant and vegetable based. Because of the knowledge that she possesses about the benefits of her natural products, she has a wiD. customer base who she can help to improve their health. The business allows her to help her family sustain their daily needs. Her husband sells groceries from a stall in a city market.

Lucila always strives to be able to keep her business going forward. These days she wishes to buy more plants and vegetables to have a larger quantity of herbal remedies. Because of this, she thinks it's advisable to request a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: The purchase of inputs to make herbal remedies.

loans.name: Donato Alberto

texts.es:
Trabajar como independiente siempre ha sido el sueño de Donato Alberto M., quien a sus 53 años de edad espera convertirse en un microempresario exitoso. Actualmente este campesino además de trabajar en diferentes labores en el campo, desde hace un año inició con la venta de pescado en la que ve una oportunidad para salir adelante y contribuir con el progreso de sus 3 hijos. 

Caminar largas jornadas para llevarle a sus clientes el pescado que trae desde un municipio de Antioquia-Colombia es uno de los sacrificios que debe realizar Donato para lograr vender su producto. 

Actualmente este emprendedor necesita de un préstamo para comprar más variedad de pescado y así aumentar sus ventas. A futuro Donato no sólo espera comprar una moto sino tener su propio local donde pueda ofrecer su pescado.
texts.en:
Working independently has always been the dream of Donato Alberto M.. He is 53 years old and wants to become a successful small businessman. At the moment, Donato is a field laborer who performs different jobs on a farm. He started selling fish a year ago because he saw an opportunity to get ahead and contribute toward the progress of his three children.

Donato must walk many hours to bring his customers fish from the municipality of Antioquia, Colombia. This is one of the sacrifices he must make in order to sell his product.

This entrepreneur is in current need of a loan in order to buy a wider variety of fish so that he can increase his sales. In the future, Donato hopes to buy a motorcycle as well as open his own shop where he can sell fish.

loans.use: Purchase a wider variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Carola

texts.es: Carola tiene 44 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 15 años tiene su tienda de abarrotes, instalada en su misma casa, y en donde sus hijos la apoyan en la atención hacía los clientes, mientras realiza compras de más productos al por mayor para implementar su establecimiento. Siempre mantiene abierto su tienda, de esa manera no deja de vender, además proporciona pan y otros productos que el cliente necesita para el desayuno, ya que una panadería se encuentra muy lejos, así que se levanta muy temprano a conseguir este producto. Por tal razón dese continuar adelante por lo que su deseo es mejorar su tienda abasteciéndola de más productos. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para implementar más su tienda, en esta ocasión como esta cerca las fechas de inicio escolar se abastecerán de mercadería en útiles escolares.
texts.en:
Carola is 44 years old and lives with her 3 children in her own home.  She has owned a grocery store, which is located in her home, for more than 15 years.  Her children support her by serving her customers while she goes to buy more products wholesale with which to stock her store.  Carola's store is always open which means she never stops selling.  She also provides her customers with bread and other products that they for their breakfast since the nearest bakery is quite far away.  She gets up very early to acquire these products.  Carola would like to continue to make progress in her business.  She would like to improve her store, stocking it with more products.

This is Carola's first loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She likes being a member of her community bank because the members are responsible people and very supportive of each other.  Carola thanks those who will help fund her loan since it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest the loan she is requesting in stocking her store some more.  On this occasion, as the back-to-school season is approaching, she will stock her store with school supplies.

loans.use: To buy more products, including school supplies for the back-to-school season

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La Sra. Blanca C. es de la ciudad de Carapegua – compañía Cerrito, tiene 40 años, es madre soltera, cuenta con casa propia y tiene 2 hijos; un hijo de 15 años y una hija de 8 años. 
La Sra. Blanca se dedica al comercio de ropas en forma ambulante(macatera) hace más de 5 años; aprendió este trabajo desde muy joven tejiendo frazadas en su domicilio para otras personas quienes llevaban a vender sus productos; viendo la necesidad de contar con un ingreso mejor decidió dedicarse a la venta por otras ciudades.
Fue así que empezó a trabajar como macatera y hoy día cuenta con más de 50 clientes activos contando con un ingreso semanal considerable.
Solicita el préstamo para compra de ropas, su posterior venta y obtener así un mayor ingreso.
texts.en:
Sra. Blanca C. is from the neighborhood of Cerrito in the city of Carapgeua. She is 40 years old, lives in her own home, and has two children: a 15 year old son and an 8 year old daughter.

Sra. Blanca has been selling clothes as a traveling merchant for more than five years. She learned this trade as a young woman by producing woven blankets from her home along with other people who sold these products. Since she needed to earn a better income, Blanca decided to sell in other cities.

She started working as a traveling saleswoman and today she has more than fifty regular customers. Blanca is able to generate a considerable weekly income. She is requesting a loan to buy clothes for subsequent resale so that she generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase blankets, trousers, shirts, blouses, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy American rice, Nicaraguan rice, beans, charcoal, white ivory soap, La Lechera milk, flour, Nido-brand formula and chicken

loans.name: Carlos Vidal

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Carlos Vidal; el tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también se dedica al transporte, el tiene un mototaxi que hace servicio público en el distrito de Urcos y la tienda de abarrotes atiende su esposa, el socio saca adelante a sus hijos por medio de estos pequeños negocios, el socio quiere mejorar los negocios. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes y para el mantenimiento de su mototaxi.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Carlos Vidal, 32, is a member of the “LAS AMISTOSAS” (The Friendly Ones) communal bank located in Urcos District which belongs to Quispicanchis Province, Cusco Department.

He has a spouse and three children.  He alternates his daily chores with running a grocery store; he also provides transportation.  He has a mototaxi that he uses to provide public transportation services in Urcos district while his wife tends to the grocery store.  He supports his children through these two small businesses.  He wants to improve the businesses and is asking for a loan to buy stock items for the store and to service his mototaxi.  He is happy about the loan and committed to making his payments.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his grocery store and to service his mototaxi.

loans.name: Areej

texts.en:
Areej is a 22-year-old lady who lives in a rented house. At first she was trying to think of a way to help in paying the rent so, a year ago, she started a small home business using her artistic skills and creative ideas.

Areej was known for her skill at working with straw, so she started making straw baskets and beautiful frames and selling them. She also does flower organizing for speciA. occasions.

Doing that for a year made her want more success, so now she is applying for a loan to help her expand her business and have her own shop in the future.

loans.use: To help her expand her business and have her own shop in the future.

loans.name: Enkhsaikhan

texts.en:
Enkhsaikhan B., 37, is taxi driver and he has been in this business for five years. He lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His youngest child is 8 months old and his wife is looking after the baby at the moment. They are planning to build a family house next year. 

The taxi business is the only source of the family's living. Therefore, the condition of the family car, which he uses in his taxi business, is important to the family. 

Enkhsaikhan is asking for a loan to buy some spare parts and to do proper auto service to his car.

loans.use: To buy some spare parts and to do proper auto service to his family car, which he uses in his taxi business.

loans.name: Socorro Auxiliadora

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA SOCORRO AUXILIADORA, ELLA TRABAJA COMO INSPECTORA DE HIGIENE TIENE DIEZ AÑOS DE EJERCER ESE OFICIO, ES MADRE DOLTERA DE UN NIÑO Y ESTE SE ENCUENTRA EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
ELLA VISITA NUESTRA OFICINA DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: ZINC, PERLINES Y PINTURA PARA REPARAR EL TECHO DE SU CASA DE HABITACION.
ESTE ES EL CRDITO NUMERO ONCE QUE SOLICITA  CON CEPRODEL, TODO ESTO PARA DARLES UNA MEJOR CONDICION DE VIDA A SU FMAILIA.
texts.en:
Socorro Auxiliadora works as a Health Inspector.  She’s been in this job for ten years.  She’s a single mother of a little boy who is school aged.  She visits Ceprodel’s office to ask for a loan to buy building materials and supplies like zinc metal sheeting, purlines and paint to repair her roof.

This is loan #11 that she requests from Ceprodel.  All of this is in order to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.es:
Juan, es un agricultor, vive con su familia conformada por su madre y hermanos, él es soltero y el negocio de la agricultura nace por iniciativa propia, no tiene un horario fijo para desarrollar las actividades que le demanda la agricultura.
Actualmente necesita comprar los insumos para la nueva siembra, por lo que solicita un préstamo para adquirir abono, insecticidas y preparación del terreno, esta compra le permitirá contar con lo necesario para trabajar, aunque siempre se corre el riesgo por la época de invierno, el cual puede afectar o beneficiar al cultivo.
Para Juan el objetivo es tener siembras grandes, con una producción abundante, sin perdidas por el clima, y con el apoyo de su familia, para poder superarse.
texts.en:
Juan is a farmer. He lives with his family,which consists of his mother and siblings. He is single and the farming business was started on his own inititative. He has no set schedule for the activities that the farming demands.  

At this time, he needs to buy materials for the new planting. He is asking for a loan to acquire fertilizer, insecticides and to prepare the soil. This purchase will allow him to have what he needs to work, although there is always risk in the winter season, which can either harm or benefit the crop.  

For Juan, the objective is to have big crops and abundant production, with no losses due to weather. With his family's support, he can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides,and to prepare the soil.

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is a married woman with one infant-aged child. She is 25 years old. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of products in the community. Sheryl has had this business for three years.

Sheryl is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods and other daily needs.

In the future, Sheryl hopes that she can maintain and improve her store so that she can provide the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods and other daily needs

loans.name: Carlos Guillermo

texts.es:
Carlos Guillermo tiene 36 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 7 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  SAGRADO CORAZON  se encuentra ubicada en el sector Cuatro Esquinas perteneciente al cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 12 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y a la comercialización de los mismos y otras actividades que da utilidades.

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura siembra papas, trigo, maíz en tierras propias, ademas tiene 4 cabezas de ganado. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos y alimento para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafios como es la Fiebre Aftosa en el ganado. Su sueño es comprar una casa en el sector donde vive.

Le gusta hacer deporte y festejar las fiestas de navidad, fin de año, carnaval y San pedro.
texts.en:
Carlos Guillermo is 36 years old, married and lives with his wife and children in the hamlet of Guaranda in the provide of Bolívar. He has seven children. 

The members of the communal bank "Sagrado Corazón" [Sacred Heart] are located in the Cuatro Esquinas area belonging to the Guaranda hamlet, fifteen minutes away from the cooperative's office. This group is made up of 12 members who raise crops and livestock in commercial enterprises, as well as other income-producing activities.

Carlos earns a living in farming. He grows potatoes, wheat and corn on his own land. He also has four head of cattle. He does his purchasing in the Guaranda market and his selling in the wholesale market of the same city. He is seeking the loan to purchase supplies for growing his crops and feed for his animals. With the support of the loan he would be financially helped to supply his needs. He faces challenges such as foot and mouth disease in his cattle. His dream is to buy a house in the area where he lives. 

He likes to play sports and celebrate the Christmas and New Year's holidays, as well as Carnaval and San Pedro's Day.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for growing crops and feed for his animals.

loans.name: William

texts.es: William, tiene la edad de 41 años, está casado y vive con su hijo y su esposa que son sus mayores prioridades. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos necesarios para la asistencia de su cafetal. El cuenta con un terreno apto para la explotación de este cultivo y ya sembrado por lo cual lo que el quiere realizar es la compra de los abonos y lo necesario para una mejor cantidad de producción esta próxima cosecha. el quiere generar ganancias para las necesidades de su familia y seguir creciendo como un caficultor de la zona. Es el segundo  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
William is 41 years old, married, and lives with his wife and child who are his highest priorities. He intends to use this loan to buy the necessary supplies for maintaining his coffee crop. William has a suitable plot of land for growing this type of crop. Since the planting is finished, he wants to buy compost because it is necessary for producing a large quantity for the next harvest. William wants to generate income so that he can provide for the needs of his family and continue growing as a local coffee producer.

This is the second loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. William has not had any other loans with the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies for maintaining his coffee crop.

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Mrs. Chum is 49 years old, living in Kompong Thom province of Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers .they have been growing vegetable and rice field since 1990. From planting, they could be earned $5 per day. So far they have eight children, one has already married and seven are singles. to help the family live in comfortable as other family in village, two children works as security guard in one company (Best company) and the other three children are working as local construction workers in Phnom Penh.Mrs.Chhum wanted to borrow $550 from Kiva loan to grow their rice field and to create a new business by buying pigs in order to raise for extra income. This loan is useful for their family because they can have enough money to do her job timely.

loans.use: to grow their rice field and raising pigs.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is from the village of La Paz Saguday. She and her husband work hard on the family farm. The couple have been blessed with three children.

Juliet request a loan amount of P21,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticide and payment for the labor cost of transplanting of crops for farming business. She hopes that she could be able to improve her rice farming business to be able to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticide and to pay for labor of transplanting of crops for her farming business

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is 53 years old and married. Her husband has a business selling clothes. He purchases clothes from the wholesale market and sells to his customers at reasonable rates through his shop, which is located in a nearby market. Parveen also supports her husband by selling clothes to her community clients. The income she earns helps her to pay utility bills and other household expenses. She doesn’t have any children so she spends her day operating her business and doing her household tasks. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s clothes-selling business. With the loan, he will buy a variety of clothes in bulk to put in his shop for selling to his customers. He is very experienced in his work and has been operating it for many years. Parveen is hopeful that an investment will bring even more profits to him. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Parveen.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Alejandro Petrofki

texts.es:
En  la ciudad de Managua el señor Alejandro  se dedica  a la labor de técnico catastral en una empresa de esta cuidad  dedicándose  a esta labor desde hace 11 años .es casado y con dos pequeño hijos a las que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen. 
Una de las necesidades que el señor atraviesa hoy en día es que debe mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda es por eso que ha tomado la sabia decisión  de iniciar la obra de mejora. es por este motivo que acude a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como zinc, , perlines .para iniciar la  mejora de la vivienda realizando el cambio de techo .por medio de esta obra brindara mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos y esposa .
Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta obra le proporciona a su familia un techo digno donde vivir y con todas las condiciones necesarias
texts.en:
Alejandro works in the city of Managua as a property assessor for a local firm in the city; he’s had this job for eleven years.  He’s married and has two small children that he has to provide the necessary conditions for growth and development to. One of the needs he’s currently going through is that he has to improve the condition of his house so he’s made the decision to start a home improvement project.  

Because of this, he’s calling on Ceprodel to request a loan to buy building materials and supplies like: zinc metal sheets and purlines to start improving the house by replacing the roof.  Through this work he will provide his children and his wife with better living conditions.  It’s important to point out that through this project he will provide his family with a decent home to live in with all the necessary conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies to replace the roof.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуда жительница города Вахдат. Ей 28 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Два года как занимается торговлей. У нее имеется торговая точка, где она продает детскую одежду. Кредит берет для приобретения сезонного товара.
texts.en: Mavluda lives in the town of Vahdat.  She is 28 years old, married and has two children.  She has a secondary education.  She has been involved in retail sales for two years.  Mavluda is requesting this loan for the purchase of seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai was born in 1971. She is married with two children. Her family lives in Ngoc Loi village. She is a carpenter. She has a workshop at home. She has been working at this business for three years with her husband’s help. They produce wood furniture. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2006. This is the sixth time she borrowed a loan from SEDA. In the last cycle, she borrowed 7,194,000 VND to expand her workshop and she repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,066,000 VND to buy wood to produce furniture.

loans.use: to buy wood to produce furniture.

loans.name: Ronel

texts.en:
Ronel is 22 years old, single, and lives in the Philippines.  He has a shop that sells bananas and firewood. He has had this business for two years. 

Ronel is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which he will use to buy bananas and firewood to sell.  Ronel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase bananas and firewood to sell

loans.name: Cordillera De Los Andes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORDILLERA DE LOS ANDES” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Cristina es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, compra y venta de ganado, tejido de mantas, carnicera de corderos, producción de canastas para flores.

La señora Cristina,  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora en zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de compra y venta de ganado que viene trabajando hace años atrás.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de ganado) que adquirirá de las ferias del área rural y posteriormente lo venderá en su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene once hijos.
texts.en:
The "Cordillera de los Andes" communal association will begin its first loan cycle with the Pro Mujer institution, through the Panamericana office.  It is made up of seven members, and is run by a board, of which Cristina is the president. 

The businesses that the members of communal association carry on are varied, and include: neighborhood store, buying and selling livestock, weaving shawls, lamb butchering, and making flower baskets. Cristina says this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer, and that she joined the institution at the invitation of the facilitator in the area.

Currently she has a business buying and selling livestock, that she has been doing for many years. The loan she will take out is for increasing her capital, by buying livestock that she will acquire at fairs in the rural area, and later sell in her community. This work will allow her to generate resources to support her family, as she is married and has eleven children.

loans.use: To buy livestock.

loans.name: Pos' Group

texts.en: Pos is 51 years old, married and has nine children. She has been farming on her land for 33 years to earn a living. She also raises pigs for additional income. She leads a group of two members. Pos is requesting a first loan with VisionFund. She wants to grow rice and buy pig feed. She hopes this loan will enable her to make more rice and feed her pigs to be healthy and fat to earn more income to feed her family and increase her savings to buy more piglets for the future.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Adjango

texts.fr:
Adjango est une femme âgé(e) de 32 ans. Elle est mariée å un  revendeur  avec 01 enfant âgé d’01an. Adjango travaille comme revendeuse de mèches et produits de beauté depuis  2009. Elle vend à ses clients à la maison après achat à Lomé.
Adjango a requis son second cycle de crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter des mèches, des produits de beauté et des articles scolaires.
Dans les prochaines années, Adjango voudrait augmenter son stock afin de mieux vendre pour ouvrir une boutique avec le bénéfice réalisé et  assurer l’éducation et le bien –être de la famille.
texts.en:
Adjango is a 32-year-old woman. She is married to a retailer with whom she has a 1-year-old child. Adjango has been working as a retailer of hair extensions and beauty supplies since 2009. She sells to her customers at home after buying her products in Lomé. 

Adjango requested her second loan cycle from WAGES in order to buy hair extensions, beauty products and school items. 

In the coming years, Adjango would like to increase her stock in order to increase sales and open a boutique with the earned profits/ She would also like to ensure the education and well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, beauty products and school items.

loans.name: John Paul

texts.en:
John Paul is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single with two children. 

John Paul has a computer shop that provides online games and internet. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy tools and pay for the electricity for his computer shop.

John Paul has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, John Paul hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the electricity for his computer shop.

loans.name: Duo Luz Divina Group

texts.es:
DUO LUZ DIVINA
Doña Elba Rosmery es una mujer trabajadora que cuenta con un pequeño  negocio de artesanías y venta de ropa típica, desde temprano ella se dedica a elaborar sus tejidos típicos para terminarlos lo antes posible y poder venderlos, en los días de mercado ella  sale a vender ropa típica, ya que es el único medio que tiene para poder apoyar a su familia, tiene bajo su responsabilidad a su dos hijos menores de edad que necesitan el cuidado y el apoyo de sus padres ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos, y tener mas ganancias. Doña María Susana es una persona trabajadora que quiere salir adelante, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a crianza de animales , desde hace años ella se ha dedicado a estas actividades para poder darles a sus hijos una vida mejor , ella necesita un capital para poder comprar mas materia prima para sus tejidos y mas concentrado a sus animales.
texts.en:
DUO LUZ DIVINA: 

Elba Rosmery is a hardworking woman who has a small business selling crafts and traditional clothing. Starting early in the day, she makes her traditional fabrics, so that she can to finish them as soon as possible and be able to sell them. 

On market days, she sells tradition clothing as it is the only means she has to support her family. She is responsible for her two children who are minors and who need the care and support of their parents. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase raw materials for making fabrics, and have more profits.

María Susana is a hard worker who wants to get ahead. She makes a living making traditional fabrics by hand and in animal husbandry. For years she has devoted herself to these businesses in order to give her children a better life. She needs capital in order to buy more raw materials for her fabrics and more feed for her animals

loans.use: to buy raw material for weaving.

loans.name: Eleele

texts.en:
Eleele is 44 years old, is married and has 7 children.

Eleele owns & operates a business venture planting & harvesting taro for sale. She has 3 years of experience in this business. Eleele needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Eleele joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Eleele's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: L’Œil De Dieu Group

texts.fr: Le groupe L’ŒIL DE DIEU est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Roberte Henriette, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Roberte Henriette est âgée de 53 ans et est une veuve. Roberte Henriette est mère de deux enfants dont un scolarisé et un reste à sa charge. Roberte Henriette a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Il y a douze ans, Roberte Henriette vend des conserves, des liqueurs et des condiments dans son quartier. Roberte Henriette achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin.  Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Roberte Henriette désire obtenir un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe L’ŒIL DE DIEU. Les trois premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group, L’oeil de Dieu, is composed of three persons who reside in the same area. The representative of the group, named Roberte Henriette, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. This is the fourth time that this group is seeking financial support from ALIDé in order to increase the level of their activity. 

Roberte Henriette is 53 years old  and widowed. She is the mother of two children, one of them still in school and her dependent.She left school at secondary level. She has been selling canned goods, alcohol and condiments in her neighborhood for the last twelve years. She buys her products in a market in Benin. 

In order to increase her stock and to better meet her customers demand, Roberte Henriette, together with the other members of L’oeil de Dieu, would like to get a fourth loan from ALIDé. The first three loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of canned goods, alcohol and condiments.

loans.name: Soem

texts.en:
Mrs. Soem is a resident of Prey Chor district. She is 49 years old and is a single mother of five children. Agriculture is the sole source of her income. She typically generates an average of 3 USD per day. In order to support the family, three of her children work as garment factory workers in Phnom Penh city and send a part of their salaries home monthly to help their mother.
  
With the loan of 600 USD, Mrs. Soem will pay for rented farmland, on which she grows rice and various kinds of vegetables throughout the year. Mrs. Soem hopes that she’ll be able to own a piece of farmland herself.

loans.use: to pay for rented farmland

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is 48 years old and married with one child. For the past seven years she has had a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Noemi has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. She has requested a loan of 17,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of food for her shop. With her profits she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of food for her shop.

loans.name: Benard's Group

texts.en:
Benard, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing his group, formed by six farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. He joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to gain leadership skills. He is married and has two children.

With a portion of this loan, Benard will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of his loan means that now he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. Benard plans to use the profits he gains this year to send his children to school.

In total, Benard’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 2.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Banati's Group

texts.en:
The lady standing to the left hand side of the photograph is Banati.She is an enterprising and industrious lady who hails from a remote village of Koraput district,Odisha,India. Three years ago when her husband passed away, Banati was devastated.But with time she gained her confidence and took all the responsibility of her family on her shoulders. She currently has a family of four and is the sole earner of her family.She works hard in order to meet the ends of her family and provide a comfortable living to them.Banati is engaged in making incense sticks from last three years.She does this work from home s that she can balance her work as well as her house in an equal manner.However,due to lack of funds she is unable to increase her volume of production as per the customer's order.

Banati along with her group member is requesting for a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum 
She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase,ether,wooden sticks,scented powder,glue and packaging materials in bulk. The loan amount will ultimately help Banati to increase her volume of production and thus increase her income and enjoy a relatively higher standard of living.

Banati is in dire need of your kind help.
