This is the fifth loan for Clovis from HOFOKAM and he intends to use the loan proceeds to buy cattle and local brew for selling at a margin.

loans.use: To buy cattle and local brew for selling at a margin

loans.name: Molleccato Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "MOLLECCATO"; la socia vive en el distrito de Urcos y provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Paulino: ella tiene 35 años de edad ella es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos;  la socia se dedica a la venta de comidas caseras en la plaza central de Urcos, ella tiene un stand de venta de comidas típicas de la zona. Ella tiene este negocio desde el año 2006, la socia desea incrementar sus ventas para lo cual ella solicita capital para comprar los insumos y también platos y cubiertos para su negocio ambulatorio. La socia solicita le préstamo para comprar insumos y cubiertos para su negocio.

Los socios se dedican a la crianza de animales menores, la venta de comida, al transporte (triciclos) llevar carga pesada a los mercados y otros lugares; a la venta de productos secos, obrero.
La socia agradece el préstamo que se le otorgará y se compromete a seguir trabajando con mucho ahincó para cumplir con los pagos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
This partner is s member of the Molleccato community bank. She  lives in the Urcos district in the Quispicanchis province, deparment of Cusco. The partner is 35 year old Paulina, who is in a common-law marriage and has 3 children. She makes a living selling home-made food in the central plaza of Urcos, where she has a stand selling typical food. She has had this business since 2006 and wishes to increase her sales. To that end she requests a loan to buy ingredients as well as plates and silverware for her business. 

The other partners make a living by raising small animals, selling food, transportation (tricycle), carrying heavy cargo to other places and markets, selling dry goods, and as a general laborers. This partners is thankful for the loan and is committed to keep working hard to makes her payments and improve her business.

loans.use: This partner requests a loan to buy ingredients and silverware for her business

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty S. is currently in the business of selling maize flour and cassava tubers at the market, and is requesting a loan to stock bags of beans and rice to sell. Betty is 23 years old and is married to a businessman. She has 2 children and only 1 child goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: Stock bags of beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy K. is a 28 year-old married woman with three children. She operates a green grocery which has been in existence for the past two years now. The business is situated at the airport in Malindi town. 

Nancy was introduced to KADET LIMITED by another client of the company, and this will be her third loan from the company. The loan is KES 40,000, and she plans to use it to add stock to her grocery as well as repair the business structure. 

Nancy wishes to use the anticipated profit from the business to continue expanding the business and purchase more stock. Her dream is to see her family healthy and make sure her children are well-educated.

loans.use: to sustain and grow the client's grocery business

loans.name: Sarvinaz

texts.ru:
Sarvinaz H. 58 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 3 detey kotoriye uchatsya v universitete. Ona yavlyayestay IDP personom , pereselenec iz Zengilan i seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste s semyoy.

Servinaz seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye dlya toqo chtobi pomestit bolshe novix tovarov. Ona uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji produktov.
texts.en:
Sarvinaz H. is 58 years old. She is married and has three children who go to the university.  She is an internally displaced person and has been relocated from Zengilan and now lives in the Absheron region together with her family.  

Sarvinaz needs 2000 AZN to expand the space of her store to house more new merchandise.  She has been in the business of selling groceries for seven years.

loans.use: To expand the store space

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.en:
Sylvie is 30 years old and married with two children who are 4 and 7 years old. She also takes care of two relatives who are 11 and 14 years old.  Sylvie is a self-employed businesswoman selling a variety of goods, as her photo indicates. Those goods include water and juice. Her shop is open from 6am to 6pm every day and she has had this business for three years.

Sylvie has now requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her shop by purchasing a large quantity of water and juice.  With this large quantity, she will also start wholesaling. In doing so, she hopes to earn more profits, which will allow her to renovate her house, continue to pay school fees for her two relatives and build a secure future for her two children.

loans.use: To purchase a large stock of water and juice

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives in Jaranwala which is a small city of Punjab Pakistan which is famous for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a 2 room brick house with her family. 

She is married to M. M. who is 43 years old and is a daily wage labor. 

Razia has given birth to 2 sons and 4 daughters. She couldn’t provide them education facilities due to poor financial conditions. Her eldest son operates a donkey cart and offers loading services to his clients. He contributes the family financially through the earning. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who also wants to buy a donkey cart and start loading business because his profession doesn’t return with good income and in result his family suffers from financial aspect.  

Razia is hopeful that through the loan investment her husband will be able to approach many clients and makes better profits from his new business. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she has established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Razia”.

loans.use: To buy a donkey cart for starting a loading business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita R. N. y su esposo desde hace 23 años se dedican al negocio sobre ruedas, en este momento su mayor afición es a la venta de ropa usada, zapatos y accesorios para el hogar. Este negocio es su única fuente de ingresos es por ello que desean invertir mas en el para seguir prosperando. Margarita se ven en la necesidad de pedir un préstamo para comprar ropa de temporada ya que en Diciembre tuvo muchas ventas.
texts.en: For the past 23 years, Margarita R. N. and her husband have had a business on wheels.  Right now, their main passion is selling used clothes, shoes and household products.  This business is their only source of income and they would like to invest in it so that it continues to prosper.  Margarita needs to request a loan so that she can buy seasonal clothing since she made a lot of sales in December.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Martha Mariela

texts.es:
Martha de 34 años, es originaria de Pueblo Nuevo municipio  de Estelí, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, estudio secretariado ejecutivo, tiene una mini tienda donde vende ropa y cosméticos la cual  tiene 7 años de funcionar. Comenzó a trabajar en este negocio con ayuda de su  esposo que trabaja como conductor de autobuses públicos. Al principio vendía  mercadería ambulante de casa en casa con el tiempo, hizo un préstamo y logro poner su mini tienda la cual tiene dentro de su propia casa, solamente ha tenido este negocio, la experiencia de saber este negocio la heredo de sus padres quienes han tenido este tipo de negocios y le han enseñado a ella como administrarlo bien. 
El crédito lo solicita para comprar productos nuevos como repuestos de vehículos y hacer mejoras a su vivienda. Este crédito le ayudara a mejorar y acondicionar mejor su negocio y vivienda, para poder ofrecer mejores  productos atraer mas clientes y darles un techo digno donde vivan sus hijos.
Tiene como planes ampliar sus negocio donde también pueda vender zapatos al por mayor, comprar vitrinas para mantenerlas surtida de nuevos productos.
texts.en:
Martha is 34 years old and from Pueblo Nuevo, in the town of Estelí.  She is married and has 3 children.  Martha studied to be a business secretary.  She owns a small store where she sells clothes and cosmetics.  She has owned her business for 7 years.  Martha started working in this business with the help of her husband who works as a bus driver.  At first, she sold her merchandise door to door but she took a loan and managed to set up a small store in her own home.  This is the only business she has owned.  She inherited the experience she needed for this business from her parents who also owned this type of business and they taught her to run it well. 

Martha is requesting this loan to buy new products such as vehicle spare parts and to make some improvements to her home.  This loan will help her to improve and better adapt her home and business so that she can offer better products, attract more customers and provide her children with a decent home in which to live.  Her plans are to expand her business so that she can also sell shoes wholesale, to buy display cases and to keep her store stocked with new products.

loans.use: To buy new products such as vehicle spare parts and to make improvements to her home

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en: Vicenta is a 51-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a restaurant. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her restaurant business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,000. Vicenta is borrowing PHP 24,500 to purchase raw materials. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 24,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Vicenta aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. Este cantón es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, por la variedad de su fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora que en su mayoría se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Lucia, ella tiene 47 de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 14 y 8 años de edad que estudian en colegio y escuela. Ella tiene su casa propia en la que vive con sus hijos.

Trabaja de empleada pública en el cuerpo de bomberos 24 de mayo y además se desenvuelve como comerciante, vende ropa, principalmente ropa interior, sobrecamas y toallas. Su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y a esto le ayudan su hija y sus hermanas. Trabaja cuatro  días por las noches y los fines de semana todo el día,  sus productos los deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Su mercadería compra en  Guayaquil. Nos cuenta que lleva diez años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar sabanas y ropa interior para estudiantes que están por iniciar las clases. Está en el Banco Comunal de diez años y le gusta por la ayuda y por la forma de trabajar de la institución. Sus sueños son tener un gran local y ser empresaria.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” (Mother for a Better Future) meets every fifteen days in the May 24th Canton in the Manabí Province. This canton is known for its beautiful landscapes, its forests, and the variety of plant life. The people are friendly and hardworking. Most of them engage in agriculture and livestock breeding.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Lucia. She is 47 years old and a single mother of two children (ages 14 and 8) who are high school and elementary school students respectively. Lucia has her own home where she lives with her children.

Lucia is a public employee who works at the May 24th Fire Station and also has a retail business. She sells clothing (primarily undergarments), bedspreads, and towels. Lucia sells door-to-door and also has the help of her daughter and her sisters. She works in the evenings four days per week and all day on the weekends. Lucia offers her products on credit and collects payments every eight days. Her merchandise is acquired in Guayaquil. She says that she has been in business for ten years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy bedding and children’s undergarments since students are starting their classes. Lucia has been with the Communal Bank for ten years and enjoys the assistance and the organization’s method of working. Her dreams are to have a large store and become a businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase undergarments and bed sheets.

loans.name: Esmeralda Yaneth

texts.es:
Esmeralda, es una joven de 19 años de edad, reside en Delicias de Concepción departamento de Morazán, está soltera y vive con su madre y hermana. Ella se dedica a vender tortillas, aprendió por su madre desde muy pequeña, pero tiene su propio negocio hace 2 años.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, que es su materia prima en la ejecución de su venta, esta compra será una gran ayuda, pues el maíz es el principal para que ella pueda preparar las tortillas y disponerse a vender.
Su aspiración es estabilizar sus ingresos, para algún día casarse y formar su propio hogar con casa propia.
texts.en:
Esmeralda, 19, lives in Delicias de Concepción, Morazán Department.  She’s single living with her mother and her sister.  She sells tortillas.  She learned from her mother when she was very little but she’s had her own business for the last two years.

She is asking for a loan to buy corn since it’s the raw material for her sales.  This purchase will be of great help to her because corn is the main thing she needs to make the tortillas she intends to sell.  Her hope is to stabilize her income so that she can marry someday and form her own home in a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is a 39-year-old widow who has two children who are 14 and two years old. Her oldest child completed high school but was not financially able to go on to college. Vestine makes a living by selling bananas and a beverage that is popular locally which is called Ubushera. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and has made enough money to feed her family. She is applying for a loan to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy bananas and a beverage made out of sorghum called Ubushera.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda P. is from the village of Anakan, Gingoog City. She is 60 years old. Melinda is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Melinda owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling firewood in the local community. Melinda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Melinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melinda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stocks of firewood. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Melinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of firewood.

loans.name: Sop Mohamed Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Mohamed est créé depuis le 28 mars 2008, il fait partie du Banc Villageois Artillerie 2; il est composé de 15 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce. 

La responsable Khady est âgée de 34 ans, elle est mariée et a 5 enfants en charge.Elle est à l'extrême droite sur la photo en boubou couleur orange rouge avec un châle blanc sur les épaules. Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de fruits selon la période (oranges, mangues, melons etc......)elle fait parallèlement de l'aviculture.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter des poussins et des fruits pour renforcer ses activités.

Elle son mari dans les dépenses familiales et la santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The Sop Mohamed solidarity group was created on March 28, 2008; it belongs to the Artillerie 2 'Banc Villageois' (loan group). It is composed of 15 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main activity is retail.

Khady, the leader, is 34 years old. She is married and has five dependent children. She is all the way to the right on the picture, in a red-orange bubu with a white shawl on her shoulders. She manages a small business retailing seasonal fruits (oranges, mangoes, melons, etc......). In parallel, she raises poultry.

Her new loan will allow her to purchase chicks and fruits to strengthen her activities.

She helps her husband with family expenses and children's healthcare.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal fruits for retail.

loans.name: Las Estrellitas De Carabayllo Group

texts.es: La señora Meri Carmen F., integra el Grupo "Las Estrellitas D. Carabayllo",  Meri Carmen, tiene 27 años D. edad es soltera y tiene un hijo desD. joven siempre le ha gustado trabajar para ayudar a su familia, actualmente se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza (cosmeticos).  Inicio en este negocio por intermedio D. una vecina que le vendia a ella y la animo para que pueda vender. Su deseo adorado como toda madre es poder ver a su hijo profesional pero a la vez ella desea poder tener una zapateria en donD. pueda vender diversidad D. calzados.  El prestamo lo invirtio para la compra D. productos D. belleza y stockearse ya que viene campaña por el dia del padre.
texts.en: Meri is 27 years old, single, and has one son. She's enjoyed working from a young age to help her family. At the moment, she works selling beauty products. She got into the business through a neighbor, who sold to her and encouraged her to begin selling. Like every mother, her fondest wish is to see her son grow up to be successful, but she'd also like to have a shoe store where she could sell all kinds of shoes. She is using this loan to purchase beauty products and restock, since she'll be selling more for Father's Day.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Ramir

texts.en:
Ramir is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Ramir provides motorela or habal-habal (transportation) services. He has had this business for eight years. He has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed for the maintenance of the service.

Ramir has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Ramir hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle service.

loans.name: Takalani Group

texts.en:
Tholakele is 47 years old and single with four children between 2 and 17 years old. Three of the children attend school.  Her other source of income is the government’s child support grant. In the photo above, she is standing in the middle of her group with her hand raised.

She’s been in this business for three years and sells skirts, shirts, shoes, trousers, and underwear in Hlabisa, South Africa. She requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to sell more clothing from her home and at pension pay points. 

The main challenge to her business is that customers buy on credit and fail to pay on time. In five years time, she would like to have a formal place for her business. The extra income from this loan will help her extend her house and send her children to school.

She appreciates WDB and KIVA and hopes that they will help others as well.

loans.use: to buy skirts, shirts, shoes, trousers and underwear

loans.name: Sa Em

texts.en:
Sa em (in the photo) and her husband, Khoeun, live in a village along National Road Number four, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons and one daughter-two are in school and other two are still young. 

Sa em is a garment worker, while her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for another loan of $1,200 to fill-up the land around her house. Because the house where she lives is low than her neighboring houses, so when raining season come the water flooded which is difficult for family members to stay.

loans.use: To fill up the land around her house with more soil

loans.name: Maria Florence

texts.en:
Maria Florence is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Maria Florence has a retail shop that sells beauty & clothing products from AVON. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional stocks from AVON & NATASHA.

Maria Florence is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Maria Florence hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional  stock from AVON & NATASHA.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has three children. 

Adel has been an owner of an automotive workshop since 2004. He fixes and repairs all cars’ electrical problems.  He has good experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2,200 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his workshop and to purchase a generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his workshop and to purchase a generator.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah  lives in  Uganda.  She is single and has 2 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (mother).
   
Sarah has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 5 years and she works 6 days out of every week.  Sarah sells her products from home, by means of retail.  Sarah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.     

She also generates additional income through selling piped water.  The main business challenges for Sarah include increased prices of charcoal and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to be a wholesaler and to build and own her own house.  Sarah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Johanna Del Carmen

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de la comarca las mercedes jurisdicción de Quezalguaque, actualmente se desempeña como maestra de secundaria en el Instituto Rubén Darío de la misma localidad, atendiendo 2 turnos diurno y dominical, su núcleo familiar se compone por 4 persona ella, su esposo y  2 hijos, los que estudian en los colegios de la misma localidad, esta señora ha sido cliente de la empresa desde el año 2008, actualmente está solicitando es crédito numero 3 este ultimo atraves del convenio firmado de financiamiento con dicho instituto, ya que los mismos le han ayudado a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
This customer is originally from the Las Mercedes area of Quezalguaque. She is currently a high school teacher at Instituto Rubén Darío in the same town, working two shifts: daily and Sundays. Her family is made up of four people: herself, her husband and two children who go to school in the same town.

This lady has been a customer of the company since 2008. Now she is asking for loan number three through the financing agreement she signed with the institute since these loans have helped her improve her living conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: to improve an annex by buying blocks, cement, sand and paying for labor.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
This is Marivic, 32, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Ramil, a graphic artist, and is mother to her only child. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Marivic operates an LPG business. What she basically does is buy liquefied petroleum gas tanks from wholesalers and sells them per tank with a little profit. LPG tanks can range from small to regular size tanks. Aside from this, she also retails electronic cellphone loads (prepaid cellphone credits) and offers direct selling products. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 41,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stock of LPG tanks to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marivic dreams of having other branches someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of products needed in her business

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
A caring lady, Rani manages her household chores by staying at home. She takes care of her family by cooking good food. Her husband gifted her a sewing machine, which she uses to sew clothes for her neighboring clients. She operates it when she gets free from her household work. She loves to do good for her family.   

Rani has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who has a furniture polisher business.  With the loan, he will buy polish and brushes to provide better quality services to his customers and increase his profits.  He is an experienced businessman and has been operating his business for many years. Rani is confident that an investment will take his business to a more profitable position. 

This is Rani's 2nd loan application to Asasah. In her previous loan year, she paid installments regularly without any problem. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rani.

loans.use: to buy polish and brushes

loans.name: Aly

texts.en:
Aly is 42 years old and has been engaged in a hog-fattening business for 18 years. Within these years of operating this occupation, she often experiences a lack of the feeds that are fed to her pigs. This causes her to ask for a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy feeds and vitamins. She wants her pigs to be healthy and nourished in order to sell them for a higher price.

She is aiming to save enough money for the educational purposes of her four children. She trained well in this occupation and yet, she feels difficulty, especially when she lacks money to finance the needs of her pigs. Thus, borrowing working capital is a big contribution to her as a hardworking woman.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Helen Maria

texts.es:
Hellen es una mujer luchadora, tiene 45 años y vive con su familia, en una comunidad del distrito de Hatillo que es una zona urbana y residencial, sin embargo es objeto de una creciente actividad comercial, concentrada principalmente en los centros comerciales. Se ha ubicado gran cantidad de mueblerías, tortillerías, panaderías, librerías, talleres mecánicos y automotrices, gasolineras, dentisterías, farmacias, consultorios médicos, bares, restaurantes, tiendas e imprentas.

En este momento está pasando por una situación económica difícil, ya que es madre soltera. Y las entradas de dinero que tiene, no son suficientes para financiar la carrera de su hija.

Es por eso que Hellen está solicitando un crédito de 450,000.00 (cuatrocientos cincuenta mil colones), para cancelar el pago del cuatrimestre  de la carrera universitaria de su hija y finalizar el pago de una computadora. Ya que tienen sus expectativas familiares en ella para asi tener un futuro  y una vida mejor.

Hellen es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Hatillo, una de las 110 empresas de crédito comunal de EDESA en Costa Rica. Es su segundo préstamo con la Empresa y da muchas gracias por toda ayuda que le han brindado.
texts.en:
Helen is a determined woman. She is 45 years old and lives with her family in a community in the District of Hatillo, which is a urban and residential area. However, there is increasing commercial activity that is mainly concentrated in the business centers. Several types of businesses are located in those areas such as furniture shops, tortilla factories, bakeries, bookstores, auto repair and mechanic shops, gas stations, dental offices, pharmacies, health clinics, bars, restaurants, stores, and print shops.

At the moment, Helen is going through a difficult financial situation since she is a single mother. With the limited access to income that she has, there is not enough money to finance her daughter’s degree.

For this reason, Helen is requesting a loan of 450,000 CRC so that she can pay for a semester of her daughter’s university degree and to finalize the payment of a computer. There are expectations being placed on her daughter by family members so that she can have a future and a better life.

Helen is a member of the Communal Credit Enterprise of Hatillo, one of the 110 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This is her second loan with the organization and she is grateful for all of the help that has been provided.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university expenses and to buy a computer.

loans.name: Kamket S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Kamket S.H.G Group in Western Kenya! Joseph is the facilitator of Kamket S.H.G group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Joseph takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season,Joseph had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,Joseph was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joseph and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Joseph will educate his children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Kamket S.H.G group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Bertha Camila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TETE CACA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bertha Camila; ella tiene 62 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de refrigerios como sandwichs, hamburguesas, gaseosas y galletas, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de refrigerios. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar los refrigerios como carne, pollo y panes al por mayor.    
                                                                                
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Señor de Tete Caca communal bank, located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member, Bertha Camila, is 62 years old and married with four children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling refreshments such as sandwiches, hamburgers, sodas, and cookies.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  By means of this job she gets her children ahead.  She wants to expand her business selling refreshments.

Bertha Camila is requesting the loan to buy ingredients such as meat, chicken, and bread wholesale, to make her refreshments.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making the payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, chicken, and bread wholesale, to make refreshments.

loans.name: Zenaidah

texts.en:
Zenaidah is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Zenaidah has a shop that sells electronic phone loads from several networks such as GLOBE and SMART.  She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy stocks of electronic phone loads to sell.

Zenaidah has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Zenaidah hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of electronic phone loads to sell.

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es:
Diana pertenece al banco comunal “Choquequirao” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y sus reuniones con sus compañeras del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Cusco de la provincia de Cusco del departamento del Cusco. 

Diana tiene 22 años de edad y  es soltera, ella nació en la ciudad Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas.  Diana trabaja en una entidad privada como operador radial de taxi. Ya son cuatro años que trabaja y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Diana y su hermano tienen un negocio familiar que consiste en la venta de artesanía de tipo platería. Diana en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para elaborar sus joyas. 

Diana agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Diana belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s Community Bank in the city of Cusco. The members hold monthly meetings in the city which is part of the province and department of the same name. 

Diana is 22 years old and single. She was born in Cusco and still lives and works there. She works for a private company as a taxi driver. It’s a job she’s held for the last four years and all is going well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. 

Diana and her brother run a family business selling crafts made of silver. She currently needs a loan to buy the materials necessary to make jewelry. She is grateful for this loan which will be very useful and promises to make the scheduled monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy the materials to make jewelry

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 35 years old and is married with one child. She has been engaged in the hog-raising business, primarily hogs for breeding. She describes herself as patient and industrious. 

Her business serves as a source of income for the family that helps her provide their daily needs. Now she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 (Philippine Pesos) to buy feed for raising her piglets. 

She wants to develop her business, earn a higher income, and save some of it for any future emergencies in her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for raising her piglets.

loans.name: Marcos Benedo

texts.es:
Marcos Benedo   tiene 30 años  estado civil actual Unión Libre, vive con la pareja  e  hijos. Vive en el Recinto Aguas frías de Mocache Cantón Mocache.

Ventanilla  EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas frías de Mocache, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Marcos Benedo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz en terrenos propios hace cinco años. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. Su sueño es comprar una casa.

Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres descansar.
texts.en:
Marcos Benedo is 30 years old and lives in a common-law relationship with his partner and children.  He lives in the area of Aguas Frías de Mocache, Mocache canton.  The El Progreso communal bank is located in the the Aguas Frías de Mocache area in Mocache canton.  This bank works in short-cycle agriculture growing corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Marcos Benedo has worked for five years in agriculture growing corn on his own land.  He buys his products in Mocache and sells them in the market in Mocache.

He requested the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and manure for the crops.  The loan has helped him increase his income for family use and invest in the planting.

His dream is to buy a house.  In his free time he very much enjoys resting.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and manure for the crops.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ru: Ахмад разводит скот в течении 30 лет, ему необходимо купить корм для своих коз. В настоящий момент холодно и корма для  скота очень мало. В его стадо  более 150 коз, половина дома, а остальные из них находятся в горах у пастуха до весны. Благодаря кредиту его скот будет находиться дома и он будет спокоен.
texts.en: Ahmad has been breeding livestock for 30 years.  He needs to purchase livestock feed for his goats.  Currently, it is cold, and there is very little fodder for livestock.  Ahmad's herd contains over 150 goats, half of which are at home, and the rest are in the mountains with a shepherd until spring.  Thanks to the loan, Ahmad's livestock will be at home, and he will be calm.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed for his goats

loans.name: Herminio

texts.en:
Herminio is married with three children. Herminio is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Herminio is operating a service-based business,providing transportation to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for five years and every month he earns 2,500 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

Herminio became a member of GDMPC in the year 2010. In the future, Herminio hopes to see his children finish their studies and to gain double income out from his business.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Gladys Ama

texts.en:
Gladys operates a chop bar, a local Ghanaian restaurant, in her village. She has had no formal education. She prepares and sells fufu which is made of cooked cassava and plantain which is pounded into smooth round balls. Fufu is served with groundnut soup, palm nut soup, or light soup, and fish or meat. She sells to individuals around Elmina. She has been involved in this business for many years. 

Gladys is married and has three children. The income from her business normally goes toward helping her husband pay their children’s school fees and utility bills. 

She has noticed that there is a growing demand among consumers for her food. She is unable to meet their needs due to limited working capital. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more cassava, plantains, palm nuts, groundnut paste, and other ingredients for the preparation of her food for sale. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Gladys wants to ensure that all her children will be given the opportunity for an education to further distance their family from poverty. Gladys is photographed here preparing her food.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava, plantains, palm nuts, groundnut paste, and other ingredients for the preparation of her food for sale.

loans.name: Srey Nang

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Srey Nang is aged 29 years and single. For the last nine years, she has been farming rice as primary source of family’s income to make a living and to supplement the income, she also works as a garment worker. She is able to earn about 30,000KHR per day and manage to save about KHR10,000 each day for the future needs. 

Srey Nang has never been with VisionFund before, now she is seeking a loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor’s fee in harvesting rice. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland to increase her rice farming production to make more rice to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Bahar Hasanova

texts.en: Bahar and his wife own a café in the Turkish quarter of Sliven, Bulgaria.  It is a modest spot, predominately offering drinks and simple foods, such as crepes, and a well-worn pool table.  The café seats up to 12 people.   In conjunction with the café, Bahar’s wife runs a business importing textiles from Turkey.  She makes the trip to Turkey monthly, bringing back predominately clothes, which she then sells in a corner of the café and a variety of local markets.  She typically makes the trip to Turkey on the night train with two of her three grown children for safety’s sake. The loan proceeds will fund two things: 1) working capital for the café and 2) inventory and transportation expenses for the clothing business.   As a historical aside, after the brutal Ottoman occupation of Bulgaria (15th century to late 19th century) the Turks who remained in Bulgaria for the most part either cloistered themselves or moved east to be again inside Ottoman lands.  10% of the Bulgarian population is of Turkish descent, and is often excluded from mainstream society due to their religion (Islam) and residual resentment many ethnic Bulgarians still feel against the Turks, nearly 150 years later.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Cratis

texts.en:
Cratis has been selling soft drinks in her neigborhood for 5 years. She recently began to sell beer, as well. With a small loan that she took out 5 years ago she was able to take out her refrigerator and sell her soft drinks. She also sell school supplies since there is a school closeby.

She tends to the business from 3 pm to 11 pm every day. She has additional income because she is raising 3 of her sister’s children; her sister has been in Spain for 5 years. Thanks to her earnings she has been able to make improvements to her house, which is made of cane.

She wants the loan to buy cases of cola and beer; she also wants to buy school supplies and continue selling those.

Cratis was born in Esmerelda. She is 43 years old with 4 sons, all of whom still depend on her. Her husband abandoned her 15 years ago. She is a woman who since she left her hometown at the age of 14 began to work in houses. To this day she has not stopped working; she has fought so that her children would eat every day. She is proud of having been able to buy her own house, which took an enormous effort. Her aspiration is that her business grows and her 15 year old niece joins her in the business, since she is a single mother.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Cratis lleva 5 años vendiendo colas en su sector. Últimamente comenzó a vender cervezas también. Con un pequeño crédito que saco hace 5 años pudo sacar su nevera y vender sus colas. Ella también vende útiles escolares ya que una escuela esta en la esquina de su casa. El negocio lo atiende a partir de las 3:00 PM hasta 11:00 PM todos los días. Ella tiene otros ingresos porque esta criando 3 sobrinos porque su hermana esta en España desde hace 5 años. Gracias a los ingresos generados ella ha podido hacer mejoras en la casa que es de caña. Ella desea el préstamo para comprar jabas de colas y cervezas, también desea comprar útiles escolares y seguir vendiendo. Cratis nació en Esmeralda. Tiene 43 años. Con 4 hijos, y todavía están a su cargo. Su esposo la abandono desde hace 15 años. Ella es una mujer que desde que salió de su tierra a la edad de 14 años comenzó a trabajar en casa. Hasta ahora no dejado de hacerlo, ha luchado para que sus hijos puedan tener el sustento diario. Se siente orgullosa de haber podido tener su casa que le ha costado con mucho esfuerzo. Su aspiración es que su negocio crezca y que su sobrina de 15 años se involucre en el negocio ya que es madre soltera.

loans.use: Buy cases of soft drinks and school supplies

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en: Khiev N. sells perfume at the local market in Phnom Penh.  Her husband works as an officer in Parliament, and earns $4/day.  They have two children that work as electricians to help support their family.  This loan will be used for purchasing perfume to sell at both the market and in her neighborhood.  In the future, she hopes to build her own store selling perfume near her home so she can spend more time with her family and friends.

loans.use: To purchase perfume for sale at the market

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino is a self-employed driver and has a 1974 van that he uses to complete moves, transporting construction material and all other types of jobs he is hired for. He works in the city of El Alto and this business is his main source of income his used to support his wife and his son, who goes to school at the state University. He lives in the zone Rio Seco El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase a motor and tires for his van. This is the second loan he has applied for from Impro, and his timely repayments of his first loan make him a good candidate for a second, enabling him to continue working as a professional driver with his van.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Marcelino es chofer de transporte libre y tiene una camioneta modelo 1974 que le sirve de herramienta de trabajo con la cual realiza mudanzas, carga material de construcción a las obras, lleva todo tipo de carga en la Ciudad de El Alto y se constituye en su fuente de ingreso con que mantiene a su esposa y su hijo que estudia en la universidad estatal. Vive en la Zona de Rió Seco El Alto. El destino del crédito es para la compra de motor y llantas para la camioneta. Es el segundo crédito que solicita de IMPRO; el buen comportamiento de pago del anterior le faculta para solicitar otro préstamo, para continuar trabajando con su camioneta.

loans.use: Maintenence of his vehicle.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey S. is 27 years old and lives in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To earn income for her family, she runs a small grocery store at home earning around $5 each day. She and her husband have two children who are too young to attend school. Her husband (pictured here) works in his farmland growing rice and a variety of vegetables. These products enable him to earn on average $2.50 each day. 
Mrs. Srey S. is humbly requesting a loan to increase her grocery store inventory to meet her clients’ needs. She feels optimistic that the loan that will improve her business venture.

loans.use: To increase a number of her grocery products to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy various more articles

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. is from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 34 years old, married and has four (4) children. She has a chemist's shop where she sells drugs. She has been a LAPO member for over 5 years. She has been in business for some years now. She is requesting a loan of US$800 to buy more drugs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for sale

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Basilia is a woman of 53 years and she and her four children, who are 29, 20, 18 and 15 years old, support her family.

Basilia has two businesses that are located in the new market in the city of Warnes. In one of the stalls she sells chickens and in the other she sells salteñas (a type of empanada), empanadas, refreshments and other products.

She has over 12 years of business experience, specifically in the sale of chickens and other food products.

She has some competition in both businesses because in the market there are people that also offer the same or similar products, but Basilia has the advantage that with her 12 years of experience she has a fixed clientele.

The prices of her products vary in both of her businesses and she is requesting this loan to repay a debt.

Her loan history is good.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Basilia es una señora de 53 años de edad, su familia se encuentra compuesta por ella y sus cuatro hijos que tienen 29, 20, 18 y 15 años respectivamente.

Basilia tiene dos negocios que se encuentran ubicados en el mercado nuevo de la ciudad de Warnes, en uno de los puestos vende pollos y en el otro puesto vende salteñas, empanadas, refrescos y otros.

Tiene una experiencia de más de 12 años en el rubro del comercio, especificamente en la venta de pollos y otros productos alimenticios.

Su competencia es media en ambas actividades debido a que en el mercado hay personas que también ofrecen productos iguales o similares, pero la ventaja de Basilia es que al tener 12 años de experiencia cuenta con clientela fija.

Los precios de sus productos son variables en ambos comercios, la solicitud del crédito es para la devolución de un anticrético.

Sus antecedentes crediticios son muy buenos.

loans.use: Debt repayal

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She sells food items in the market of Kabala town in Sierra Leone. Although the business has helped Asma generate income for the family, she could not save for expansion and for emergencies because the business is too small to generate sufficient income.

Asma would like to expand and diversify the business. She is requesting a loan of $525.

loans.use: Diversify her business by adding more items to sell

loans.name: Longuino

texts.es:
Thanks for the first loan. With your help, I was able to buy the woodworking machine I needed. With the loan I am currently requesting, I am going to buy the materials needed for carpentry, thus allowing me to finish the orders I have pending due to lack of lumber. I am requesting a loan of $1,200.00 USD in order to buy carpentry materials.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Gracias por el primer crédito, con ustedes pude comprar la maquina que me estaba haciendo falta. En este otro crédito solicito un préstamo para la compra de materia prima y así terminar los pedidos que tengo pendientes por falta de madera. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la comprar de materia prima para la carpintería

loans.use: Purchase of carpentry materials

loans.name: Abdul Qaoum

texts.en: Abdul Qaoum lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has two young kids. He has a bakery; they work together. He has good experience in his work and  he has also a good number of customers. He needs a loan to expand his small business so he has requested an individual loan to complete his inventory and make a good monthly income to help his family. He is happy with this process of loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand his small bakery

loans.name: Las Marias Group

texts.en:
Antonia and her husband live in the small eastern town of Samana, where they raised five children (ages: 20, 21, 30, 32, 34). This will be her 6th loan with Esperanza, and over the past 3 years her business has grown significantly. She now runs a good sized grocery store in her community, and plans to buy more beans, pasta, salsa, and laundry detergent to increase her selection and stock. In her free time, Antonia enjoys spending time with her husband, praying, fishing, and watching her grandchildren grow up.

Esperanza wants to thank you for your continued support, and we hope that you will enjoy watching this group continue to grow. God Bless!

loans.use: Restock grocery store and expand inventory

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en: Aziz lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with two sons.  He is uneducated; he works in agriculture and has good experience in the business. He has plenty of land for cultivation. He has requested an individual loan to complete his stock so he can increase his benefit from his land and help his family.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Ngen

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngen N. is a villager in Tei Buon Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She works in a brick making factory, while her husband, Mr. Sath Sem, works as a horse-cart driver. Her husband's business is in trouble because his horse died. In order to re-start Mr. Sath Sem's business, Mrs. Ngen N. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a horse for her husband's business.

Mrs. Ngen N. is a 39 year old mother of five: two are working as horse-cart drivers; two are enrolled in school; while the youngest is too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Ngen N. obtained a loan to buy a horse for her childrens' business. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy a horse for her husband business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Ms. Alicia A. de Ochoa works in food sales located between La Sucre and Colon. She lives in a house in Anticretico in the neighborhood Miraflores. She is a single mother and she has two little granddaughters who are in her care since her mother passed and they counted on her as their only support. She also has a second job as a teacher. She is a punctual client and is very dedicated to her granddaughters.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

LA SEÑORA ALICIA A. DE OCHOA TRABAJA CON EL SERVICIO VENTA DE COMIDA UBICADO ENTRE LA SUCRE Y COLÓN VIVE EN UNA CASA EN ANTICRETICO EN LA ZONA DE MIRAFLORES ELLA ES MADRE SOLA Y TIENE DOS NIETITAS QUE ESTAN A SU CARGO YA QUE SU MADRE FALLECIO Y SOLO CUENTAN CONE ELLA COMO SU UNICO APOLLO, ADEMAS ELLA PRESENTA UNA SEGUNDA ACTIVIDAD ES PROFESORA ES UNA CLIENTE PUNTUAL Y MUY DEDICADA A SUS NIETAS

loans.use: To buy food to attract clients

loans.name: Kadia

texts.fr:
Madame Kadia  koné a 41 ans,  mère de 5 enfants (2 garçons, 3 filles), et vit avec son mari et ses  enfants dans une famille monogamique à Hamdallaye un des quartiers de la préfecture de Koutiala (Région   de Sikasso  République  du Mali.).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école elle s’est très tôt  initiée aux activités génératrices de revenus pour finalement choisir d’évoluer dans l’achat vente des habits et des pagnes wax(un tissu très prisé en Afrique de l’ ouest) depuis maintenant  20 ans.
Après avoir obtenu 5 prêts solidaires (prêts de groupe) avec une association de son quartier elle est à son troisième prêt individuel avec Soro Yiriwaso.Tous les prets précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elle s’approvisionne mensuellement auprès des commerçants grossistes du grand marché de Bamako (capitale de la République  du Mali)  et souvent sur place à Koutiala.. Elle effectue ses  ventes dans la ville de koutiala d’une facon ambulante (articles dans une tasse), au marché sous un hangar et dans les foires hebdomadaires   des villages environnants de koutiala à crédit ou au comptant très généralement en détail.  
Elle compte acheter avec ce pret 100 pièces de pagnes wax ,une douzaine d’habits pour enfants et espère réaliser un benefice de 120.000FCFA.
En raison de sa notoriété dans le domaine de la vente des habits, Madame Kadia Koné envisage d’ouvrir une boutique d’habillements et  d’articles divers pour femmes au grand marché de Koutiala.  Ainsi elle pourra elle même voyager au Pays Bas  pour faire des achats.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kadia Koné, 41, is the mother of 5 children (2 boys and 3 girls) and lives with her husband and her children in a monogamous family in Hamdallaye, a neighborhood in the Prefecture of Koutiala (Sikasso Region, Republic of Mali).

Not having had the good fortune to attend school, she began early on to be active in various money-earning ventures but finally, some 20 years ago, she settled on buying and re-selling clothing and high-quality "pagnes" (a batik-like cloth very much appreciated in West Africa.)

After having obtained a share in 5 group loans with an association in her neighborhood, she is now on her third individual loan with Soro Yiriwaso. All the preceding loans have been reimbursed correctly.

Mrs. Koné does her purchasing monthly from wholesalers at the big market in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali) and often locally in Koutiala. She sells her wares in the town of Koutiala going house to house (with her wares in a basin on her head), or in a stall in the market and in the weekly fairs of the villages surrounding Koutiala, for credit or cash, generally retail.

She intends to use this loan to buy 100 lengths of high-quality "pagnes" and 12 outfits for children, and she hopes to make a profit of 120,000 F CFA. Since she is well-known in the field of clothing sales, Mrs. Koné dreams of opening a store where she would sell clothing and various other items for ladies in the big market of Koutiala. Thus she might be able to travel to Holland herself to do her buying.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of high-quality "pagnes" for re-sale

loans.name: Paoline

texts.fr: Dame H. Paoline est née le 20 octobre 1980. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant âgé de 4 ans. Elle achète des mèches synthétiques au NIGERIA , qu'elle vient vendre dans son salon de coiffure à ses clientes afin de leur faciliter le déplacement et la rapidité dans son travail. Du fait de  l'approche des fêtes de fin d'année et compte tenu de la demande de ses clientes l'année précédente, elle s'est rapprochée de ALIDé afin de bénéficier d'un prêt pour faire face à aux demandes de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born on October 20, 1980, Paoline H. is married and the mother of a 4-year-old child. She buys synthetic hair extensions in Nigeria and brings them back to sell to clients in her hair salon. In order to avoid making the trip, permitting her to work faster, in anticipation of the approaching year-end holidays, she has approached Alidé for a loan based on last year's customer demand to meet the needs of her clientele.

Translated from French by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two cases of synthetic hair extensions

loans.name: Marvin José

texts.es:
Marvin habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua, que se llama Villa Reconciliación, es casado y tiene dos hijos de 6 y 10 años de edad los cuales están estudiando. Su esposa es ama de casa cuida a sus hijos y esta pendiente del hogar y también de la pulpería que junto a Marvin tienen.

Como le gusta la música también canta en un bar que se llama Chinchilla que es bien frecuentado ya que su ambiente es muy agradable. El levantó la pulpería con fondos propios y con pequeños ahorros de su esposa ya que ella siempre lo ha apoyado para que Marvin pueda lograr sus objetivos. Con la solicitud del préstamo es para comprar inventario en la compra de granos básicos para ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de productos. A futuro es poder agrandar más el negocio de su pulpería y poder ofertar más los productos y de esta manera lograr más clientela.
texts.en:
Marvin lives in a neighborhood of Managua called Villa Reconciliacion. He is married with two children of ages 6 and 10, both of who are students. His wife is a housewife who takes care of the children and is dedicated to the home and their small market. Because he likes music also, he sings in a bar called Chinchilla, a great place to go because of the pleasant environment. He started a market with his own money and the small savings of his wife. She has always supported Marvin so that he could achieve his goals. The purpose of this loan is to purchase inventory such as whole grains in order to offer his customers a variety of products. In the future, he would like to be able to grow his business and to be able to offer more products. In this way, he will obtain more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase whole grains

loans.name: Elie Salimosse

texts.fr: Elie B. agé de 37 ans est marié et pére de famille.Depuis six mois il a ouvert un restaurant fast food qu 'il gére avec son ami dans un quartier de Mbour .Avec le pret sollicité il va renforcer ses activités en diversifiant le menus et elargir l' espace en de l' ouverture de la saison touristique.
texts.en:
Elie B. is 37 years old, married, and a father with a family. Six months ago, he opened a fast-food restaurant that he manages with his friend in the Mbour district. With the requested loan, he is going to bolster his business by diversifying the menu and expanding the space for the opening of tourist season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mujeres Al Progreso Group

texts.en:
Fidelina M. is a single mother of 3 kids living in an extremely poor area in the Dominican Republic. Each day is a battle to feed her children, and she has no chance of saving and getting ahead. She came to Esperanza International in this situation and wanting to change her life. She took out a small loan and started a small business selling clothing in her area. She would travel to a far city to purchase clothes very cheap, then return to sell them in her area. She did well with her small business, and was able to make all her payments and feed her children.

She is now hoping to receive a second and bigger loan, with which she feels like she can create an even bigger business. She hopes to have her own store someday, and to make enough to send all her children to a good school. She said she feels happy for the first time in a long time, and feels like she can be a good provider for her children. She loves them so much and only wants to give them a comfortable life. She now has the means to do that, and she is going to continue to keep growing and generating more money. She has something of her own, and something that gives her a purpose and a drive. She is so excited about this next loan, and excited about this opportunity she is receiving!

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Edith Gerelda

texts.es:
La señora Edith Gerelda Z. Ucañán tiene 34 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Emprendedoras II y vive en la calle La Mar 649 del Puerto Marítimo de Salaverry en la provincia de Trujillo, en el departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa e hizo cursos de alta costura, se casó y tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella.
Su negocio consiste en venta de pescado en el mercado Los Luchadores, en sus horas libres, arregla vestidos, faldas, etc. También hace manualidades.
Su primer crédito fue de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas que los invirtió en su negocio de pescado.
Con este crédito de 500 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas invertirá en pescado.
Edith sueña con tener su casa y un negocio en la misma, para poder estar más tiempo con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Edith Gerelda Z. Ucañán is 34 years old and belongs to the “Enterprising Women II” cooperative bank. She lives in the Trujillo province, located in La Libertad, Perú. She completed secondary school and took courses in advanced sewing. She then married and has two children who now live on their own. Her business consists of selling seafood at the Los Luchadores market. In her free time, she tailors dresses, skirts, etc., and also makes handmade items. She invested her first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles, which she repaid in four installments, into her seafood business. With this loan of 500.00 Peruvian soles, to be repaid in four installments, she will buy fish. Edith dreams of owning her own home where she can locate her business, and of spending more time with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her seafood business.

loans.name: Ajara

texts.en:
Ajara F. is a 45-year-old mother of two girls and four boys, some of whom have completed senior high school, while the three youngest attend junior high. She lives with the family in Offinso, a commercial/farming town in the Ashanti Region of Ghana, where her husband is a cassava and plantain farmer.

For the past three years Ajara has owned a provisions shop that sells groceries such as milk, milo, sugar, and biscuits, and she also vends vegetables from a table top in front of her shop, her customers being community members who otherwise must walk all the way to the market to purchase produce.

Ajara buys some of her goods, especially the vegetables, from the small towns nearby, but travels to the bigger towns to procure her groceries. If granted, her loan will enable her to increase the quantity of goods that she buys on each excursion, thereby reducing the frequency of her trips and allowing her to sell to more people in her neighborhood and even beyond.

Ajara wants to save more money to help her husband put up a house of their own.

loans.use: To procure more provisions for her store.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Antonio tiene 40 años de edad, está casado con la señora María Taboada y no tienen hijos.
Antonio emigró de la ciudad de Caaguazú a la ciudad de Itá en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida, empezó a trabajar desde muy joven vendiendo carbón a negocios y particulares, con el tiempo fueron aumentando sus clientes y por ende sus ingresos familiares. Decidió montar una despensa en su domicilio y dejarla a cargo de su esposa, el negocio dió excelentes resultados. 

Hoy dia surte a sus vecinos y antiguos clientes de carne, azúcar, bebidas en general y otros insumos de primera necesidad además de carbón, el mismo solicita el préstamo para la compra de dichas mercaderías.
texts.en:
Antonio is 40 years old, married to María Taboada, and they have no children. Antonio emigrated from the city of Caaguazú to Itá searching for a better quality of life. He started working at a very young age selling coal to businesses and individuals. In time, they increased their customer base and, as a result, the family’s income. He decided to open a store in his home and leave his wife in charge of tending to the business, which has produced excellent results. Currently, he supplies his neighbors and established customers with meats, sugar, beverages, and other daily use goods in addition to coal. He himself is requesting a loan to purchase said merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Generally, to purchase meats, beverages and coal.

loans.name: Adith

texts.es:
La señora Adith C. L. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amistad y Paz”, vive en el Jr. Juanjuicillo S/Nº, Distrito de Juanjui, departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 56 años y es madre de 2 hijos, los dos mayores de edad, que ya no dependen de ella. 

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 motivada por su hija y con el apoyo de su esposo emprendieron su negocio. Tiene 06 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal. En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, que los ofrece a los moradoras de los pueblos aledaños. 

Con el préstamo de S/1,500.00 que cancelará en 06  meses, desea invertir comprando ropa usada en fardos, con variedades de tallas, con modelos para damas, caballeros y niños. 

Ambos; su esposo y ella, toman las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio, en lo personal, nos cuenta que también desea variar su negocio con el  sembrío de cacao (cosecha de cacao).

Adith manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adith C. L. belongs to the “Amistad y Paz” Community Bank. She lives on Jr. Juanjuicillo St. in the Juanjui District of the San Martín region. She is 56 years old, married and the mother of 2 children. Both children are adults and not dependents.

She started her business with her first loan for 300.00 PEN, motivated by her daughter and with the support of her husband. She has worked with the Community Bank for 6 years. She currently sells used clothing to the people from bordering towns. She will payback the loan of 1,500.00 PEN in 6 months. She would like to invest in bundles of used clothing in a variety of sizes and styles for women, men and children.

Both she and her husband make the decisions about the earnings from her business. Personally she tells us she would also like to vary her business by growing cocoa (cocoa crop).

Adith is grateful to the Manuela Ramos organization for allowing her to grow as a business owner and as a Woman.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchase of bundles of used clothing in a variety of sizes and styles for women, men and children.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca B., 31, is married and a mother of four children, two males and two females. All of her children are in school – junior high and the basic schools. Rebecca lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a mason by trade.

She works very hard to help her husband financially to provide for the family. Rebecca runs a grocery store in her community. She sells products such as tins of milk, sugar, bread, milo, etc. She has been in this business for two years and wants a loan to procure more goods. She hopes to sponsor all of her children to the tertiary level of education.

loans.use: To procure goods for a grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Capital for farm improvement

loans.name: Enhbayar

texts.en:
Enhbayar L. lives with his wife and three teenage children in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. All three children are high school students. Enhbayar has a small retail business selling secondhand shoes. His wife also works with him in his business. In 2000, Enhbayar started out by selling cheap secondhand shoes and clothes in the local market. He purchases secondhand clothing from the wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. When he travels to Ulaanbaatar, his wife sells clothes and shoes at the market from his stall. In the near future, Enhbayar hopes to expand his business by adding new high demand clothing items. Enhbayar and his wife's ultimate goals are to make sure that all their children receive a good education and pursue their dreams without financial strain.
He has requested a loan to purchase more secondhand clothes for his business.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand clothing for his business

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani P. is from the town of Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Lani is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lani owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, & toothpaste in the local community. Lani has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine Pesos (about US $85) a month for these activities.

In 2001, Lani joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lani has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lani is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase  additional stocks for her retail store. This loan will be the 18th loan taken out by Lani from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase  additional stocks for her retail store

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Coumba W. est une femme de 41 ans, mère de 7 enfants. Elle fait de la vente en gros d'arachide. ses revenus lui permettent d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Coumba W. is a 41-year-old woman and the mother of seven children. She sells peanuts wholesale. Her revenues enable her to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell peanuts in bulk

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa P., 23, is married with three children. She has many years of experience in her plantation business. She sells to the village people and public four days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~75 USD). She has no previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Luisa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers, weedkiller and knives

loans.name: Đồng Thị

texts.en:
Đồng Thị T. is a 43 year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, T. owns and operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling mattresses to local businesses and community members. T. has been engaged in this business for more than 14 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2003, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. T. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in renovating the business. The loan will be the seventh loan she has taken out from TYM Fund. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her operation.

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Mrs. Sokvorn Chhom Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokvorn C. is 27 years old and the mother of two children wH. are too young to work or study. The village bank which consists of eighteen members is located in Kampong Trea village in Kandal province. They plan to use the loan which they obtained in different purposes. Mrs. Sokvorn C. is the village bank president wH. has been selected by the members. She is a farmer wH. owns a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. In her vegetable growing she faces an obstacle because she does not have vegetable seeds for growing. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy vegetable seeds to grow on the field. Her husband, Mr. Nget Thy, is a driver for a garment factory. Mrs. Srey O. did not come to take a loan but her husband was, so he is presented in the picture instead. 

One member in this group loan is an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy vegetable seed to grow on the field.

loans.name: Mauricio Jovanis

texts.es: El señor Mauricio F. tiene 36 años de edad, vive en el municipio de villa del carmen del departamento de Managua, soltero, con casa propia, sus planes son mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda, de profesión electricista y  trabaja en la alcaldía de Villa del carmen desempeñándose en el aria de asistente de mantenimiento desde hace seis meses. Ha tenido falta de financiamiento para mejora su casa. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, zinc, piso. Su objetivo es obtener seguridad y protección a su familia. Da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible las mejoras de su vivienda ya que en día solo se puede construir mediante financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mauricio F. is 36 years old and lives in the municipality of Villa del Carmen, in the department of Managua. He is single and has his own house. His plans are to make improvements to the structure of his house. He is an electrician and for the past six months has worked in the mayor´s office in Villa del Carmen as a maintenance assistant. He has not had any money to pay for home improvements. Thanks to this loan from Afodenic he will be able to buy construction materials such as cement, zinc and flooring. His goal is to provide security and protection to his family. He thanks the institution for making it possible to make improvements to his house, as the only way to build is with financing.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for making home improvements.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita M. is from the village of Tipan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 65 years old. Rosita is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a business selling charcoal to local community members. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rosita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
