Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Max

texts.en:
Max F. is applying for a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5,000 as additional working capital for the maintenance of his duck raising business. He operates this busines in the village of San Juan Quezon, Isabela where his family also lives. At his age of 43, Max remains single and he has been very dedicated towards the development of his business. 

He hopes to improve his business and to give enough support towards the needs of his family, especially his parents. By working hard and with patience, Max believes that someday or somehow he can able to make himself successful with the continuous assistance of lenders to his business.

loans.use: Towards additional business capital.

loans.name: God Love You Group

texts.en:
God love You is a group of 5 borrowers led by Korto B.. Korto is 54 years old  and married. She has 2 children, aged 20 and 32 years old, their educational levels are 11th grade and a university graduate.
Korto is illiterate because she happens to be a victim of the belief that women don't need to be educated because they will be taken care of by their husbands. She and her family lives in the Molton Corner, north of the outskirts of the capital of Monrovia, Liberia.

Korto's business is selling fish. She buys fish wholesale from fishermen and sells retail to residents to of Molton Corner, north of the outskirts of the capital city, Monrovia, Liberia. She has been running this business for 15 years and hopes to start selling wholesale to retailers. Korto talks to her customers in a good manner and sells fresh fish to customers in order to encourage them to continue buying from her but she sometimes faces supply shortages, which is not good for business.
She needs this loan in order to purchase more fish to serve to her customers. Korto dreams of improving the living standard of her family and to educate her children.

loans.use: She needs this loan in order to purchase more fish to serve to her customers.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma P. is from the town of Baclay, Tukuran, Zambo, Del Sur. She is 45 years old and married with four school-age children. To make a living, Elma owns and operates a fishing business. She harvests and sells farm-raised fish in the local community. Elma has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $225 month from these activities.

In 2008, Elma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Elma is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Kunduz

texts.en: Kunduz is married, has three children, and devotes her time to selling salads. Her husband works as an independent welder but does not earn enough to pay for household expenses or for their children's education. That's why she decided to help him by opening her business, which she started twelve years ago. At first, Kunduz sold to her neighbors and, little by little, her business has been growing and now she sells in the markets. Her oldest daughter helps her in the business and wishes to continue to make it grow. Kunduz is requesting a loan for 12,300 Somoni to purchase fresh vegetables for making salads. She and her family are very grateful for the support that you give to allow them to continue their business and improve their quality of life. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more fresh vegetables for making salads

loans.name: Srey Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Mom H. is the mother of four children.  Two are employed in different positions, while the others are attending the local school.  Her husband, Mr. Pol Sava, is a motorbike taxi driver who supports the family with his modest income. 

Mrs. Srey Mom H. is the leader of a group whose members all live in Preak Ta Ong village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land used for cultivating rice.  Her plantation faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizer to support the field. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita es una laboriosa mujer de 42 años, vive feliz al lado de su esposo Edgardo de 49 años, y sus tres jóvenes hijos: Ezer de 22, Wilder de 19 y Gisela de 16 años, en su pequeña casa que es propia y está ubicada en la parte oriental del Perú.

Junto a toda su familia se dedican al cultivo de plátanos, café y palta en sus fértiles chacras; él se dedica a esta actividad desde muy joven porque lo aprendió de sus padres; además que los frutos que cultivan son los que se produce en mayor cantidad por su zona.
El mayo anhelo de Felicita es que sus hijos puedan estudiar una carrera en la ciudad, ya que por la zona donde vive no hay oportunidad de buena educación, además quiere que ellos lleguen a tener lo que ni ella ni su esposo lograron en la vida. 
A Felicita le gusta su trabajo porque sus tierras son propias y las puede producir sin ningún tipo de problemas, además porque sus hijos y su esposo la ayudan en la actividad que les genera buenas ganancias económicas, pues sus productos los vende a mayoristas que pagan un buen precio de acuerdo a la temporada de los frutos.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete que una vez más será responsable con sus pagos pues tiene en mente solicitar otros créditos futuros, y así poco a poco cumplir con cada uno de sus objetivos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para sus tierras de cultivo, porque sabe que la tierra produce más si se le da un buen cuidado.
texts.en:
Felicita is a hard-working woman who is 42 years of age, and lives happily with her husband Edgardo who is 49. They have three children: Ezer, 22 years old, Wilder, who is 19, and Gisela, 16. They live in a house they own, located in the eastern part of Perú. Together with the whole family, she dedicates herself to growing bananas, coffee and avocado. She has been farming since she was very young, having learned the trade from her parents. The crops she grows are the most produced in her region of the country. Felicita’s greatest wish is for her children to pursue their studies in the city, since in the zone where they live there are not many opportunities for a good education. In addition, she would like them to have the many things that she and her husband never managed to have in life. Felicita enjoys her work because she is doing it on her own land, and she can harvest her crops without any problems. In addition, she enjoys working with her husband and children who help her generate a good income for the family. She sells her products to wholesalers who pay a good price for seasonal products. This is the fourth time she’s had a loan with MFP, and she promises to be responsible with her repayments as she would like access to credit in the future to reach her goals. The funds she is currently requesting will be invested into the purchase of fertilizers for her farmland, because she knows it will yield more if she takes good care of it.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Marta Isabel

texts.es: Marta Isabel L. D. B. D. 47 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután, vive en la casa D. su madre junto a sus dos hijos D. 18 y 16 años D. edad. Ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa, la cual la comercializa junto a su hijo mayor D. manera ambulante, cada día Marta se levanta muy temprano dispuesta a vender lo más posible, ofreciendo su productos por las colonias y mercados D. Usulután. DesD. hace 15 años Marta se dedica a la misma actividad, la cual le ha permitido brindarles a sus hijos todo lo necesario como alimento, vestuario y estudios. Es por esto que ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias en su colonia ya que se ha destacado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y responsable la cual siempre ha velado por el bienestar D. sus hijos. Marta solicita un préstamo ya que desea poder comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa, así mismo diferentes estilos, tallas y colores lo cual le permita aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Marta Isabel L. D. B. is 47 years old. She lives the department of Usulután. She lives her mother's house with along with her two sons, who are 18 and 16 years old. She sells clothing as a street vendor, which she does along with her oldest son. Every day, Marta gets up very early, ready to sell as much as possible. She sells her products in the neighborhoods and markets of Usulután. She has been in this line of work for 15 years, and it has allowed her to proviD. everything that her children needed, like food, clothing, and studies. This is why she has such good references from people in her neighborhood, because she has stood out as a hardworking and responsible person who has always looked out for the wellbeing of her children. Marta is requesting a loan because she’d like to buy a larger quantity of clothing and also different styles, sizes, and colors, which would allow her to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase good containers for carrying milk

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary N. W. is 49 years old and married with five children between the ages of 29 and 22 years old. She is a member of a self-help group called "Mother's Choice". Her business is located in Ndunyu Sabuk where, for seven years now, she has been operating a grocery store. Her major challenge has been too many people in the area who are in the same kind of business as hers. She is using her loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more vegetables to sell to more people. She has a dream of really expanding her business. She is innovative and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es una madre de familia de 39 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a vender menestras en el mercado de la ciudad desde hace más de 12 años. Ella nos comenta que tuvo que empezar este negocio porque los ingresos que su esposo percibía como obrero agrícola no eran suficientes para solventar la economía de su hogar. Todos los días Cristina vende menestras en grano y precocidas desde las ocho de la mañana hasta las dos de la tarde.

Cristina se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más menestras para ampliar su negocio, ya que este se encuentra algo desabastecido debido a que tuvo que ser operada de su vesícula hace algunos meses y no podía atender su establecimiento.

Ella es una mujer activa y bastante trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Este es su segundo crédito con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Cristina is 39 years old and is a mother to 4 children and lives with her husband in the district of Paiján, province of Ascope, in the region of La Libertad, located 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She has sold menestras (dried legumes) in the city market for over 12 years. She tells us that she had to start this business because her husband's earnings as a farmer was not enough to make ends meet in her home. Everyday Cristina sells menestras in grain and precooked from 8 in the morning until 2 o’clock.

Cristina applied for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva’s field partner) for 1000 new soles, and she will invest it to buy more menestras to expand her business since its been in trouble ever since her vesicular operation some months back and she was not able to take care of her business.

Cristina is a very active and hardworking woman. Her biggest wish is to keep growing as an entrepreneur and to give her family a better quality of life. This is her second loan with our institution and she has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality when making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more menestras (dried legumes) to expand her business.

loans.name: Ma. Esperanza

texts.en:
Ma. Esperanza J. is from the village of Tierra Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 45 years old. Ma. Esperanza is separated from her spouse and has four adult children. To make a living, Ma. Esperanza owns & operates a business selling dried fish and longanisa in the local community. Ma. Esperanza has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ma. Esperanza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Esperanza is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ma. Esperanza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tierra Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misa

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhom B. is 44 years old and lives in Roka village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land for growing crops. Her husband, Mr. Chhoeun Chhoum, is a construction worker who can earn a small income to support his family. Although they try to work hard with their different business, they still don't earn enough income to support the family. Thus, Mrs. Sokhom B. decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding. With her new business, she hopes to increase her income to improve the family's living conditions. Mrs. Sokhom B. is the mother of seven children. One of the children is a seamstress in a garment factory, three are construction workers and support their father's business, two are students in the local school and the youngest one is five years old. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita G. is from the village of Tudela, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Lolita is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a business providing tricycle transport services and she has a sari-sari "general store". Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Lolita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 58 años, casada y madre de 6 hijos, pero solo vive con el último de sus hijos, tiene 15 años y vela por él, en compañía de su esposo viven juntos en su casa propia. Desde hace 5 años emprendió el negocio de venta de piedras de carbón y desde entonces no ha parado de trabajar, yendo a zonas muy alejadas para abastecerse de este producto. Luego serian vendidos en las fábricas de ladrillo, que son muchos lo que abundan por su localidad. Esta materia prima, sirve para combustible de hornos grandes de condensación, que son muy útiles en estas fábricas. Este negocio le ha dado buenos resultados, por tener mucha demanda el carbón, es así que constantemente compra este material, logrando almacenarlo en el patio de su casa. Ahora su propósito inmediato es comprar en mayor proporción. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una camionada de  carbón de piedra.
texts.en:
Antonia is 58 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children. She lives with her youngest child, who is 15 years old, and cares for him. Together with her husband, they all live together in a house they own. For the past 5 years, she has run a business selling coal. Since starting up, she has not stopped working, and travels great distances in order to obtain her product. The coal is then sold to the brick factories that are plentiful in the area where she lives. This raw material serves as fuel for the large condensation ovens that are common in these factories. This enterprise has given her good results due to the great demand for coal. For this reason, she constantly buys the material and stockpiles it on the porch of her home. Her immediate plan is to buy the coal in greater quantities. This is her second credit with MFP, and she promises to be very responsible with her loan payments. In addition, she feels this contribution will be very helpful to her in growing her business. She plans to purchase a truckload of coal with the loan she is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more coal.

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of four people located in Prey Rumdeng village in Takeo province. Mrs. Ny N. is 35 years old. She is the village bank president, selected by all the members. Each member of this village loan will use the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Ny N. is a farmer who owns three hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living. She is also a pig breeder at home. With both businesses, she can earn a small income to support her family. Mrs. Ny N. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food for pig breeding, to buy fertilizer and to hire a laborer to plow her farm. Mrs. Ny N. is a widow with two children who are students in the local school. They also help their mother's business.

loans.use: To buy piglets, pig food and fertilizer and to hire a laborer to plow her farm.

loans.name: Kishwar's Group

texts.en:
Kishwar is a resident of the mid-sized city of Riwind, Pakistan. She owns a small house with two rooms and has been living there with her family for twenty-five years. Her husband's name is M. J. and he runs a grocery shop. He choose this business for two reasons: firstly, he had five years sales experience in a department store, and secondly, there was no local grocery store and people were going to the main market for groceries. He has been running his shop for three years and has built up a good reputation among his customers. 


Kishwar, who is a very talented lady, operates a bed-sheet selling business. She purchases bed-sheets from Lahore city at cheap rates and sells them in the local community and also in the market. This business helps her to share the financial burden with her husband.

  
Kishwar is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest capital in her own business so that she can purchase bed-sheets in bulk and increase profits.

loans.use: to purchase bed-sheets in bulk to sell

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang T. N. was born in 1960 and lives in Luong Quy village, Dong Anh district. She has a son who is going to school.

Not only is Hang T. N. a worker but she also breeds pigs and has a monthly income of about 2,500,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2005 and has repaid punctually. For this loan she wants to borrow 8,502,000 VND to repair her house.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Gloriose

texts.en:
Gloriose was born in 1981 and is married with one child who is 3 years old. Gloriose's husband helps her in her business so that they earn a lot of money. Gloriose takes care of one dependent; she has 4 years of experience in business of selling green bananas. This business is profitable and that's the reason why it was chosen by her. She employs one person from her community. The hours of her business are from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening every day except on Sunday.

Gloriose is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing her business which will be an advantage for her customers as well as herself because the customers will be satisfied and Gloriose will earn more profit.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Mujeres Audaces Group

texts.es:
Esta foto fue tomada en el negocio de la señora Josefina C. O., una  integrante del grupo Mujeres Audaces, que está ubicado en el Estado de Puebla en México. En la foto podemos apreciar su mercancía.   Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa  que inició hace 13  años. Solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la venta de ropa además de que piensa iniciar con la venta de abarrotes. Las personas la estiman mucho y la reconocen como una persona muy trabajadora. Por el momento muestra los dos tipos de mercancía en un solo local.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se encuentra muy entusiasmada ya que considera que con ello podrá invertir más en su negocio y poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes en tiempo.  Tiene 38 años, estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria es casada y tiene en total 3 hijos (2 mujeres 1 varón).  Quiere este crédito para que en un futuro pueda tener un local para cada tipo de negocio.  Ella tiene la ilusión que con las ganancias de sus dos negocios bien establecidos pueda seguir construyendo más habitaciones a su casa.

El grupo está conformado por  10 integrantes y los otros integrantes son:

Maricela M.M.				Venta de repostería.
Sandra Rosario C.C.			Venta de pollo.
Cristina V.O.				Venta de refrescos.
Magdalena Herminia Z.R.		Venta de artículos para el hogar.
Evelia N.P.				Venta de Ropa.
Damaris I.F.				Venta de trastes.
Ignacia M.M.				Venta de ropa.
Maricela L.V.				Venta de ropa.
Guadalupe C.R.			Venta de cosméticos.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in Josefina C.O.’s business. She’s a member of the Mujeres Audaces (Daring Women) communal bank located in the Mexican state of Puebla. We can see her merchandise in the photo. She is a clothing merchant, a business she started 13 years ago. She is asking for funds to invest in the clothing sales business but she is also thinking about starting to sell groceries. People like her very much and recognize her as a hard working person. At present, she is stocking both kinds of items in the same location. At the moment of requesting the loan she is very excited because she feels that this will make it possible for her to invest more in her business and be able to fill all her pending orders from customers on time. She is 38 years old and finished 9th grade. She’s married and has three children, two girls and one boy. She wants this loan so that in the future she can have a separate location for each type of business. She hopes that with combined profits from both businesses she will be able to add on to her home. The Group has 10 members who are: Maricela M.M. Pastry sales. Sandra Rosario C.C. Chicken sales. Cristina V.O. Soft drinks sales. Magdalena Herminia Z.R. Home articles sales. Evelia N.P. Clothing sales. Damaris I.F. Dinnerware sales. Ignacia M.M. Clothing sales. Maricela L.V. Clothing sales. Guadalupe C.R. Cosmetics sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in clothing sales.

loans.name: Aurora Felicita

texts.es:
Aurora de 33 años, vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil), ella tiene una papelería (en Ecuador se los llama “bazar”).   

Comenzó con la papelería para poder mantener a su familia, vendiendo cuadernos, plumas y papeles a sus vecinos y conocidos cuando completo el dinero para ubicar su pequeña papelería readecuo su casa y la ubico en la parte delantera de su casa. Trabaja desde las 07h30am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas y vitrinas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere amplia su negocio y mercadería.
texts.en:
Aurora, 33, lives in Primavera de Duran (an urban area on the outskirts of Guayaquil whose natural ecology is fast disappearing.) She has a paper goods store (that in Ecuador is called a "bazar.") She started this business so that she could support her family, selling notebooks, pens and paper to her neighbors and acquaintances. When she gathered together enough money she reconfigured her home and located her store in the front part of her house. She works in the business from 7:30am until 8pm every day. With the loan, she will buy notebooks, pens and glass display cases for her business. In the future she wants to expand her business with more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy notebooks and paper goods

loans.name: Boldu

texts.en:
Boldu N. is the resident of Kadamjai, a nice town on the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 46 years old and married. She has two sons and a daughter. The first son went to work in Russia, the daughter helps her mom with her business activity and the younger son studies at school. Boldu works as a cook and cleaner at a school. She also sells rice to make money. Almost all of the family members are engaged in the rice selling activity. Selling some part of the harvest, Boldu makes 6600 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase 1.5 tons of mineral fertilizers for sowing the rice. In the future she wants to purchase a vehicle for her son to start working as a taxi driver. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for rice production.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita F. is from the village of Cabisera 8. She is 38 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Lolita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling fish in the local community. Lolita is just starting this business.

In 2009, Lolita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Lolita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aurea

texts.es: Aurea, de 41 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Luis tiene 44 años y de su joven hija, juntos y con muchas ganas de salir adelante habitan en un barrio ubicado  al norte de la ciudad. Cada día se despierta con los primeros rayos de luz, pues debe empezar a preparar los desayunos que ofrece a sus asiduos comensales, negocio que viene realizando desde hace 3 años. Es así que antes de las 8 de la mañana sale con su pequeña carretilla a ofrecer  desayuno a sus clientes, quienes trabajan en diferentes negocios de la zona. De esta manera expende bebidas calientes y panes con distintos rellenos, en donde casi toda la mañana hasta el mediodía termina por vender todo lo que había preparado, y satisfecha se dirige a su casa para luego continuar suministrarse de ingrediente para el día siguiente que tiene que preparar desayuno. De las ganancias que recibe ayuda a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su hija cuando no estudia, pero generalmente el trabajo lo realiza sola. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar el negocio e instalar un puesto de venta de desayunos y comidas en algún mercado de su zona. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete  pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Aurea tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes al por mayor que necesita para seguir ofreciendo desayunos; además una parte también la destinará para comprar 2 llantas para cambiar las antiguas del auto con el que trabaja su esposo.
texts.en:
Aurea, 41, lives in her own house with her husband, Luis, 44, and their young daughter. Together, with a strong wish to get ahead in life, they live in a neighborhood in the north side of the city. She rises at dawn every day to start preparing the breakfasts that she offers her regular diners. She has been in this business for 3 years. So it is that before 8am we can find her out with her cart selling breakfasts to her customers who are employed in various area businesses. She sells hot beverages and various stuffed breads all morning and is usually sold out by noon. She returns home satisfied with her sales and starts to get the ingredients for the next day’s breakfast preparation. Profits from these sales help her husband meet household expenses. Sometimes, when her daughter isn’t doing school work, she helps out but she usually works by herself. As an enterprising woman, she plans for the future to expand her business and set up a stand in one of the area markets to sell breakfasts and lunches. This is the 2nd loan from MFP and she promises to repay on time because she is very grateful to all the people who funded the loan that will allow her to keep working in search of progress. Aurea plans to use the funds to buy ingredients she needs to continue making breakfasts at wholesale. In addition, she will use part of the funds to buy two tires to replace the old ones on her husband’s car that he uses for work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and ingredients for the breakfasts she makes.

loans.name: Johana

texts.en:
Johana is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for the last twenty years and has three employees. His mixed farm produces tea, which he sells locally, and milk, which he sells through Brookside Company. He is also in the business of buying and selling livestock. He is 57 years old and married with seven children who are between the ages of 4 and 28. Five of the children attend school.

He has requested this loan of 40,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. He says that the income from the sale of milk will go towards the education of his children. His biggest challenge is disease, which affects his production. In the future, he would like to buy a piece of land and build a dairy unit for his cows.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina A. is from the village of Centro 2, San Guillermo, Isabela. She is 43 years old. Adelina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Adelina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling street foods such as barbecues and other dimsums to the local community. Adelina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Adelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Adelina is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Adelina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 24-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is married to a peasant and together they have two children aged 6 and 4 years. He lives in a household of five people in a rented house. He dreams of having a good family standard of living. 

Robert currently is into the retail shop business and motorcycle transport. He has been in business for the last three years. Before that, Robert used to ride a bicycle for his transport business. He intends to use the loan to purchase sugar, soap, cooking oil and domestic items to sell in his shop.

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, soap, cooking oil and domestic items

loans.name: Comfort Ama Madwen Moho

texts.en: Comfort Ama Madwen Moho G. sells banku, plastic bowls and saucepans at Elmina. Comfort has no educational background. She is married to an electrician. She assists her husband in the well-being of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more plastic bowls and pans to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more plastic bowls and pans to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty N. is currently in the business of selling rice, beans and cowpeas at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans and cowpeas to sell. Betty is 29 and married to a peasant. She has four children, two of which go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more bags of beans and cowpeas to sell.

loans.name: Paul Kamau

texts.en:
Paul has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last five years.  He is 43 years old, married to Esther Watetu, and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his fourth loan.  He paid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use this loan amount to buy fertiliser and potato seedlings, and pay for labour to plant potatoes.

In the future, Paul plans to buy more land so that he can practice large scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertiliser and potato seedlings, and pay for labour

loans.name: Lotis

texts.en:
Lotis A., age 35, owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop in her local community, offering such daily-use products as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, and snack foods for sale. She also buys and sells ready-to-wear (second-hand) clothing items. Lotis has been engaged in her business for over three years and it brings her approximately 5,000 PHP a month. She and her husband live in the village of Agusan Canyon, Camp Phillips, Bukidnon, and have two school-aged children.

In 2009, Lotis joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Lotis has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and was employed as working capital. Lotis is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase beverages and other additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Lotis from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase beverages and other additional products to sell

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel, D. 34 años, vive en su casa que es  propia junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos,  cada día se esfuerza por salir adelante para mejorar su condición D. vida.DesD. hace 3 años, esta emprendedora madre D. familia se dedica a la venta D. diversas comidas en un paradero D. su zona. Cada día después D. cocinar en su casa envuelve sus ollas y la saca en su carreta, D. esta manera empieza con la venta D. sus platillos (chanfainita, tallarines rojos y demás guisos D. pollo). El tiempo le ha permitido captar muchos clientes que gustan D. su sazón, sobre todo los chóferes D. los paraderos D. los motocarros. Lo que mas le gusta D. su trabajo, es que le es muy rentable y por ello ha contratado  a una señorita quien le ayuda en la atención, pero también le preocupa el incremento D. mayor cantidad D.  vendedores ambulantes D. comida que se instalan aledaños a su negocio. Por ello para más adelante piensa alquilar un local y apostar por un restaurante, para brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.Es el 13avo préstamo que tiene con MFP, por lo que se ha comprometido nuevamente en ser responsable en el pago D. sus cuotas, ya que los créditos anteriores le han sido D. mucha utilidad en el progreso D. su negocio.Maribel planea invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra D. sillas y  mesas, asimismo piensa mandar realizar almanaques a pedido D. sus clientes, D. esta manera espera alcanzar el progreso.
texts.en:
Maribel is 34 years old.  She lives in her own home together with her husband and their three children.

Every day Maribel works hard to get ahead and improve her living conditions.  For three years, this enterprising mother has been selling a variety of meals in her area.  Every day, after cooking in her home, she wraps up her pots, takes them out on her cart and starts selling her meals: 'chanfainita' (a traditional Peruvian dish), 'tallarines rojos' (another traditional Peruvian dish - literally 'red noodles'), and chicken stews.  Over time, she has been able to attract a lot of customers who enjoy her delicious meals, above all the drivers at the 'mototaxi' (auto rickshaw) stands.

What Maribel most likes about her work is that it is very profitable and, for that reason, she has been able to hire a young lady to help her.  However, she is also worried about the increase in the number of itinerant street vendors who also sell meals and who have set up near her business.  For this reason, in the future she is thinking of renting premises and setting up a restaurant so that she can proviD. her customers with a better service.

This is Maribel's 13th loan with MFP and she has pledged, once again, to be responsible in making her loan repayments.  Her previous loans have been very helpful to her in making progress in her business.  Maribel plans to invest her loan money in buying tables and chairs.  She is also thinking of making calendars to order.  In this way, she hopes to make progress.

loans.use: To buy furniture to improve her business

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a wife and the mother of two daughters. She is studying and looking forward to continuing her education to earn a BA and start working. Eman needs this loan to pay for tuition fees and other education-related expenses. Eman took out a previous loan from FATEN and repaid it successfully and on time with the help of her husband, who is an employee.

Eman appears in the picture here in FATEN's office.

loans.use: For school tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es: Tomasa, de 48 años, es una mujer trabajadora que vive junto a su hijo Jhon, de 18 años. Como madre soltera ella vive junto a su hijo, en su casa propia, ubicada en Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). El Trabajo al que se dedica está laboriosa mujer es la venta de comida en un amplio restaurante que tiene a la entrada de puente. Todas las mañanas durante la semana, prepara comida criolla; pero según menciona en el mes de abril, en plena campaña de cosecha de café; prepara comida típica para todos los peones que trabajan en la zona, llegando adquirir una ganancia neta de 100 nuevos soles promedio. Es por eso que dentro de muy poco se trasladará al nuevo restaurante que está construyendo, que es más amplio y con mejores acabados. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “comerciantes”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde está segura que logrará sus objetivos. Tomasa, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de sacos de arroz, azúcar e insumos necesarios para la venta diaria de comida.
texts.en: Tomasa is 48 years old. She is a hardworking woman who lives with her 18-year old son Jhon. She is a single mother who lives with her son in a house that is her own. It is located in Puente Paucartambo (the central Peruvian jungle). This hardworking woman's business is the sale of prepared foods from a large restaurant located at the entrance of the bridge. Every morning during the week she prepares Creole foods. But during the month of April, during the coffee harvest, she prepares traditional foods for the laborers who work in the region. She manages to earn an average of 100 nuevos soles. This is how she will soon be able to move to the new restaurant she is having built. It is larger and it is improved in the construction. She belongs to the communal bank named "Comerciantes". This is her first loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is certain she will achieve her goals. Tomasa will invest the loan she requests in the purchase of sacks of rice, sugar, and other ingredients she needs to prepare foods daily.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare foods.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan P. is from the village of Olango, Mallig, Isabela. He is 33 years old and married, with an infant child. To make a living, Jonathan plants and harvests rice for sale. Jonathan has been engaged in his business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 25000 PHP a month.

Jonathan joined ASKI this year to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jonathan is requesting his first loan, for 20000 PHP, to be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jonathan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrellita B. is from the village of Lugdungan, Dipolog City. She is 61 years old. Estrellita is widow and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Estrellita owns & operates a business primarily planting rice.  She is also engaged in the pig raising business. Estrellita has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Estrellita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrellita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets and feeds. Estrellita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers for her rice field. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Estrellita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for rice farming

loans.name: Virgen Maria De Inquilpata Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sinforosa; ella es casada y tiene 57 años y 7 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de queso y también vende productos secos, ella vende en el mercado de Huancaro desde las 7:00 a.m hasta 6:00 p.m y en algunas oportunidades la socia vende verduras como habas, arvejas y zanahorias, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de queso y venta de verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar queso y verduras.


Los otros socios  se dedican la venta de bebidas, venta de chanchos, venta de bebidas, venta de animales y venta de materiales de construcción. 


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Virgen Maria de Inquilpata” which is located in the District and Province of Anta, Department of Cusco.

One member is Sra. Sinforosa. She is 57 years old, married, and has seven children. Sinforosa earns her living by selling cheese and dried products. She sells at the market in Huancaro from 7am to 6pm. On a few occasions, she sells vegetables such as beans, peas, and carrots. Sinforosa wants to improve her business, so she is requesting a loan to buy cheese and vegetables.

The other members are engaged in retail businesses selling beverages, pigs, soft drinks, animals, and construction materials. They are grateful to those who have helped them fulfill their dreams, so they promise to complete their payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase cheese and vegetables.

loans.name: Natalina

texts.en: Natalina is currently in business selling fish. She is 32 years old, married, with four children and three of them go to school. Natalina borrowed a loan to stock more fish to sell. She hopes to build a house in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman six children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past 10 years, she has been making mahamri (dumplings) for sale. She also operates a furniture shop which contributes to her other source of income. She sells at retail to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanamisi faces a major challenge in the seasonality of her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase bundles of wheat and maize flour, as well as timber for her furniture shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy wheat and maize flour for making dumplings, as well as lumber for her furniture shop.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina, D. 62 años, es una mujer que siempre a luchado por sobre salir en la vida. Hace 30 años que enviudó, se llamaba Andrés, con quien tuvo 4 hijos, pero ahora  vive en su casa propia junto a su querido hijo Henry, en la localidad D. Huayounioc. Con mucho esfuerzo Marcelina pudo poner un cafetín en el poblado D. Huayounioc, con la ayuda D. su fallecido esposo pudo equiparlo muy bien y poco a poco lo convirtió en un lugar muy conocido y concurrido. La comida que sirve es muy buena, es por eso que es muy visitada por sus vecinos. Ahí venD. café, panqueques (comida a base D. harina), y demás bebidas, los cuales venD. mayormente en las noches. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es tener su negocio limpio, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener atender a tantas personas a la vez, ya que muchas veces ella no se da abasto. Además cuenta que se dedica también a la crianza D. animales menores como carneros y vacas, con el que venD. carne y leche. Todas las mañanas baja a la ciudad a comprar el pasto que necesitan. Y como buena mujer del campo, también se dedica a la siembra D. papa, maíz y zanahoria a baja escala, ya que no tiene que dedicarse también a sus múltiples oficios. Para su futuro desea ahorrar lo suficiente para poder pasar una vejez tranquila. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Progreso Huayounioc”, y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donD. es una socia responsable, ya que adelanta su fecha D. pago. Marcelina, con el crédito solicitado comprará varios sacos D. abono orgánico que esparcirá entre sus cultivos.
texts.en: Marcelina, aged 62, is a woman who has always striven to excel in life. A mother of 4 children, she became a widow 30 years ago when her husband Andrés died. She now lives in her own house with her beloved son Henry in the town of Huayounioc. With a lot of efforts Marcelina was able to open a small café in the town of Huayounioc, and with the help of her deceased husband she was able to fit it very well, little by little transforming it in a very well-known and popular place. The food she serves is very good, and for this reason her café is attended by many customers. She sells coffee, panqueques (a sort of pancake maD. with flour) and drinks, which she sells mainly at night. Keeping her shop clean is what she loves the most about her job. She has been running this activity for 10 years and she thinks the most difficult part is to serve many people at the same time, as sometime she finds it hard to keep up with it. She also said she engages in breeding cows and small animals such as sheep, then selling their meat and milk. Every morning she goes to town to buy the manure they need, and being a good country woman she also engages in growing potatoes, maize and carrots on a small scale, as she has not so much time to dedicate to this because of her many activities. In the future she wishes to be able to save enough to lead a peaceful life in her old age. She is a member of the Banco Comunal “Progreso Huayounioc” (“Huayounioc Progress” Communal Bank), and this is the sixth loan she has requested to MFP. She is a very responsible member, always ahead of her repayment schedule. The loan Marcelina has requested will be used to buy various bags of organic fertilizers she will spread over her crops.

loans.use: To buy various bags of organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, potatoes, cauliflower and cabbage, as well as apples and papayas.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is an Individual client from Ibanda with a grocery stall business in Ibanda Central market that she has owned for over 15 years. She is a married woman with four children, two of whom are still in school. Her customers are mostly town based and she is able to generate 150,000 shillings as monthly income. She is also involved in farming and selling produce and this supplements her income. 

She says that to start her grocery stall, she saved from farming. Because of her hard work, she has been able to take care of her children and husband. Her plan is to increase production and she needs a loan to be able to restock her business with more tomatoes, onions, green pepper, Irish potatoes and so on.

loans.use: To restock her business with more tomatoes, onions, green pepper, Irish potatoes and so on.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda de 43 años convive con Zacarías de 44 años, que fruto de este amor tienen 3 hijos. Ellos viven en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Hilda, desde muy joven incursionó en el mundo de los negocios, es por esta razón que ahora cuenta con un hospedaje. Asimismo posee un terreno agrícola en donde siembra cacao y en medio de este trabajo decidió vender productos agroquímicos, que es un negocio rentable ya que le genera un ingreso económico  para el bienestar de su familia. Sin embargo ella desea mejorar aún más el establecimiento que tiene, es por esta razón que acude a MFP para solicitar un nuevo crédito. Este será su tercer crédito con MFP por lo que pide la colaboración de cada uno de ustedes para desarrollar su negocio. Con los 2.000 nuevos soles desea implementar su tienda con nuevos productos agroquímicos.
texts.en:
Hilda, 43, lives with Zacarías, 44 and their three children.  They live in the middle of Canayre settlement in Llochegua District.  

From a very young age, Hilda went into the world of business and now has an inn.  She also owns a piece of farmland where she grows cocoa beans and while in this occupation decided to go into the sale of agrochemical products which is a very profitable business that generates income for her family’s wellbeing.  

However, she wants to improve her establishment still more and this is why she’s called upon MFP to request a new loan.  This will be her third loan with MFP so she is asking for the collaboration of each one of you in order to develop her business.  She will use the requested 2000 new soles to stock her store with new agrochemical products.

loans.use: to buy agrochemical supplies to stock her store.

loans.name: Yaneth Odolid

texts.es: Yaneth Odolid de 42 años de edad, habita en casa propia con su esposo José de 47 años  y su pequeño hijo Luis de 7 años de edad. Yaneth  es una mujer emprendedora que día a día trabaja duramente para sacar adelante a su familia. Su sueño es dar a su hijo el estudio para que un día logre ser un gran profesional. Hace varios años que logro establecer una pequeña tienda en su lugar de residencia en la cual vende variedad de bebidas, cereales, golosinas, etc.  Además   también se dedica a la venta de pupusas, negocio que atiende solo por las noches. Es una mujer trabajadora que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus vecinos, los cuales cada día son más, gracias a su amabilidad y entrega en su trabajo. Solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para abastecer su negocio de variedad de productos como: arroz, frijoles, bebidas, lácteos, detergente, golosinas, papel y de mas productos que sean atractivos para los clientes. No pierde la esperanza que los resultados de su esfuerzo serán positivos y logrará obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Yaneth Odolid is 42 years old and she lives in a house of her own together with her husband, Jose, who is 47 years old and their young son, Luis, who is 7 years old. Yaneth is a highly enterprising woman who works day after day to provide for her family. Her dream is to provide her children with schooling so that one day he will grow up to have a successful career. It has been many years since she established a small store where she lives. She sells a variety of drinks, cereals, snacks, etc. She also sells pupusas (a traditional Salvadoran dish made of corn dough stuffed with a variety of fillings). This business she only opens in the evenings. She is a hardworking woman who has always known how to earn her neighbor’s trust. She gains more clients daily thanks to her kindness and her commitment to her work. She requests this loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) to supply her business with a variety of products, such as: rice, beans, drinks, dairy products, detergents, snacks, paper products and other products which are attractive to clients. She does not lose hope that the results of her efforts will be positive, and obtain better income. She will aspire for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, drinks, dairy products, detergents, snacks, and paper products.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Imelda has a retail shop that sells vegetables like squash, cabbages & okra. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy vegetables to sell.

Imelda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Imelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business and add raw materials like carving wood and stones

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
Priscilla is a married woman with six children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the cost of purchasing seeds for farming. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. Priscilla dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) she wants to purchase sacks of beans, maize, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans, maize, and sugar.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Esta señora es originaria de telica, actualmente se está desempeñándose como maestra de Educación  Primaria en el poblado de mina el limón jurisdicción de larreynaga malpaisillo, su núcleo familiar está compuesto por ella y su hijo, ya que es madre soltera y es el primer financiamiento recibido atravez del convenio firmado por dicho colegio, ya que el crédito será utilizado para mejoramiento de vivienda y de esa manera continuar mejorando sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
This woman is originally from Telica. She currently works as an elementary school teacher in the town of Mina de Limón, which is under the jurisdiction of Larreynaga Malpaisillo. Her family consists of herself and her son, since she is a single mother.

This is the first loan she has received under the agreement with CEPRODEL that was signed by her school. She will use the loan for home improvements so that she can continue upgrading her conditions and her standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor required for home repairs.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 32 years old and married. She has two children, age 9 and 2, living in a rented house in Hioma, Uganda.

She has been in the textile business for five years and with the income earned she has been able to pay school fees for her children. She faces a challenge of inadequate materials to suit the different preferences of her customers. Her dream is to trade in wholesale.

Harriet needs the loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: 03.03.93 Thiệu Trung Thiệu Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mai is 45 years old and is married with 3 children. Mai is the group leader of the 03.03.93 Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in the Thiệu Hóa district, a rural area in the Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent.

Mrs Mai works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. The main hardship that Mai faces in her business is the lack of skills. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. 

This is Mai's first loan with the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. With her business profit, Mai hopes to buy land of her own, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Wesakulila Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wesakulila Group in Western Kenya! Mary is the facilitator of the Wesakulila group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Mary takes care of five children at home with her husband. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Mary had an excellent maize yield harvesting 7 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Mary was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mary and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales,Mary will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Wesakulila group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío, es madre soltera de 26 años, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su único hijo Frank, de 09 años a quien desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Rocío, es una mujer muy trabajadora, hace 03 años que se dedica a la venta de frutas que produce en la chacra de sus padres, quienes le dan ese apoyo para que pueda seguir adelante y  educar tranquilamente a su hijo. Rocío nos manifiesta que en temporada de frutas como: pacay, mango, piña, plátano, entre otros; los lleva a vender a la ciudad de Ayacucho donde sus clientes quedan satisfechos con las frutas que les lleva, pues son frutas deliciosas que produce en los campos de cultivo ubicada en la localidad de Rosario. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede solventar los gastos de su hijo y considera que lo más difícil es tener que viajar y tener que dejar a su hijo. Con el tiempo, Rocío, piensa sembrar más semillas de frutas para que pueda llevar mayor cantidad a la ciudad de Ayacucho ya que ahí se encuentran sus principales clientes. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está conforme con su banco comunal, ya que todos cumplen con sus compromisos de pago. Con el crédito solicitado de 2,000 nuevos soles comprará semillas de frutas como: mango, naranja, plátano, entre otros; para poder sembrar en su campo de cultivo.
texts.en:
Rocio is a 26-year-old single mother who lives in her parents' house with her only son Frank, aged 9, for whom she wishes to provide a better quality of life. Rocio is a very hard-working woman who 3 years ago began selling fruit she produced on the farm of her parents', who provided this help so she could get ahead and educate her child in a normal way. 

Rocio tells us that it is the season for fruits, such as mango, pineapple, and plantain, among others. She takes them to sell in the city of Ayacucho, where customers are very satisfied with the fruit she brings. This is because the fruit produced in the fields around Rosario are so delicious.

What Rocio likes most about her work is being able to cover her son's expenses. She thinks the most difficult part is having to travel and leave her son behind. In time, Rocio hopes to plant mO. fruit seeds in order to take a larger quantity to the city of Ayacucho, where her principal customers are located.

This is Rocio's 3rd loan through MFP and she promises to comply with her schedule of payments. She is also very fond of her communal bank, since everyone complies with their commitments to repay. With the 2,000 new sols she is requesting, Rocio will purchase fruit seeds, including mango, orange and plantain, among others, to sow on the farm.

loans.use: buy mango, orange and plantain seeds to plant.

loans.name: Amula

texts.en: Amula is 29 years old. She is a married woman who has four children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling beans and fish in Yei, South Sudan, for four years. Amula requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and fish to sell. She will use her extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and dry fish to sell.

loans.name: Maria Paulina

texts.es: Maria Paulina. D. 28 años D. edad ella se dedica a la venta D. medicina natural,y nos dice que lleba ya barios años D. dedicarse a esta actividad,y por esa razon esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. medicina natural ya que sus ventas han mejorado y quiere aprovechar para aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en: María Paulina, 28, sells natural remedies and tells us that she’s been doing this for several years now.  Because of this she’s asking for a loan to buy natural remedies since sales have improved and she wants to take advantage of this to increase profits.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies.

loans.name: Corazon Group

texts.en:
Corazon is 66 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is a widow with three adult-aged children. Corazon has a shop that sells canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles, etc. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 17,000 to purchase more canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles, etc. Corazon has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Corazon hopes to save money for future emergencies.

Corazon is the leader of a three person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to use to purchase canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Irma Ramona

texts.es: Irma tiene 54 años de edad tiene 1 hija la cual ya esta casada,Doña Irma tiene una libreria y micelanea la cual inicio hace 5 años cuando su hija se caso y se quedo sola ahora es la unica entrada con la que ella cuenta para poder vivir ella nos cuenta que sus negocio es muy rentable y le genera muy buenas ganacias ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos para libreria,el sueño de ella es servir a Dios en Todo momento.
texts.en: Irma is 54 years old and has one daughter who is married.  Irma has a bookstore and miscellaneous shop that she started five years ago when her daughter got married and she remained alone.  Now her business is her sole means of income.  She tells us that her business is doing well and generating good sales.  She is asking for a loan in order to buy products for her book store.

loans.use: To purchase products for her bookstore

loans.name: Rufaro Group

texts.en:
Ginetie is a 65-year-old woman who stays in a small town called Chikato in Gweru. She is married and has two children who are ages 30 and 27 years. She has two grandchildren she stays with besides her two children. 

Ginetie is in the poultry business and peanut butter making business and has been doing these projects for 3 years. She is requesting a loan of $400 to buy chicks and chick feeds, as well as peanuts for peanut butter making. The major challenges she faces in her business are competition and late payments by some of her debtors. Ginetie is planning to have at least 1000 birds a month. This loan will improve her standard of living through an increase in disposable income.

loans.use: To buy chicks, chick feed, and peanuts.

loans.name: Jaspher

texts.en: Jasper, 30 years old, is married and has two children ages 7 and 12 years old. He describes himself as an innovative and determined man. He sells milk to frequent and new customers. He has been in this business for the last two years. His business challenge is insufficient funds for buying the animal feed. He will be using the loan of KES 20,000 to buy cow feed used for milking. Jaspher's hope and dream is to be supplying over 100 liters of milk in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy more cow feed

loans.name: Emesalyn

texts.en:
Emesalyn is 25 years old and lives in Oroquieta in Misamis Occidental province. She is married with one child. Emesalyn has a general store and earns approximately 7,000 PHP each month running it.

Emesalyn has been a member of PMPC for two years. She has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de repuestos de vehiculos pesados como estabilizadores,llantas,parabrisas entre otros repuestos,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tine 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de repuestos de vehiculos pesados.La socia solicita le credito para comprar llantas,parabrisas y estabilizadores.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.

loans.use: La socia solicita le credito para comprar llantas,parabrisas y estabilizadores.

loans.name: Binta's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé en Novembre 2015 lors de l’inauguration de leur banc villageois. Le groupe compte des femmes qui en majorité ont acquis de solides expériences dans le petit commerce qui se trouvent être leur activité principale.  Elles habitent toutes le même quartier et ont une bonne entente entre elle.

Madame Binta (debout à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et  mère de 07 enfants dont 01 fille et 06 garçons. Elle s’active dans la vente de petit déjeuné.  Elle jouit d’une très bonne expérience dans ce domaine.

Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter en gros 01 sac de 50 kg de sucre, des œufs, du beurre, de la mayonnaise 10 kg de haricots locale et 15 kg de petit poids pour les besoins de son commerce de petit déjeuné.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’appuyer son mari dans les charges familiales et développer son activité

loans.use: acheter en gros 01 sac de 50 kg de sucre, des œufs, du beurre, de la mayonnaise 10 kg de haricots locale et 15 kg de petit poids

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
I am 50 years old and married with four children and a member of the Loans committee in charge of appraising members for group loans in Kongoini Thayu Women Group

 I have been running this business with my husband since 1970.  In addition to the business,we have a dairy cow which produces 15 litres of milk per milking and this supplements our income and also been able to feed my family with the milk at the same time selling to the milk vendors.  My first loan was Usd.300 and the second one was the same and I managed to pay promptly

loans.use: Business is very good during the month of June and July because the farmers will be receiving mini bonus for tea and I would like to increase the stock before then

loans.name: Nafas Gul

texts.en:
Nafas Gul is 50 years old and lives with her 6 children in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Nafas Gul shares a business with her son, Fawad, who has a shop near the market selling fish.

Nafas Gul prepares sweet material and cleans the fish and then her son cooks them and sells them at the bazaar. Through this, the income of her family is growing.

They believe that through taking more another  loan through AFSG they can increase their business.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Nkurankan, Ghana is a large market centre for the people of the Yilo Krobo District of Ghana. Madame Mary is a resident of this town and sells smoked fish. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation, and is seeking a Kiva loan of $900.00 to help her improve her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Thoi

texts.en:
Miss Thoi is 38 and her husband is 39 years old. They have 4 children between 17 and 10 years of age. Her first son works as a day laborer but he is the only one of her children to contribute money to the family. The other children are going to school in grades between 8 and 5.

The family has 10.000 square meters for growing cashew nuts but their land is poor and they don’t have capital to buy fertilizer so productivity is low. So selling vegetables is thus important to increase their income by about $2.5/person/month. Their average income is $10/person/month. Miss Thoi has already repaid her third loan in time. Now she wants to borrow $75 for her vegetable selling business and to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: Buy vegetables to sell and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.ru:
Abdurasul B. is 26 years old, is married and has three children. He has a high-school education. He sells household goods. He owns and raises cattle with the help of his wife. He became a client of MicroInvest in 2005. Back then he had $400 in assets and had to borrow money from illegal creditors in order to achieve a higher turnover. Gradually, over the course of 2 years during which he systematically borrowed money, he became a knowledgeable and successful client. He was able to open another sales outlet and can now go buy goods at wholesale prices. Currently his assets amount to $800, not counting the cattle that he raises at home. In the future he'd like to open a store in one of the main city markets.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer.

Бобочонов Абдурсаул – 26 лет, женат отец троих детей. Образование среднее. Занимается продажей хозяйственных товаров. Дома имеет крупно рогатый скот, и жена помогает ему откармливать скот дома. Клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» стал в 2005 году. В то время его активы составляли 400$, и чтобы увеличить товарооборот кредитовался у местных нелегальных кредиторов. Постепенно в течении 2 лет систематического кредитования он стал информированным и успешным клиентом, что позволило ему приобрести еще одну торговую точку и ездить за товаром, закупать товар оптом.
