Сейчас его активы составляют 800$ кроме несколько голов скота, которые откармливаются дома. В будущем хочет открыть магазин в одном из крупных рынков города.

loans.use: To open a shop in the central market

loans.name: Juana Tarsila

texts.es:
Hi my name is Juana Tarcila, I have had my own small store business at home for some years. Thanks to the income that I make from this business I can help with the family expenses. I am asking for a loan of U$ 400 in order to buy another freezer to store more products, since the demand for them has increased.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer,

Hola mi nombres Juana Tarcila, cuento con una pequeña pulperia en mi casa de habitación, desde hace varios años, gracias a los ingreso que persivo de este negocio puedo colaborar con los gastos de mi familia, actualmente necesito comprar un Frizer, ya que la demanda ha crecido y necesito otro congelador para almacenar mas producto.

loans.use: Compra de manteca, frijoles, jabon, pan, arroz, aceite, y Lacteos.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: "I started this business years ago and it has helped me take care of my family. I know how to safeguar my capital to ensure continuity in business." All these are the words of Mrs. Victoria O.. She is 50 years old, married and has 4 children. She sells provisions and drinks.  She is requesting a loan of US$400 to buy provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Annet's Group

texts.en:
Annet currently has a shop. She wants to take a loan to begin a poultry business alongside the existing shop to increase her sales and profits.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To begin a poultry business

loans.name: Houndjénoko

texts.fr:
Aged 41, Mrs. Houdejénoko A. is married and has five children. Her main activity is sheep rearing and sometimes agriculture. She rears sheep according to traditional methods and has to take the sheep to pasture every day, which is laborious and not very profitable. She is requesting a loan of $300 to build an enclosure for the animals and buy feed on a regular basis. This would increase her profit.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 41 ans, Madame A. Houndjénoko est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Sa principale activité demeure l’élevage de moutons et quelque fois l’agriculture. Son élevage est pratiqué de façon traditionnelle et elle doit amener les moutons au pâturage tous les jours ce qui rend l’activité pénible mais avec un rendement faible. Elle sollicite un apport financier de $300 pour construire un enclos aux bêtes et acheter régulièrement leurs nourritures. Ceci pour améliorer son rendement.

loans.use: To build an enclosure and buy feed for livestock

loans.name: I Nyoman Switra

texts.id:
I Nyoman Switra has been farming chicken since 2005. He farms chicken to be slaughtered that takes about 35-40 days from birth to slaughter. An average mature chicken weighs about 2kg and can be sold for $1 per kg. I Nyoman Switra farms about 4000 chickens. He is assisted by his wife and a contract worker that he pays about $110 per harvest. I Nyoman Switra's chicken farm is his family's only source of income since he retired from his post as his village head. He gets decent income from the farm, but it also carries significant risk as his chickens are vulnerable to disease and his yield can vary with temperature and weather. Therefor he needs to keep up the environment and spend some money on vaccines and drugs. Each harvest, I Nyoman Switra can earn up to $110 to $170 by selling his chickens to larger wholesaler who has been I Nyoman's regular client. I Nyoman Switra needs additional fund to afford higher price of feeds and to renovate his chicken cages. He hopes that his chicken farm can grow. He needs to pay for his children's tuition. One of his children is currently in college, and the other is still in Junior high school.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Beternak ayam telah di tekuni I Nyoman Switra Sejak tahun 2005 . Ayam yang di pelihara adalah ayam pedaging. Masa pertumbuhan ayam ini dari sejak lahir hingga siap panen berkisar 35 sampai 40 hari , dengan berat badan rata-rata 2 kg sedangkan harga perkilogramnya Rp 9.200,- . I Nyoman Switra memelihara 4.000 ekor ayam. Ia di bantu oleh istri serta seorang tenaga kerja yang di gaji sebesar Rp. 1.000.000,- per sekali panen . Memelihara ayam bagi I Nyoman Switra adalah satu –satunya sumber pendapatan keluarga sejak dia pensiun menjadi kepala dusun . Hasil yang di peroleh pun sangat menjanjikan . Namun resiko yang dihadapi juga cukup tinggi karena ayam jenis ini sangat rentan dengan serangan penyakit dan sangat terpengaruh pada suhu /cuaca ,sehingga memerlukan lingkungan yang sehat dan juga modal yang cukup untuk persediaan obat-obatan ataupun vaksin. Dalam sekali panen I Nyoman Switra meraup keuntungan berkisar 1 sampai 1,5 juta rupiah. Sedangkan hasil panen I Nyoman Switra langsung diambil oleh pedagang besar yang sudah menjadi pelanggan tetap . I Nyoman Switra memerlukan tambahan modal untuk membeli pakan ayam yang saat ini semakin mahal dan juga untuk merenopasi kandangnya yang sudah mulai rapuh , Dan besar harapan I Nyoman Switra peternakan ayamnya bisa lebih berkembang ,sehingga dapat menunjang biaya pendidikan anaknya yang kini telah duduk di bangku kuliah dan satu lagi masih SMP.

loans.use: Purchase Chicken Feed and Repair Cages

loans.name: Haqiqat

texts.en:
Haqiqat M. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Aghdam. She has a small shop in front of her house where she sells mostly fruits and vegetables. Her shop is also famous in the neighborhood for its tasty popcorn and sunflower seeds that all the kids buy on their way to school.

Haqiqat's son has an old car that their family calls a branch of the shop. Her son fills it with fresh produce and visits other neighborhoods to sell the goods there. Haqiqat just got a license for selling meat. She needs this loan to purchase meat from wholesalers.

loans.use: Purchase of inventory for her little shop

loans.name: Avelino

texts.es:
Avelino Hernández is a married father of 3 children ages 20, 17, and 15. He started his business because he needed the income to support his children. He started working as a taxi driver at the bus station 38 years ago. He decided to save up enough money to buy himself a taxi cab and continue in the business because for many years, he had rent the vehicle, thus he was left without money.

He is requesting a loan of $675 USD, which he will repay in 6 months, so that he can finish paying his taxi license fees and also pay for another taxi cab. With your help, Avelino will get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Avelino Hernández es casado y tiene 3 hijos de 20, 17 y 15 años. Inició el negocio por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso para la atención de sus hijos, hace 38 años como ecotaxista de la central de autobuses. Decidió juntar dinero para comprarse un ecotaxi y continuar en el negocio ya que durante muchos años tuvo que estar pagando la renta de uno y tuvo muchas carencias económicas por esta situación.

Solicita un crédito por US $675 que pagara en 6 meses para completar el pago de las placas de su taxi y abonar a otro taxi. Con tu ayuda don Avelino saldrá adelante

loans.use: Pay taxi cab license fees

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru:
Mastura Zubayadova lives in the town of Vahdat. She is married and has 7 children. She is 44 years old. She generally stays at home and takes care of their animals. She breeds cattle and sells it on a market or to her neighbors. She would like to increase the number of animals she has by purchasing more cattle. This is only possible if she can obtain a loan. She plans to pay off the loan within the next 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Зубайдова Мастура жительница города Вахдат. Замужем и имеет 7 детей. Ей 44 года. Она домохозяйка , но уже 7 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит бычков и продает на базаре или соседям. Хочет увеличить поголовье скота , путем покупки дополнительных бычков. Это возможно лишь после того , как она получит кредит. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Ton

texts.en: Mrs. Ton M. is a villager in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She currently works in the rice plantation and pig breeding business, while her husband, Mr. Yeng Yim, is a subsistence farmer. Mrs. Ton M.’ plantation business has insufficient draft animals, thus, she is requesting a loan to buy a new cow to use as a draft animal. Mrs. Ton M. has five children: three are working as construction workers; while two attend school.  Previously, Mrs. Ton M. obtained a loan to start her pig breeding business.

loans.use: To buy a new cow to add with the previous one to use as a draft animal.

loans.name: Livia

texts.es:
Livia is a humble mother of three small school aged children. She works in her crop fields where she is exposed to the sun and, above all, the cold typical of the mountains of Perú. This activity is rewarded in the harvest, which brings a lot of joy to her children because they know that their parents will have money to buy them some necessities. This is the reason Livia desires to increase her income and the only way that she can achieve it is by improving her products and expanding her field and to do this she needs a quantity of money that doesn't have and so is requesting it as a loan from you with the aim of being able to count on your support.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Livia es una humilde madre de familia de 3 pequeños hijos que aún son escolares, trabaja en sus terrenos de cultivos, donde se expone al sol y sobre todo el frío típico de la sierra del Perú. Esta actividad es recompensada en la cosecha, que le trae mucha alegría a sus pequeños porque saben que sus padres tendrán dinero para comprarles algunas cosas necesarias.Por ello que Livia desea poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos y la única forma como puede lograrlo es mejorando sus productos y ampliando sus cultivos, para esto requiere de una cantidad de dinero que no posee y lo solicita como un préstamo ante usted con el fin de que pueda contar con su apoyo.

loans.use: Investment capital for the improvement and enlargement of her crop fields

loans.name: Akou Yvette

texts.fr: Né en 1969 à Agomé-Tomégbé, Madame G.  Akou Yvette  s’est mariée à un chauffeur et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Son activité principale est la coiffure et la tresse. Elle est  très dévouée et sollicite un financement pour aménager son atelier et acheter des matériels de travail pour bien satisfaire sa clientèle et attirer d’autres. Ceci augmentera son rendement ainsi que ses revenus et va lui permettre de bien s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in Agomé-Tomégbé in 1969, Akou Yvette G. is married to a chauffeur and the mother of four (04) children. Her main business is hairdressing and braiding. She is very dedicated and is requesting a loan to improve her salon and buy work materials so that she can meet her customer's needs better and attract more clients. This will increase her productivity and income so that she can take care of her family.

Translated from French by Alex Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her hair salon and purchase work materials

loans.name: Antonia Adelina

texts.es:
La señora Antonia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Paykanas” ubicado en Jr: Mariano Melgar Mz.D Lt.6 AA.HH. 28 de Marzo del distrito de Yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 30 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al trabajo de la madera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300, decide invertir en la venta de productos lácteos.

En la actualidad, Antonia cuenta  con 1 motokar, el cual lo pone a trabajar todos los días y de esa manera conseguir ingresos para pagar puntualmente el préstamo.

Con este préstamo de S/.2,200, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, invertirá en el arreglo de la motokar y comprará 3 llantas, tapizada de asiento, cambio de toldo y otros.  
   
Antonia se siente una mujer independiente gracias al apoyo de Manuela Ramos, además de estar agradecida por tener confianza en ella.
texts.en:
Mrs. Antonia is a member of the "Banco Comunal Las Paykanas", located in Jr: Mariano Melgar Mz.D Lt.6AA.HH. 28 de Marzo, District of Yarinacocha, Department of Ucayali. She is 30 years old, a mother of 3 young children who still depend on her, she is married and her husband works as a carpenter. With a previous loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.l300 she invested in dairy products. At the present Antonia has 1 motorcar which is being worked daily and that way she receives income to repay her loan punctually. With this loan of S/.2,200, to be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in fixing the motorcar and buy 3 tires, upholster the seats, and change the roof, among others. Antonia feels independent thanks to the support from Manuela Ramos and she is also very thankful for the trust put in her.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: IInvest in maintenance and fixing a motorcar.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Luisa, socia del Banco Comunal “La Esperanza”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, miel de abeja y hierbas medicinales. Su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa, en Prolongación La Merced S/N y sus clientes son mayormente los vecinos de su  barrio y personas que requieran de sus productos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, papel higiénico en paquetes, detergentes, jabones de diferentes marcas y tamaños, entre otros, para poder surtir bien su negocio y sus clientes encuentren  lo que buscan, así como también tramitará sus documentos para formalizar su negocio. 

Maria Luisa tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y con sus 02 hijos, los cuales son estudiantes y aún dependen de ella. Es una mujer trabajadora, que quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio y su meta es ampliar y dar seguridad a su local para surtir más el negocio y poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Luisa is a member of the financial group "La Esperanza" (Hope) and she lives in the region of San Martin in the province of Mariscal Caceres in the district of Juanjui. She sells groceries, honey and medicinal herbs. Her business is located in her home and her customers are mostly her neighbors and others who are in need of her products. This loan will be repaid in 6 months and will be used to purchase items such as rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, canned items, toilet paper, detergents, soaps of different sizes and brands, among other things so that she can stock her business better and so that her customers can find what they are looking for, she will also be able to send off the documents that will formalize her business. Maria Luisa is 38 years old and she lives with her husband and her two children who are both students and are still dependent on her. She is a hard working woman who would like to see her business continue to grow. Her goal is to expand and secure her store and to better stock it so that she can meet her customers' demands.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grocery items such as rice, sugar, milk and cooking oil.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
La señora Nicolasa vive en casa propia en la calle los pinos de la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz; ella trabaja como empleada domestica y su esposo trabaja como albañil, tiene un hijo el cual trabaja con un taxi que su padre compró.

El crédito que solicita es para reparar el auto ya que es una herramienta de trabajo para su hijo quien puede solventar sus estudios y su alimentación solo con el auto porque esta estudiando.

Su antecedente histórico con Impro es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs Nicolasa lives in her own house on Los Pinos Street in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz. She works as a maid, her husband as a builder and she has one son who drives a taxi his father bought him.

The loan she is requesting is to fix the taxi as it is the tool of her son’s trade who currently only makes enough to pay for his education and food as he is still studying.

Her credit history with Impro is good and qualifies her for a new loan.


Translated from Spanish by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing the taxi her son drives to help his parents

loans.name: Lazaro Jesus

texts.es: El Sr. Lázaro tiene 59 años de edad, habita en Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, casado con seis hijos de 5, 7, 10, 13,16 y 18 años de edad y los tiene estudiando. Sus planes para su familia son comprar una casa para cada hija y que tenga su propio hogar con un techo en donde habitar.Don Lázaro tiene su propio negocio un taller de carpintería que lo inicio hace 32 años para el tiempo de los años ochenta cuando costaba conseguir la madera y lo inicio con unos préstamos de aquellos años. Los planes para su negocio es mejorar su taller y ampliarlo un poco más y comprar materiales para aumentar la producción. Agracias a los prestamos en Afodenic lograra ampliar su negocio y aumentara sus ingresos, lo cual permitirá un mejor futuro para su familia.

loans.use: Comprar productos de materia prima y remodelar  el local

loans.name: Julia Elena

texts.es:
Julia C. se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y perfumes ambulando en las oficinas mercados y vecinos.
Tiene un hijo y vive en la zona de Achumani de la ciudad de La Paz, en alquiler.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de mercadería (perfumes, cosméticos y otros)
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Julia C. earns her living selling cosmetics and perfumes at workplaces, markets, and her neighbors' homes. She has one son, and rents a home in the Achumani neighborhood of La Paz. She plans to use her loan to purchase merchandise (perfumes, cosmetics, etc). This will be Ms. C.’s second loan with IMPRO. Her credit history has earned her a #1 rating, meaning she has paid off her loans completely and on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Joyitas De Oro Group

texts.es:
En la zona de villa tejada, se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “Joyitas de Oro”. Un grupo muy simpático y particular formado por 18 miembros que trabajan de manera organizada en todas sus actividades, cumpliendo mas de cinco años de trabajo junto a Pro-Mujer.  Las actividades que realiza la asociación Joyitas de Oro, son variadas; DEysi se dedican a la venta de artículos en plásticos, que los comercializa en la ciudad de Cochabamba; su hermana  costura sombreros, otras diseñan productos en miniatura (alasitas),
También se  dedican a la venta de ropa.
Afirman que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de productos al por mayor, están seguras que sus ventas aumentarían, de este modo obtendrán mayores ganancias y beneficios para sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Joyitas de Oro” group is from the Villa Tejada area. This is a very nice and particular group made up of 18 members who are very organized, having worked with Pro-Mujer for more than five years. The “Joyitas de Oro” group's members have a variety of businesses: Deysi sells plastic articles in Cochabamba; her sister sews hats; others design miniatures for the festival of Alasitas. They also sell clothing. They needs more capital in order to buy their goods wholesale; they are certain that their sales will increase, thus they will make more money and more profits for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital in order to buy goods at wholesale prices

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana E. prepares food for sale at Broyinbima near Elmina. Nana has received no formal education. She is married and has one child. Her husband works with the Takwa mines. Nana has been preparing food for sale since 2000. She is responsible for paying housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used to purchase food which she will prepare for her costumers. She plans to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase food to prepare for sale

loans.name: Joaquín

texts.es:
Joaquin es socio del Banco Comunal Orcasitas, Joaquin vive en la comunidad de Orcasitas que se ubica a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Joaquin es conviviente, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Joaquin junto a su esposa se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de peones, sus ventas lo realiza en la misma comunidad. Además Joaquín se dedica a la agricultura de verduras en sus terrenos de la comunidad de Chacco.
Joaquin necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono y para el pago de peones.
Joaquin sueña con brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, darles una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Joaquín is a member of the Orcasitas Community Bank. He lives in the town of Orcasitas, which is located thirty minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Joaquín is 43 years old and lives with his wife and three children. He and his wife make handcrafted bricks for a living and they count on the help of workers who sell the bricks in their community. Joaquín also works as a vegetable farmer on his plots in the community of Chacco. He needs a loan of $325 that will be used to purchase fertilizer and to pay his workers. Joaquín dreams of providing his children with a good education, giving them economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soil and pay his sales workers

loans.name: Miyagi

texts.es: Miyagi es un joven muy alegre, tiene 20 años y vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes desea ayudar con los gastos familiares, ya que se siente en la responsabilidad de darles una vejez tranquila. Aunque todavía es muy joven, ya ha incursionado en el comercio de aderezos, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y lo hace con mucho gusto, ya que sabe que así puede ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, él divide su tiempo entre su negocio y sus estudios universitarios, los cuales no descuida, ya que quiere ser un buen profesional y no defraudar a sus padres. Lo que más le gusta es que con su negocio evita que sus padres trabajen más de lo necesario y tengan más tiempo para ellos, anhela ver crecer su negocio y tener una tienda muy grande donde pueda vender sus condimentos. Lo más difícil para él es moler, debido a que las espacias molidas cuando vuelan por el aire le irritan los ojos, aun así sabe que tiene que continuar con lo que ha comenzado y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro para salir adelante. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en su primer crédito y espera poder serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es un joven muy atento y alegre, que disfruta de trabajar con las demás socias. Con los mil setecientos nuevos soles que solicita comprará más hierbas y condimentos; además de otro molino para aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Miyagi is a very happy young man. He is 20 years old and lives at home with his parents, whom he wants to help with family expenses and feels responsible for giving them tranquility in old age. Although he is still very young, he already has familiarized himself in the commerce of seasonings. He has seven years experience in the activity and does it with a lot of pleasure since he knows he will be able to help his parents with expenses. He divides his time between his business and his university studies, which he does not neglect because he wants to be a good professional and not disappoint his parents. What he most enjoys is that with the business his parents don't have to work more than what's necessary and they have more time to themselves. His goal is to grow his business and have a very large store where he can sell her seasonings and condiments. Grinding is the most difficult part of his work because the spices can get into the air and irritate his eyes, but he knows that he has to continue what he has started and wants to work very hard to make headway. This is his second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he was very punctual with his first loan and hopes to be timely with this one as well. He is a very attentive and happy young man at his community bank who enjoys working with the other members. With the money he is requesting he will purchase more herbs and spices, as well as another mill to increase his production.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase another mill and more spices

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward A. is an auto mechanic at Siwdo near Cape Coast. Edward has received junior high school education. He is married and has two children. His wife is a seamstress.

Edward has been an auto mechanic since 2008. He is responsible for feeding and clothing his family as well as for fees, bills, etc.

Edward’s loan will be used to buy spare parts. His customers insist that he repairs the vehicles and replaces the necessary parts using his own money and then they pay for his services and other expenses he incurs on the vehicle. He is therefore asking for additional funds to buy spare parts to enhance his work. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest back for the expansion of his trade.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his business

loans.name: Samieh

texts.en: Soumaya is 49 years old and married with three children. She lives in Kfarshima, Mount Lebanon. She has been working as a food provider since 1995, when her mother first taught her the business. Today, she wants to borrow $1000 in order to increase her stock.

loans.use: To increase the stock of her food provider business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is a 44-year-old vendor in the village of Minallo Naguilian, Isabela. She is married to Delfin M. and they were blessed with two children who are now both married. In her youth, Lolita was only able to finish elementary school. Despite this, Lolita strives for the fulfillment of her business dreams. She is requesting a second loan of PHP 10,000 to expand her business. Right now she earns just PHP 500 every week, which is no longer enough to support their daily expenditures. She is hoping to increase her weekly income through the loan and hard work. She knows that through her diligent resourcefulness, she can gradually achieve all her goals in life.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Progreso E Group

texts.es: El grupo “Progreso E”  se encuentran representados por la señora Benedicta Rosa y conformado por 12 miembros que en su mayoría se dedican a diferentes actividades como la venta D. abarrotes en tienda D. barrio, venta D. cosméticos por catálogos, venta D. verdura, desayuno, ropa y ala atención en farmacias. Un porcentaje considerable tiene puesto fijo y la otra parte son ambulantes por lo que la competencia se incrementa en el mercado pero todas saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y sus ganas D. salir adelantes. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas que coadyuven en el crecimiento D. sus negocios y al mejoramiento D. la calida D. vida D. sus familias. A pesar D. ser un grupo nuevo cuentan con experiencia en créditos solidarios por lo que saben administrar bien los fondos otorgados.
texts.en:
The group "Progress E" is represented by Benedicta Rosa and consists of 12 members, who are dedicated to different activities such as the sale of groceries in neighbourhood supermarkets, the sale of cosmetics by catalogue, sale of vegetables, breakfast, clothes, and pharmacy attendants. A considerable percentage have permanent stalls, and the others are door to door who, even because of the competition increasing in the market, know how to move forward thanks to their experience and desire to move forward. The destiny of this finance is for the purchase of grocery items, consumables and tools that help in the growth of their businesses and go to the improvement of the quality of life of their families. In spite of being a new group, they are experienced with loans because of their knowledge of administering well the funds granted to them.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en: Makerita T., 36, is married with 4 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public and village people 4 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (about US $110).  SPBD loans are Makerita’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Lê Thị

texts.en:
T. Lê Thị (1720070541) is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương.  She is married and has one adult child.  To make a living, T. owns & operates a business raising chickens for sale. T. has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  T. is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by T. from TYM Fund.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Christopher Makanga

texts.en:
Christopher is married to Joyce Khehaya and they have four school going children. For the last three years, Christopher has been transporting small goods around Naivasha town with a motorbike.

A friend introduced him to KADET and this will be his first loan. With the proceeds from the loan, he is planning to buy his own motorbike. This will make him self employed and will begin his journey to financial freedom.

In the future, Christopher wants to venture further into the transport business eventually owning a minivan for public transport and increasing his income.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 54 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, quienes aun viven con ella a pesar de la independencia económica que ya poseen. Pero de todas maneras, Flor trata de brindarles sus cuidados como madre. Desde joven se dedicó a la venta de ropa y calzado, ya que trabajó en diversas tiendas comerciales donde ganó experiencia en la actividad comercial. Eso le sirvió para iniciar su propio negocio de zapatos desde su domicilio, donde atiende las diversas demandas de sus vecinos y amistades, quienes continuamente la visitan. Sin embargo, su capital de trabajo fue menguando a consecuencia de los problemas de salud que tuvo, pero no dejo de trabajar y espera pronto recuperar su capital para invertir en mayor cantidad de mercadería, pues desea llevar sus zapatos a otros lugares del país, ya que es muy beneficioso salir fuera de la capital donde la población tiene escasa accesibilidad a diversas prendas y calzado de buena calidad. Por ello, Flor seguirá trabajando con el mismo entusiasmo, pues las ventas es una de las actividades que más le agrada realizar. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, Flor cree que el compromiso que muestran ella y sus compañeras de banco comunal ha sido un factor primordial para progresar en sus diversas actividades, por lo que renueva su compromiso de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Con los 2000 soles que ahora solicita comprará más zapatos para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Flor is 54 years old, married, and has 2 children who still live at home even though they are financially independent. Nonetheless, she still takes care of them as their mother. Flor has been selling clothes and shoes since she was a young woman. She worked in several shops where she gained experience in this business. This eventually led to her decision to start a shoe sales business from her home, where she meets the demands of her neighbors and friends who continually visit.

Lately her working capital has been dwindling as a result of health problems, but she continues to work in order to recoup as much of her investment as possible so that she can buy more merchandise. She hopes to start selling shoes in other parts of the country, especially areas outside of the capital where the population is poor and has limited access to clothing and shoes of good quality. Flor continues to work with a high level of enthusiasm because sales is one of her favorite activities.

This will be Flor’s 10th loan with MFP. She believes the commitment that she and her fellow Communal Bank members have demonstrated has been a key factor in the group’s success. Therefore, Flor renews her promise to make her payments on time. She will use her loan of 2000 soles to purchase more shoes so that she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more shoes for resale

loans.name: Sarat

texts.en:
Mr. Sarat P., age 22, is single and lives with his mother and sisters in a small village outside of Phnom Penh. He has three sisters and one brother.
 
Sarat has been a cell phone vendor for one year. He buys phones in Phnom Penh to resell at his home. He hopes to supplement his existing business by repairing phones and installing cell phone applications and MP3 and MP4 players. Through this new business he will be able to generate additional income to support his family.

Sarat is applying for his first loan of $300 to purchase a computer for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a computer for his business

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a vendor of native cakes that she personally cooks.  She is 45 years old and married with three children.  They are living in the village of Old Centro 1 San Mateo, Isabela. Dolores would like to improve their way of living and she wants her three children to finish their third level of education. Her eldest is Andreo - 21 years old, fourth year college, taking up criminology; Ryan - 20 years old, fourth year high school, and Wowee Roy - 11 years old, sixth grade student. 

Dolores is asking for financial support amounting to PHP5,000 that will be used as working capital for her snack vending business in their village. She lacks capital and is praying for the approval of her loan request from Kiva lenders. Dolores is also hoping that, through her vending business, her family will be uplifted from their poor living situation.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 44-year-old man who lives in Tripoli in northern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Ali has been working as a furniture maker and repairer since 1987. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work and new thread for the furniture. This is his fourth loan cycle and he has always paid on time. 

His previous loan helped him improve his work. Ali is special in his work because he does it well and has experience. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties except in building a network. Ali decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Gull Andam Parye Group

texts.en:
There are four members in this group, which is known as Gull Andam parye. They are seeking to receive funding for their respective businesses, so they are requesting a group loan in the amount of 40,000 Afghani ($825).

Specifically, Gull Andam and Parye would like a loan for their bakery business because they are hoping to open a new shop. Meanwhile, Mohammad Uasof and Fada Mohammad are requesting a loan for their general store business as they need to purchase certain necessary materials for their shop (they note that they have a lot of clients). They express their deep gratitude to all lenders of AFSG and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials for their respective businesses

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 37 year old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Joseph has been working as a carpenter since 1990. He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Joseph has requested a loan.
Jospeh is known for his good work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash to have the required tools for his work. Joseph decided on doing this business because he likes his work and hopes to improve his work.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry tools.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn, 40 years old, is a farmer. She lives with her husband and their three children. Her oldest child is now 20. She does her best to keep her farm in good condition, and she is grateful that her last harvest was good. She is now preparing her land for the next planting, and she needs additional capital to run her farm.

Madelyn joined CEVI and applied for a loan of Php9000, which she would like to use to purchase farm necessities. This loan will help her immensely with the farm, and in turn, improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia trabaja como comerciante de flores en la feria 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto, el esposo trabaja en el interior como chofer. Estas dos actividades son su fuente de ingreso con que se mantienen; en este momento están esperando su primer hijo, la esposa esta embarazada de 7 meses y a pesar de su estado sigue trabajando en su puesto de venta. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona villa Adela de la misma ciudad. 

El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de más flores para la temporada navideña, pues en esta época se vende muchas flores.
 
Es segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Silvia works as a flower vendor at the July 16th Fair in the city of El Alto. Her husband works inland as a driver. These two sources of income help to maintain their household. At the moment, Silvia is expecting her first child. She is 7 months pregnant and continues to work at her vending stall despite her condition. Her home is located in the Villa Adela District of El Alto.

Her loan will be used to buy more flowers for the Christmas season. She sells more merchandise during this time. This is Silvia’s second loan with IMPRO. Her good payment history allows her receive another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more inventory to sell for the Christmas season

loans.name: 12 De Junio Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formó con integrantes del comité La Amistad el cual se dividió para formar dos grupos, de esa forma se inicio el comité 12 de Junio, del barrio Yka´a. Actualmente se encuentra en el 6° ciclo del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya y esta integrado por 15 señoras quienes invierten en distintas actividades.

La señora Carmiña G. se dedica a la venta de ropas y dulces e invirtió el dinero en la compra de remeras, busos, camperas, pantalón, blusas, dulces, entre otros, para el incremento de sus ventas.

La señora Gervacia G. se dedica venta de carbón e invirtió el dinero en la compra de carbón al por mayor para el incremento de sus ventas.

La señora Gladys D. es costurera e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos tales como telas e hilos para la elaboración y venta de sus prendas.

La señora Eva G. se dedica venta de carbón e invirtió el dinero en la compra de carbón al por mayor para el incremento de sus ventas. 

La señora  Edita G. se dedica a la venta de bijouterie e invirtió el dinero en la compra de bijouterie al por mayor para su venta posterior.

La señora Vilma G. se dedica a la venta de comestible e invirtio el dinero en la compra de insumos tales como carnes discos para empanadas, servilletas, verduras, panificados entre otros, para el incremento de su negocio.

La señora Fidencia M. se dedica a la venta de dulces e invirtió el dinero en la compra de dulces varios para ofrecer una mayor cantidad y variedad a sus clientes.

La señora Silvia Agüero se dedica a la venta de ropas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de remeras, busos, camperas, pantalón, blusas, entre otros, para el incremento de sus ventas.

La señora Lucia F. se dedica a la venta de jugos e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de los mismos. 

La señora Anunciación R. tiene un comedor e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para el incremento de su negocio. 

La señora Victoria Riquelme sse dedica a la venta de bijouterie e invirtió el dinero en la compra de bijouterie al por mayor para su venta posterior.

La señora Nancy M. se dedica a la venta cosméticos e invirtió el dinero en la compra de cosméticos varios al por mayor para sus ventas. 

La señora María Vicenta Castillo es costurera e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de estuches para guitarras.

La señora María Gloria Velastiqui es costurera e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de estuches para guitarras.

La señora Mirian Raquel Gomez se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza e invirtió el dinero en la compra de químicos para la elaboración de los mismos.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by members of the “La Amistad” (Friendship) committee which split into two groups. This is how the “12 de Junio” (12th of June) committee of the Yka’a neighborhood was formed. It’s currently in the 6th cycle of the “Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya” (Committee of Enterprising Women of the Paraguayan Foundation) and is made up of 15 women who perform different activities. Ms. Carmiña sells clothes and candies. She used her money to buy t-shirts, hoodies, jackets, pants, tops, and candy, among other things, so that she can increase her sales. Ms. Gervacia sells charcoal and used her money to buy bulk charcoal in order to increase her sales. Ms. Gladys is a seamstress and she used her money to buy supplies, such as fabric and thread for the manufacture and sale of her garments. Ms. Eva sells charcoal and she used her money to buy bulk charcoal to be able to increase her sales. Ms. Edita sells miscellaneous household items and she used her money to buy items in bulk for resale. Ms. Vilma sells foods and she used her money to buy meats, empanada rings, napkins, vegetables, and baked goods in order to increase her business. Ms. Fidencia sells candies and she used her money to buy various kinds of candy in bulk, in order to be able to offer a greater variety to her customers. Ms. Silvia sells clothing and she used her money to buy t-shirts, hoodies, jackets, pants, and tops, among other things, in order to increase her sales. Ms. Lucia sells juices and she used her money to buy juice-making supplies to make and sell juices. Ms. Anunciación has a food stall and she used her money to buy supplies for her business. Ms. Victoria sells general household goods and she used her money to buy more items in order to increase her sales. Ms. Nancy sells cosmetics and she used her money to buy more cosmetics in order to increase her sales. Ms. María V. is a seamstress and she used her money to buy supplies to make guitar cases. Ms. María G is also a seamstress and she also used her money to buy supplies to make guitar cases. Ms. Mirian sells cleaning products and she used her money to buy chemicals for their manufacture.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various items and supplies for manufacture and resale

loans.name: Abdusamat

texts.en:
Abdusamat is dedicated to raising animals, primarily cattle, which he buys and sells at commercial city markets. This work is very agreeable to him, since raising animals is the trade he has enjoyed most ever since he was a young boy. Nevertheless, Abdusamat has other jobs as well, and one of these is farming. He grows potatoes and onions in their respective seasons, and he is diligent about taking into account the bad weather that could damage his crops.

Abdusamat requires a certain amount of money in order to increase the number of his cattle. His goal is to increase his herd and thereby not only remain solvent but actually increase his household income. He wishes to continue his trade in buying and selling animals.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history. It was a key post along the Silk Road and was the site of the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country, home to epic mountain passes, contains communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and its civilization dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve the country’s agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth M. is a 44 year old widow with no children.  She has been operating her green grocery shop in Ndabibi which is on the outskirts of Naivasha town for the last three years.

Ruth was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her second loan.  She plans to buy more variety of goods for sale like oranges, pawpaw,(a large edible berry), pineapple and mangoes which are in season.

Ruth plans to expand her business and also run a fruit salad shop on the side in the near future.

loans.use: Buy more fruits for sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Trabajadoras” se formó con la unión varias vecinas del barrio Santa Librada, de la ciudad de Villa Elisa. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas.
 Las integrantes formaron un grupo  muy unido y capaz de realizar actividades en forma conjunta, ya que la mayoría de sus integrantes se dedican a la venta, siendo así la mayoría de ellas, colegas entre si.
Todas las integrantes del comité son madres que se dedican a dichas actividades con el fin de fortalecer la economía de la casa y desarrollar sus emprendimientos de manera sustentable. 
Así como la señora Ramona B. quien se dedica a la venta de ropas, ella viaja hasta el mercado 4 de la ciudad de Asunción, para comprar su mercaderías y revenderlo en su barrio de la Ciudad de Villa Elisa. La venta lo realiza visitando a clientes de diferentes zona y actualmente ya cuenta con muchos clientes quienes pagan en forma semanal o mensual por la mercaderías que ella les ofrece y vende.
Se citan las actividades que ellas realizan:

texts.en:
The “Working Mothers” Committee was formed by uniting various neighbors in the Santa Librada barrio of the city of Villa Elisa. All committee members carry out activities independently, as are their sales. The members make up a very united group, capable of acting together. Since the majority are dedicated to sales, they are actually colleagues. All committee members are mothers who are dedicated to their activities for the purpose of strengthening the household economy and developing their enterprises in a sustainable manner. One example is Mrs. Ramona B. who sells colothes. She travels to Market 4 in the city of Asunción to buy merchandise and resell it in her barrio in the City of Villa Elisa. To do this, she visits customers in different zones and, actually, she can count on many customers who pay weekly or monthly for her merchandise. Here are their activities: 1 Ramona B. Clothing sales 2 Daniela A. Sells meals 3 Evelyn M. Provisions store 4 Arninda B. Sells fruit 5 Olga A. Lottery sales 6 Aida S. Sells drinks 7 Leonora V. Provisions store 15 Alejandra V. Sells fruit 16 Ana María C. Lottery sales 17 Sonia C. Sells drinks 18 Valentina D. Café

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING T-SHIRTS, DRESSES, BLOUSES, PANTS, HOSE, AND SHORTS TO SELL

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria C. is from Grace Village, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 59 years old. Maria is married and has eight adult children. To make a living, Maria owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling a variety of different products in the local community. Maria has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Oladayo

texts.en:
Oladayo is 35 years old and married with four children, living in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. Her children attend school and this gives her great joy, as she hopes they become graduates in the future.

Her husband sells bags of cement to support their family, while she sells foodstuffs and groceries. Oladayo hopes to grow her business and is requesting a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to lift her business and family above poverty. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Germelina

texts.en: Germelina P.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She is 41 years old, married and has three grown-up children. She is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Germelina has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Germelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Germelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used for additional capital for her business. Germelina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Believe Usef Ii Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Believe Usef II” group from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Members of this group are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,500,000 from Kiva lenders in order to invest in their businesses. 

Thirty-eight-year-old Adama K. (pictured in the middle) is the leader of the group. She was born in Waterloo, is married to a soldier, and they have four children – one of her children is in senior secondary school II, one in JSS I, one in class V and the last is in nursery school. Adama has been a businesswoman for more than twenty years now. She sells dried fish. With her share of this loan (SLL 500,000), she will expand her business by buying basketsfull of dried fish to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy baskets full of dried fish to add to her current stock

loans.name: Precious

texts.en:
Precious lives in Lagos, married and have five children. She is been a LAPO client for over four years now. With her loan from LAPO micro finance she was able to manage her business very well.
54 years old Precious sells biscuit in wholesale and retail to costumers in her locality and has been in this trade for over five years. She is asking for a loan of NGN50, 000 to purchase more biscuit in cartons to sell, this she said will lead to reduction in price thereby increasing her profit and will also enable her meet the demand of customers. She says with the increase in profit, her family will be better cared for. Thanks to all Kiva lenders for their good work

loans.use: To purchase more biscuit in cartons to sell

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en:
Chhuon T. is 62 years old and lives in Phnom Penh. She currently produces and sells natural medicine to earn a living. The medicine is made from many kinds of tree roots. Normally, she buys the root from the people who carve from the forest. She then makes the medicine and sells it to patients. She earns an average of $4 per day and has been in this business for many years. 


Chhuon T. has three children; two of them are now married and the other one is single and works in a garment factory.  This is the third loan she has requested.  Chhuon T. will use this loan to buy a plot of land to resolve the issue of polluted water which is affecting her health and her daily living conditions. She will use the rest of the loan to mend her old house.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land to address the issue of polluted water

loans.name: Patria

texts.en:
Patria P. is from the village of Tubod, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 64 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Patria owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Patria has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from this activity.
In 2004, Patria joined PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Patria is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her eighth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products of her General store to sell

loans.name: Exode Plus Group

texts.en:
Exode Plus is a community bank made up of 20 members whose chairwoman is Mireille. These members are united in the same goal: to grow their businesses through loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC.

Mireille runs a restaurant to the north of the city of Kinshasa. She began her business in 2002 with startup capital of $20. After hard work and good management, she succeeded in making the restaurant thrive thanks to her accumulated profits. The business now gives her a profit of $40 per day. She intends to expand it with the next loan by adding soft drinks. Mireille is 36 years old, married and the mother of four children whose ages range from 10 to 20 years old. All of them attend school.

loans.use: diversifying her business by adding soft drinks to resell at profit

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mr. Chea P. (in the photo) is 36 years old and his wife, Mrs. Mala Chhoung, is 32 years old. They have been married since 1996 and have four children: one son and three daughters. All of them are in school. The family is living in a suburb of Phnom Penh City.  

Chea has been driving a motor taxi for more than five years. He drives in Phnom Penh. His wife has been a garment-factory worker for two years. Besides these occupations, the couple also operates a business by renting out a space of their house. 

Chea does not have a proper restroom to use in his family, so he is asking for his first loan in the amount of $300 in order to build a restroom.

loans.use: To build a restroom for his family to use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a mill to grind corn and meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more plastic chairs, umbrellas, and drinks

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda P. is from the village of Cabisera 8. She is 51 years old. Luzviminda is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Luzviminda owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Luzviminda has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Luzviminda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Luzviminda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
El señor Tomas tiene 32 años de edad es casado con la señora hace 10 años atrás, viven en Colomi Comunidad Duraznos Pampa más de 6 años, tienen dos hijos con edad de 9 y de 7 años que estudian en nivel primaria.                                                                                                             
El señor y su esposa nos cuentan que mas antes vivían en el Municipio de Ayopaya lo cual no tenían suficiente recursos económicos ni para el estudio de sus hijos, porque en el rubro a la que se dedicaban producción agrícola les fue mal, mucha enfermedad en sus cultivos que causaron pérdidas totales; De tal modo el señor Tomas  y su esposa se decidieron trasladarse a la comunidad de Duraznos Pampa dentro del Municipio de Colomi, ahora que económicamente no tienen ningún problema siembran papa, locoto llevan a vender a la feria semanal de Colomi y variedad de verduras para la alimentación de su familia, ellos se apersonaron a la oficina de CIDRE a solicitar un préstamo para comprar un camión de abono orgánico (gallinaza) y productos agroquímicos, con el dinero que tenia compro un vehículo y para la siembra no tienen capital para comprar los insumos agrícolas, ellos piensan no volver más a la comunidad donde vivían mas antes.
texts.en:
Tomas, age 32, has been married to Carmen for ten years. They have lived in Colomi in the Duraznos Pampa community for over six years. They have two children, ages nine and seven. The children go to elementary school. He and his wife tell us that they used to live in the Ayopaya municipality. It did not have sufficient economic resources, not even for their children’s education. In their area, farming production, it went very poorly for them. There were a lot of diseases in their crops, which caused total losses. Therefore, Tomas and his wife decided to move to the Duraznos Pampa community in the Colomi municipality. Now they do not have financial problems planting potatoes and chilies. They take them to sell at the weekly fair in Colomi, and an assortment of vegetable is for feeding their family. They came to CIDRE’s office to request a loan to buy a truckload of organic fertilizer (poultry manure) and agrochemical products. They used the money they had to buy a vehicle, and they do not have the money to buy agricultural supplies for planting. They do not plan on returning to the community where they used to live.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and seeds for their agricultural activity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Didas

texts.en: Didas is a father to five children. They are all above nine years of age and live in Fort Portal, Uganda. Besides having his own children, he has other dependants he is looking after. He also owns a house where he lives with his family but it has not stopped him from having a family dream, which is to educate his children and improve his household income.  Didas distills alcohol. He has been in this business for five years and hasn’t seen any hardships at the moment, making him believe in expanding his business in the near future. He needs the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with two grown children. She is a market entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. Yelena sells children’s footwear in the local market called ‘Yubileinyi’. Yelena has been working in this sphere for thirteen years. Presently, she has about 35,000 UAH invested in this business. Her monthly gross income is about $2800. 

Yelena is requesting a 12,000 UAH loan to increase her turnover capital and purchase assorted winter boots for children. Yelena’s merchandise is always in demand. The current loan will enable her to buy additional inventory in bulk. Yelena is always on the lookout for good prices from suppliers that will allow her to make a profit. By having an adequate amount of capital available, she can maximize her opportunities and continue developing a solid business.

loans.use: to increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Christiana Davi Akponah

texts.en: Christiana Davi Akponah G. operates a food joint (a place where people come to eat) near Ntranoa at Elmina. She has attained a senior high level of education. Christiana is married to a prison officer. Demand for her food is high and she is looking to expand her business. She plans to reinvest the new profits into her business, so she can increase her operations.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Lebanese Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and three siblings. He is a proud new business owner. He opened a vegetable and fruits shop in his town two years ago. This talented man planned to expand his business level so he decided to add a small grocery corner to increase his sales. And that’s how he will present two services to the clients in parallel. He has made some savings and he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase merchandise to realize this target. In the future, he plans to diversify his business and open a grocery store to enlarge his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ruzi

texts.en:
Ruzi, who is married and has three children, makes his living selling foodstuffs at his grocery store. His location is very good and he serves many customers because he is willing to work late. In this business for 16 years, he knows a good deal about it. Ruzi is also a very punctual and detail-oriented person, character traits that help him in his business. Ruzi can always figure out how many supplies he needs to ensure they are always fresh and of sufficient quantity to meet customer needs. Ruzi has applied for a loan to increase his inventory of items to sell. He will spend the additional income made possible by this loan to improve his living conditions.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes its role as a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Rosalind

texts.en:
Rosalind B. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 48 years old. Rosalind is widowed and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosalind owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Rosalind has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosalind joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalind is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like biscuits & junk foods. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosalind from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the  business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like biscuits & junk foods

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: El sr. Freddy de 25  años de edad soltero, vive en la zona de Huayllani , vive en la casa de sus padres , es joven independiente, tiene su taxi esta afiliado a un radio móvil,  trabaja de lunes a sábado de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 22:00, el ayuda a su padres en los gastos del hogar, es un joven muy responsable ,  el préstamo lo destinara para la refacción y mantenimiento de  su movilidad  es muy trabajador y dedicado a su familia, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado .
texts.en:
Freddy is 25 years old, single, and lives in Huayllani, in his parents' home.  He is an independent young man.  He owns a taxi and is affiliated with a radio taxi company.  He works from Monday to Saturday, from 6.00am to 10.00pm, and helps his parents with their household expenses.  He is a very responsible young man.

Freddy will use his loan to have his car refurbished and to have some maintenance work done on it.  He is a very hard-working man who is dedicated to his family.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him.

loans.use: To have his car refurbished and to have some maintenance work done on it

loans.name: Kishwar Tahira's Group

texts.en:
Kishwar tahira is a resident of the small city of Kasur in Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its tannery industry. She owns a two-room house there and lives in it with her family. 

Her husband's name is S. A., and he is involved in a clothing business. He sells clothes through a shop located in the market. He sells specifically ladies' clothes there and manages a good clientele base. Kishwar helps him by selling clothes to ladies in her community. Their good collection of clothes has made them renowned among their customers. Kishwar is an active lady, and carries out her responsibilities as a housewife well and takes care of her family.
 
She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy clothing of different varieties in bulk quantities. The bulk purchasing will enable him to offer more variety to his customers and will increase his sales. Kishwar is confident that through the loan investment her husband’s business will become more profitable. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kishwar tahira.

loans.use: To buy clothes for a clothing business

loans.name: Mrs. So Sreyneang Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of fifteen people who are living in Veay Chhneah village, Takeo province. Mrs. So S. has been selected as the village bank president by the other members, who will use their portions of the loan in various ways to support their families. Mrs. So S. is a mother of two children; one is enrolled in local public school, and the other is 1 year old.  She is a hammock maker who is able to earn some money to help support her famiL.. Her husband, Mr. Kosorl Yoem, is a motorbike taxi driver. She has a problem because her husband’s motorbike is now too old to use. So to improve this situation, Mrs. So S. is seeking a loan to buy a new motorbike to use as a taxi to instead this old one.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for use as a taxi

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia D. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old. Artemia is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Artemia owns & operates a business raising crops.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Artemia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Artemia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Artemia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used for additional capital for her business. Artemia is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Artemia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Ung

texts.en: Ung P. resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. P. sells cow ties, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman, earning USD 5.3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 120 on other necessary expenses. P. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more fabric to produce cow ties to sell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make and sell cow ties

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora, de 63 años; es una mujer extraordinaria. Pues a pesar de su edad sigue trabajando para poder salir adelante, ya que sus hijos propia formaron su familia, y ahora son independientes. Actualmente trabaja y vive en su casa propia ubicada en las afueras de la ciudad de San Ramón (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica está abnegada mujer es la venta de frutas de toda variedad. Constantemente viaja a la ciudad de Tarma, donde vende frutas al menudeo, pues en la sierra del país no se encuentran estas frutas, por ello en cada viaje que realiza le brinda buenas ganancias. Asimismo se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como gallinas, patos y cuyes, que también son animales muy escasos en la selva central, por ella la venta de carne de estos animales obtiene regulares ganancias mayores al dinero invertido. Lo que más le gusta, es “trabajar”, pues le gusta mantenerse ocupada, es por eso que ahora tiene planeado sembrar mango, con lo que podrá variar la venta de diferentes frutas. Según menciona son pocos los que se dedican en la siembra de este fruto y las temporadas de cosecha y maduración son una vez al año; por lo que es muy cotizado en el mercado. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las brisas”, y este es el octavo crédito que tiene con MFP, donde se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibe.
