Teodora, con el crédito que solicita comprará varias frutas para poder comercializarlas en la ciudad de Tarma.
texts.en:
Teodora is 63 years old and an extraordinary woman.  Despite her age she continues to work to get ahead since her children have formed their own families and are independent.  She works and lives in her own home on the outskirts of the city of San Ramón (Peruvian central forest).  This self-sacrificing woman works selling all types of fruit.  She travels constantly to the city of Tarma where she sells fruit retail.  The type of fruit she sells is hard to find in the mountain area so she makes a good profit everytime she travels there.  

She also raises small animals such as hens, ducks and guinea pigs, which are also scarce in the central forest.  Income on sales of these types of animals is greater than money invested.  What she enjoys most about "working" is that it keeps her active; so now she is planning to grow mangos to add variety to her fruit range.  She says few people grow this type of fruit and the ripening and harvest season are once a year so the market price is high.

She belongs to the communal bank, "Las brisas".  This is her eighth loan through MFP, to which she is grateful for the support received.

Teodora plans to use the loan to buy a variety of fruit to sell in the city of Tarma.

loans.use: To buy wholesale fruit

loans.name: Ayozu

texts.en: Ayozu Cathernien is 28 years old and is currently in the business of running a food market. She is married to a student, and they have two children, all of whom  are getting schooling. Her future goal is to take care about her children's education costs.

loans.use: stock more food in the market for resale

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 47 years old, married to Regina, and a father of five children. He operates a stall at the Gikomba market, where he sells second hand shoes. This is his primary business and he has been doing it for the last eleven years. Gikomba market is relatively busy in terms of business and has a high population as well. This is favorable for his business.

This is his first loan with KADET and he plans to buy four bales of shoes for resale. He hopes that the returns he gets will be help him to expand his business further and give his family a better life.
 
In the future, he hopes to open a wholesale store for new shoes and distribute to other retailers.

loans.use: to buy four bales of shoes.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Hay un lugar conocido como la comunidad de Arin este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En esta comunidad de Arin conocimos a la señora Susana de 62 años de edad, tiene su pareja y fruto de esta relación tiene seis hijos, vive con su pareja en su casa propia que cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la provincia de Calca, que pertenece al departamento del Cusco. Esta zona tiene como actividad principal la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Susana se dedica a la confección de ropa y también se dedica al cultivo de maíz y hortalizas, ella tiene varias chacras y están cerca de su casa. Posteriormente vende sus productos una vez que hayan llegado a su tamaño en los diferentes mercados de las ciudades de Calca, Urubamba, Cusco y a pobladores que la conocen y asi incrementando sus ingresos y obteniendo cosas que le hacen falta en su casa. Ella confecciona ropa como mandiles, faldas, vestidos y buzos para sus caseras.   

El crédito que ha solicitado Susana es de 1000 nuevos soles a Asociación Arariwa, será destinado para la compra de maíz. Susana es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa que siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida y poder tener lo que quiere.
texts.en:
In the city of Calca, located in the Cusco department, there is a community known as Arin. This place is known for its beautiful landscapes, its food and the warmth of its people.

We met Susana in the community of Arin. She is 62 years of age and has six children to her partner. She and her partner live in their own house which has water and electricity. It is located in the province of Calca, which is part of the Cusco department. The main fields of work in this area are agriculture, cattle farming and tourism.

Susana makes clothes and grows corn and vegetables. She has a lot of farmland close to her home. Once they are fully grown she sells her produce in the different markets of Calca, Urubamba, Cusco and other small villages, and with these sales she has increased her income and bought necessary items for her home. Susana also makes aprons, skirts, dresses and jumpers to wear around the home.

Susana has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from the organisation Asociación Arariwa, which she will use to purchase corn. Susana is determined, hardworking and has always known how to get ahead to have what she wants and improve her life.

loans.use: to purchase corn.

loans.name: Brayan Josue

texts.es:
Brayan, es empleado y comercializa ropa, vive con su esposa y una hija de 6 años, él trabaja todos los días de 2:00pm en delante en una funeraria, el demás tiempo lo dedica a vender ropa.
Actualmente necesita invertir en mercadería, comprando prendas de vestir casual, femenina y para niños, con esta inversión está en mejores condiciones para ofrecer a los clientes.
Su objetivo es tener una fuente de ingreso constante para ayudar a su joven familia, e ir progresando juntos para alcanza una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Brayan is employed and he also sells clothing. He lives with his wife and 6-year-old daughter and works everyday starting at 2:00pm at a funeral parlor. He spends the rest of his time selling clothing.

He currently needs to invest in merchandise, buying casual wear as well as women’s and children’s clothing. With this investment, he will be in a better condition to sell to his customers.

His goal is to have a constant source of income to support his young family and to continue moving forward together to achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy casual wear and women's and children's clothing.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov is a single mother caring for four children. She was married years ago, but she divorced her husband. 

Three of her children are making a profit in different jobs while the other attends the local school.
 
She is a sacrificing and determined woman who tries to earn hard cash to ensure her children attain the highest level. To earn a living, she sells a few fish-pastes to villagers and the neighbors in the village, Baray district. 

Pov will be using a loan to buy a used motorcycle for her child to run a motor taxi service. This will allow her to gain more income and she will be able to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for her child to run a motor taxi service.

loans.name: Olga Piedad

texts.es:
Olga Piedad tiene 26 años, es soltera vive con los padres en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. No Tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  SAGRADO CORAZON  se encuentra ubicada en el sector Cuatro Esquinas perteneciente al cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 12 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y a la comercialización de los mismos y otras actividades que da utilidades.

Olga se dedica a la agricultura siembra papas, trigo, maíz, además se dedica a la comercialización de legumbres. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es tener terrenos propios y comprar una casa.

Le gusta dedicarse al hogar.
texts.en:
Olga Piedad is 26, single, and she lives with her parents in the Guaranda canton, Bolivar province.  She doesn't have any children.

The members are with the Sagrado Corazon communal bank, located in Cuatro Esquinas, in the Guaranda province, 15 minutes from the cooperative's office. This branch is made up of 12 members who work in farming, animal raising and sales of both and other useful activities.

Olga grows potatoes, wheat, corn and also sells beans.  She purchases them in Guaranda and sells them to a wholesaler in the same city.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for the farming and she will use the loan for what she needs.  She faces problems with plant disease with the crops.  Her dream is to have her own fields and to buy a house.

She likes to work in her home.

loans.use: To buy supplies for farming

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih has been running his own plumbing business since 2004 and has more than 10 years of experience working in this field. He is a 30-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and three school-aged children. He works independently and takes on projects in private homes and businesses. He is the main income source for the family. 

Today, Rabih is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. to invest in purchasing new materials needed for his projects. This may include pipes, bathroom fixtures, etc. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits by 25%.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing new materials needed for his projects.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, aged 47, is married to Jane and they are blessed with five children. He does welding services and his business has been in operation for 10 years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES.8,000.

This is his fourth loan with KADET LTD and he has a good credit history. He will use the funds to buy a new welding machine.


David intends to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children and hopes to own a piece of land in future.

loans.use: To buy a new welding machine.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha, who is 31 years old, married to Peter and the mother of five children, has operated a retail shop for the last three years. She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be her second loan with which she plans to buy more goods to sell in her shop.

In the future, Martha hopes to expand her business into a wholesale operation.

loans.use: to buy more retail goods to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Daisy Patricia

texts.es:
La señorita Daisy tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres. Su padre se dedica al trasporte público, tiene buen ingreso económico, y es el quien siempre la apoya en todos sus emprendimientos y sueños.
Ella está cursando el segundo ciclo del Curso Probatorio de Admisión en la carrera de Contaduría Publica en la Universidad Nacional de Asunción. Ella se define como una joven llena de sueños, anhelos y esperanzas, tiene como propósito culminar sus estudios dentro de cuatro años aproximadamente, recibir su título y ejercer su profesión de manera a poder ayudar a sus padres retribuyéndoles todo lo que ellos dieron por ella en pos de su educación.
Ella solicita el crédito para el pagos de los gastos de la universidad, y la compra de materiales de estudios. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da para poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Daisy is 19 years old, is single, and lives with her parents. Her father works in public transportation, has a good income, and always supports her in her endeavors and dreams. She is in the second semester of Probationay Admission Course for the career of Public Accounting at the National University of Asuncion. She sees herself as a young person with many dreams, wishes, and hopes. She intends to complete her studies in about four years, receive her diploma and work in her profession in a way that allows her to help her parents, repaying all that they've done for her towards her education. She asks for a loan to pay the university fees and to buy study materials. She thanks the Fundacion for the opportunity which allows her to move forward in her studies.

loans.use: to pay for university expenses and to buy study materials.

loans.name: José Iván

texts.es:
En  la ciudad de Managua el  señor José D.  se dedica a laborar como jardinero en una empresa de esta ciudad , casado con cuatro personas a su cargo  las que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias . 
Una de las necesidades que el señor atraviesa hoy en dia es que debe mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda debido a que ha estado en malas condiciones por lo que ha tomado la decisión  de iniciar la obra de mejora. es por este motivo que acude a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construccioncomo zinc, perlines para iniciar la mejora de la vivienda realizando el cambio de techo y por medio de esta obra brindara mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos y esposa .
Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta obra le proporciona a su familia un techo digno donde vivir y con todas las condiciones necesarias
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, José Diaz works as a gardener at a company. He is married and has four people in his charge, and he has to provide for them.

One of the needs he has is that he must improve the conditions of his house. It is in bad condition which is why he has decided to begin improving it. This is the reason that he has come to Ceprodel to apply for a loan to buy construction materials such as tin roofing and roof beams, so that he can start to improve his house. He will change the roof to provide better living conditions for his children and wife.

It is important to mention that by doing this work he will provide his family with a dignified home to live in with all of the necessary conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a determined businesswoman aged 35. She is married and blessed with four children who are still in school. For the last three years, she has been managing a grocery shop to earn a living. She also sells clothes to supplement her income. In the next five years, she wants to become successful in her business. Her dream is to buy  a lorry for transporting fruits to other markets. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy fruits.

loans.use: To buy fruits.

loans.name: Neema C Group

texts.en:
Eunice is the facilitator of the Neema C group, in the Chwele district of Western Kenya. Eunice and her group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Eunice and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

Eunice takes care of two children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to ensure food security for her family and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the 2011 season, Eunice had an excellent maize yield harvesting 16 bags on three quarters of an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest five bags of maize on that land. 

With income from maize sales, Eunice will educate her children and pay back her loan. 

In 2012, the members of Neema C group will each plant maize plots between ½ and one acre of land. 

In the photograph above, Eunice is pictured with her group members, plus a child of one of the group members.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Carmeliselda

texts.en: Carmeliselda is 30 years old and has been engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business for almost a year. She needs to buy grocery items to sell or it is going to be empty. For this reason, she is asking a loan of P5,000 to buy eggs, cooking oil, bottled anchovies and canned goods as additional goods to sell. She hopes, through the help of this loan, she will accumulate enough money to repair her store and provide the necessities needed by her only child -- her usual companion in her store. In the future, she hopes for the improvement of their status of living.

loans.use: to buy eggs, cooking oil, bottled anchovies and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Sixta Irene

texts.es:
La señora Sixta tiene 41 años D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. ropas en un salón, está casada con el Sr. Domingo D. 45 años , quien se dedica a la reparación D. relojes y joyas, el cual le ayuda con los gastos familiares, ellos tienen dos hijos.
Sixta inició su actividad hace más D. 20 años, vendiendo ropas con su suegra, después ella empezó su negocio en forma ambulante recorriendo casa por casa, por la ciudad y luego D. esto y gracias al dinero que pudo juntar abrió su propio local D. venta con muy buena ubicación, y hoy en dia cuenta con clientela formada y les provee a los vendedores ambulantes en la actualidad. Es muy valorada por su actitud emprendedora, pues desD. muy joven se ha dedicado a la venta D. dicho producto, gracias a eso y a su buena administración está pudiendo tener una mejor calidad D. vida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. prendas, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y a la vez abastecer a los demás proveedores.
texts.en:
Sixta, 41, has a clothing store.  She’s married to Domingo, 45, who is a watch and jewelry repairman and helps her cover household expenses; they have two children.

Sixta started her work more than 20 years ago selling clothes with her mother-in-law.  Later she started selling door to door throughout the city and after that and thanks to money she was able to save she opened her own store in a good location.  Today, she has a well-established clientele and she supplies the city’s street vendors.  She is very well-liked because of her enterprising attituD. because she’s been selling this product since a very young age.  Thanks to that and her good management she’s being able to have a better quality of life.

The loan will be used to buy clothes to stock up and also to stock other sellers.

loans.use: to buy clothes for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Sulaiman.  He is married to a small-scale trader who earns Le500,000 every month and has four children aged 18, 14, 10 and 3 years. Three are school-going children.  Sulaiman has two additional dependents, who live with him because they were brought by his spouse in order to assist them in their schooling. 

 In 2006, Sulaiman established his used clothing business.  He began his business to help him get a source of income to provide a livelihood for his family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,000,000 every month from this business.  He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 

Sulaiman has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and he now requires a new loan in order to purchase baseball shirts - 1 bale @ Le3,200,000 and skirts - 1 bale @ Le1,600,000 while the balance of Le200,000 will be used for transportation.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000.

 In the future, Sulaiman plans to have his own houses and to educate his children to university level.  This loan will help him to improve his business.  He serves about 40 customers around town.  His business is popular because he sells  quality used clothing; he has good interpersonal relationships with his customers.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase baseball shirts and skirts and pay for transportation.

loans.name: Jose Leonel

texts.es:
el sr. José Leonel tiene 38 años de edad, esta casado y es padre de 2 hijos, actualmente Jose tiene 1 manzanas de café cosechera, a la vez cuenta con una pulpería que son su fuente de ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y cumplir con compromisos adquiridos.
Jose utilizara el credito para la compra de un panel de energia solar, su comunidad esta se encuentra montaña adentro y se dificulta poder contar con el servicio de energía eléctrica, mismo servicio que es muy importante para el desarrollo y educación de los pueblos, una vez ya cancelado este sistema solar piensa seguir solicitando creditos para que se le apoye para su negocio y mantenimiento de su finca.   
gracias a este panel solar podra instalar luz en su pulperia y asi podra atender a sus clientes por mas horas durante la noche.
texts.en:
Sr. José Leonel is 38 years old, married and the father of 2 children.  José currently has 1 hectare of coffee plants as well as a small grocery.  The two are his sources of income for covering the family's expenses and meeting his financial obligations. 
José will use the loan to purchase a solar energy panel.  His community is located in the mountains and they can't count on electrical services.  Electricity is very important for the development and education of the villages.  Once he has paid off his solar system, José plans to continue taking out loans to support his business and maintain his farm. 
Thanks to the solar panel, José will be able to bring light into his grocery and thereby be able to be open for his customers later into the night.

loans.use: to purchase a solar panel.

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en: Sokhorn, 47, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Sokhorn and her husband sell fish. Sokhorn is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase a motorbike to transport fish to sell. By doing so, her family will be able to decrease their expenses for public transportation. In the future, Sokhorn would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport fish to sell

loans.name: Mildrey María

texts.es: La señora Mildrey a sus 28 años de edad es madre de un hijo de 8 años, trabaja en semana vendiendo pautas publicitarias de un periódico del corregimiento de san Félix ubicado al norte de Antioquia; paralelo a este trabajo y con el animo de tener mayores ingresos, la señora Mildrey arrendó hace seis meses un local en el cual trabaja de viernes a domingo ofreciendo servicios de venta de licor. La señora Mildrey requiere de la compra de licor tal como cerveza, además gaseosa y snacks con el fin de tener su negocio con mayor variedad y surtido. El sueño de la señora Mildrey es tener su propia tienda e independizarse de tiempo completo en su propio negocio para poder compartir mucho más tiempo con su hijo.
texts.en:
Señora Mildrey is 28 years old, and the mother of an 8-month-old son.  During the week, she works selling advertising for a newspaper in San Félix, which is located to the north of Antioquia.  Alongside this work, and with the intent of earning greater income, Señora Mildrey has rented premises for the last six months where she works from Friday through Sunday selling liquor.  

Señora Mildrey wants to purchase alcoholic beverages such as beer, also sodas and snacks, with the end goal of having more variety in her business and being better stocked.  

Señora Mildrey's dream is to have her own store and to work full-time independently in her own business, so that she can spend much more time with her son.

loans.use: to stock up on alcoholic beverages.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en: Romeo has been involved in business for many years. He is an experienced farmer. He is involved in growing agricultural crops. Working on land is hard labor that requires a lot of effort and funds to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds. Romeo wants to obtain this loan to plant corn crops and gather his harvest. Currently, Romeo is teaching the farming business to his sons. He knows that the land will always provide a good harvest if you work hard enough.

loans.use: to buy seed corn and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Sela

texts.en:
Sela is married and she's 47 years of age. She has two children.

Sela owns and operates a business venture, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has three years of experience in this business.    

Sela  needs a loan of WST 2,000 to purchase snacks, soft drinks, flour, sugar, salt, tin fish, mosquito coils and chicken leg quarters. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 450 or US $188 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Sela  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Sela 's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, soft drinks, flour, sugar, salt , tin fish, mosquito coils and chicken.

loans.name: Majuma

texts.en:
Majuma is 63 years old, married to Raphael, and has three children. She has been running a goat selling business for the last two years earning a monthly income of 5000  Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

She is requesting her second loan with KADET ltd of 20,000 KES. She will use the loan to purchase goats for resale. With the anticipated profits she will save to open a butcher shop. 

Her hopes and dreams are to become a leader in the goat sales business.

loans.use: To purchase goats for sale

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
 
Arlene has a shop that sells homemade sausage or longganisa. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 9,000 Philippines pesos to buy raw ingredients needed for making homemade sausage.

Arlene has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making homemade sausage.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Through the years, it has come to Lydia's realization that she can not bank on only teacher remuneration to bring a desired value to her life and that of her 3 kids.
It was after lots of stock taking that she decided she had to open up an auxiliary source of income.
3 years ago is when 32 year old Lydia ventured into a liquor store business in Bushenyi.
In many respects, this business has financially empowered her and enabled her open up new horizons as regards the provision of better welfare to her family.
Lydia also ekes out more income from Farming.
She says she will use her loan money to purchase better liquor making drums and high grade manure to improve the fertility of her farm and  her crop yields.

loans.use: to improve the fertility of her farm and her crop yields.

loans.name: Amna

texts.en:
Amna is 33years old married woman and a mother of four children. Amna is a house wife living with her spouse in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Amna husband’s works hard to support her family. He has Suzuki loader for transportation services in the Multan, Pakistan. 
Amna is borrowing 70,000 PKR through BRAC Pakistan in order to buy a new Suzuki loader for her husband’s transportation services business.
Amna has been sustaining her husband’s business activities through her past one loan from BRAC Pakistan. 
Amna and her family will be thankful to the KIVA, lender s and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy suzuki loader for her husband

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar P., originally from Riobamba, Ecuador, is a 39 year old salesman with two children, eight and five years old. Mr. P. is a homeowner. His business is located in a section of Guayaquil called Bastión Popular, and it has been in operation for seven years. His wife helps him with sales and administrative work from 6:00 am until 6:00 pm. Edgar is in charge of managing some customers’ weekly credit tabs, although most customers pay cash for his goods on the spot. He needs this loan money to be able to buy other products like watches, lamps, bed sheets, and other home items. Mr. P. thinks this loan will also help financially because he can receive a discount from wholesalers if he buys in bulk and pays in cash. Lastly, Edgar wants lenders to know that he is a hard-working entrepreneur.

loans.use: Buy more inventory and diversify supply

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en:
Mahir is a hard-working person. He has been running as a hairdresser for 15 years. He made all efforts to improve his business. His hairdressing saloon attracts a lot of cliens.
In the beginning of his business he borrowed a loan of $400 and bought a clipper, perfume, soaps.
Now he requests a loan of $800 to do capital repaires in his own hairdressing saloon.
Mahir is 43, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region Yaglikend village, settled on front line in Fizuli region, married, has 2 children.

loans.use: To do capital repaires in his own Barber shop

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Nkurankan, Ghana is a large market centre for the people of the Yilo Krobo District of Ghana. Madame K. is a resident of this town and sells fruits such as banana, pawpaw (papaya), oranges, and watermelon. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation, and is seeking a Kiva loan of $750.00 to help her improve her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mutluba

texts.ru:
A. Matluba is married, she has 2 children. She has been an entrepreneur for 15 years. She started her business sewing women’s dresses. She was taking orders at home. Now she is sewing in an atelier. She needs 600$ for buying materials, necessary for making new kinds of dresses.

Translated from Russian by Asya Lisak, Kiva Volunteer.

Азизова Матлюба замужем, имеет 2 детей. Предпринимательской деятельностью занимается 15 лет. Начала свой бизнес шитьем женских платьев. Заказы принимала на дому. Сейчас она шьет в ателье. Ей необходимо 600$ для купли сырья, необходимых для шитья новых видов платьев.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Mr. Carlos Vázquez is 47 years old. He is married to Semiona, who is 45, and together they own their own home and work together in their small business. They have 5 children, 4 sons and a daughter. Three of their sons have emigrated to Argentina in search of better work opportunities and monthly send money back to their parents. The other son works for an industrialized soft drink business, and their daughter, who is 16 years old, is still in school.

Carlos owns a grocery store. He started the business several years ago, when his children were young. In the beginning the business required a lot of sacrifice, since he had to get up early to walk a considerable distance to the main street where he could catch the bus to his store. Years later, thanks to the growth of his business, he was able to buy a small truck.

In his store he sells all kinds of necessary products, including rice, noodles, sugar, canned foods, milk products, bread products, etc. He reports that the business is going well thanks to the fact that he is the only convenience store in the area and therefore has no competition.

Carlos would like to request a loan which he will then invest in the purchase of wholesale quantities of products including rice, noodles, flour and oil. This investment will allow him to take advantage of considerable discounts, which in turn will allow him to increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Carlos Vázquez tiene 47 años, está casado con la señora Semiona de 45 años, tienen una casa propia y poseen una microempresa donde trabajan juntos trabajan juntos. Tienen en total 5 hijos, cuatro varones y una mujer. Tres de sus hijos varones emigraron a la Argentina en busca de mejores oportunidades laborales y mensualmente envían dinero ayudar a su padres; el otro hijo trabaja en una empresa industrializadora de gaseosas, la última es una hija tiene 16 años y va aún al colegio.

Don Carlos tiene es una despensa, este negocio lo empezó hace ya varios años, cuando sus hijos aún eran pequeños; al principio le costó mucho sacrificio porque debía salir muy temprano ya que su casa quedaba lejos de la calle principal donde pasaba el bus para llegar hasta el mercado. Luego de varios años, y gracias a que su negocio fue creciendo, pudo adquirir una camioneta.

En su despensa vende todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad, como arroz, fideo, azúcar, productos enlatados, lácteos, panificados, etc.; cuenta que le va bastante bien gracias a que es la única despensa de la zona y no tiene competencia.

Carlos desea solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra al por mayor de productos como azúcar, fideo, arroz, harina y aceite, de este modo podrá conseguir importantes descuentos que lo ayudará a incrementar sus ganancias.

loans.use: Buy sugar, noodles, rice, flour and oil in wholesale quantities

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.es:
Alfreda is a young mother of two children, who are the reason for her existence. Because of her love for them, she works very hard each day at the side of her husband building furniture in a shop that they started in her house four years ago. She and her husband work well together as partners in the shop because while her husband builds the framework for the furniture, she then upholsters the furniture with fabric.

Their business has increased in size, which is very satisfying to her, and she wishes to continue working. She yearns to have her own place, where she would be able to sell the furniture upholstery she has designed thanks to her talent and hard work.

She is asking for a loan of $350 to be able to buy materials with the eventual goal of acquiring her own place in which to work. With your help, let’s make it possible for this family to continue to reach their dreams of building and upholstering furniture with much hard work and love.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Alfreda es una joven madre de dos niños que se han convertido en motivo de su existencia y por amor a ellos se esfuerza cada día al lado de su esposo en su pequeño taller de fabricación de muebles que implementaron en su casita hace ya cuatro años, su labor se complementa porque mientras su esposo fabrica el armazón de los muebles ella los va recubriendo de tela.En la actualidad su pequeño taller ha incrementado su tamaño y esto la llena de satisfacciones y muchos deseos para seguir trabajando, su anhelo es poder tener un local propio donde ella pueda comercializar las fundas de los muebles que ha ido diseñando gracias a su ingenio y diligencia.Solicita un préstamo de 350 dólares para poder comprar telas, con el propósito de adquirir un local propio con las ganancias que obtenga gracias a su labor.Con tu colaboración podemos hacer que esta familia pueda seguir armando sus sueños para cubrirlos con mucho amor y trabajo..

loans.use: Purchase of fabric to upholster furniture

loans.name: Rumen

texts.en: Rumen D. lives in the village of Butan, near Vratza. He is married. His wife works as a social worker. Rumen cultivates 22 decares of his own land. He grows wheat on it. Dimitar also breeds four horses. He needs a $ 750 loan to buy fodder for his horses.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his horses

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
The committee LA AMISTAD (Friendship) was formed more than a year ago and belongs to the Marketalia neighborhood, an area occupied by low-income people. Eight years ago, this area was granted by the government as a result of the pressure exerted by the homeless, who are now in the process of obtaining property titles.

The women who belong to the committee carry out different activities: some of them run a grocery shop at home, while others sell clothes, medicines and food, either at home or door-to-door.

As a group, they are stable and pay their installments timely. At the Foundation and also within the group, they have accumulated savings for GS 3.250.000, deposited at a savings cooperative institution from the area. They also organize group activities, such as raffles and fund-raisers, in order to establish a help fund, to be used in the case of sickness of a member, or to make early payments as a group.

They will allocate the money to the purchase of merchandise, according to the different activities of the members: in the case of the grocery stores, to buy meat, cheese, milk , as well as wine and cider, taking into account the coming holidays. In the case of the clothes sellers, they will buy holiday and kids clothes. Those who sell food intend to invest in other businesses, like toys and fireworks sales. Finally, those who sell beverages or groceries wish to incorporate ice creams and cool drinks for the coming hot season.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité LA AMISTAD se formó hace ya más de un año y pertenece a la zona de Marketalia, donde conviven personas de escasos recursos. Ya hace ocho años, esta zona fue cedida por el gobierno como resultado de la presión de los sin techo, que ahora están en trámites para obtener su título de propiedad.

Las señoras desarrollan diferentes actividades: algunas tienen su negocio de despensa en su casa, mientras que las demás hacen venta de ropas, remedios y comidas, algunas en su casa y otras recorren de puerta en puerta.

Como grupo, es un comité estable y pagan con puntualidad sus cuotas. En la Fundación y dentro del grupo también, poseen un ahorro de GS 3.250.000, que lo depositan en una Cooperativa de la zona. Además realizan actividades en conjunto, como rifas y polladas para lograr un fondo de Caja de Auxilio, para los casos que alguien se enferme, o poder adelantar sus pagos como grupo en la Fundación.

De acuerdo a las actividades de la señoras, destinarán los fondos del crédito para compra de mercaderías; en caso de las despensas, compra de carne, queso , leche, vino, sidra, teniendo en cuenta las fechas de fiesta. En el caso de las vendedoras de ropas, compra de ropas de fiesta y de niños. En el caso de las señoras de venta de comida, pretenden invertir en otros ramos como venta de juguetes y fuegos artificiales, aprovechando las fiestas. Además, quienes se dedican a la venta de bebidas o despensas, desean anexar la venta de helados y otras bebidas heladas, ya que se viene la época de mayor calor.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise, such as meat, cheese, milk, wine, cider, toys, fireworks, etc.

loans.name: Berna Luz

texts.es:
Berna Luz was born in the city of Managua on March 10th, 1973. She is married and has 3 children, 2 boys and a girl. Doña Berna and her husband, with more than 14 years of experience, own a small hardware store where they also sell building materials.

Presently it is the family goal to finish building their own house and the loan requested will be used to add an extra room and thus have a more comfortable and fit home.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Berna Luz nació en la ciudad de Managua, el 10 de Marzo de 1973. Es casada y tiene 3 hijos, 2 varones y una mujer. Berna y su marido tienen un pequeño negocio donde comercializan productos de construcción y ferretería, tienen más de 14 años de experiencia en el negocio.

Actualmente esta familia se ha propuesto terminar de construir su casa de habitación, es por eso que solicitan el préstamo para construir un cuarto de habitación y poder tener mayor comodidad y una vivienda más digna.

loans.use: Build an extra room for more comfortable living.

loans.name: Goibnazar

texts.en:
Goibnazar D. is 36 years old. He is married with two children.

Goibnazar provides transportation services on his truck. He has been in this business for 3 years. As a rule Goibnazar transports goods from Dushanbe to Istaravshan and vice versa. Dushanbe is the capital of Tajikistan and located in the South of the Republic and Istaravshan is located in the North of the Republic. The road goes through the mountains and there are a couple of passes that are closed during the winter season due to the snow. Considering the above, Goibnazar has decided to fix his truck. With this purpose he requests 2000.00 Somoni ($600.00 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. This is the first loan for Goibnazar, however, he is sure he shall be able to pay the loan back on time.

loans.use: Fixing of the truck

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey M., 41 years old and living in Dam Dek Commune, Siem Reap Province, earns $0.50 per day as a farmer, growing crops to sell at the market. Her husband, Mr. Dep Vann, 44 years old, earns about $3 per day making palm sugar to sell from home and at the market. They have four children, all of whom are students. They request a $200 loan to buy a motorcycle to help them transport their inventory of palm sugar to the market as well as offer taxi services, thereby enabling them to increase family profits.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to help transport palm sugar to the market, as well as offer taxi services

loans.name: Patricia Gosvinda

texts.en:
Patricia Gosvinda S. R. has a business renting taxis in La Esperanza, a suburb of Trujillo, of the Libertad Region.  Patricia is a wonderful success story: she started her business 3 years ago with one taxi.  She now has a fleet of 4 and dreams of more.  Her husband is a skilled mechanic who has been an invaluable resource for her business.

Patricia is 49 years old and has 3 children.  She is a very hard worker and a charismatic community leader.  In addition Patricia is a volunteer health officer for the local hospital.  Before she started her business her family was in a terrible economic situation.  Now she can breathe easier and hopes to be able to send her children to University.  

A member of the community bank Mujeres en Accion II, Patricia is requesting a loan of $625 to repay over 4 months.  She would like the loan to repair a motor and buy spare parts.

loans.use: To repair a motor and buy spare parts.

loans.name: Maty

texts.fr:
Mrs. F. is a well-known used clothing merchant in the central market of the town of Thiès. This business is quite remunerative but necessitates sufficient capital to renew her stock of bales of used clothing. She is responsible for a family and uses the income from this business primarily to cover family living expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

MADAME F. est une commerçante de fripperie très connue dans le marché central de la ville de Thiès. c'est une activité assez rentable mais qui nécessite un fonds de roulement pour renouveler ses stocks de ballots d'habillements. elle est mère de famille et tire principalement ses revenus de cette activité pour prendre en charge ses dépenses familiales.

loans.use: purchasing bales of used clothing for her business

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha S., 43, is a widow with two daughters. Her first daughter is a garment factory worker and the younger one is in school. The family lives along National Road Number Five, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sokha has been selling lotus flowers, meatballs, and boiled eggs for seven years. She buys lotus flowers from her village to sell at market in Phnom Penh and sells meatballs and boiled eggs in the village. She is requesting a loan of US$500 to install a handrail in her house and to connect the house to potable water.

loans.use: To purchase home improvements.

loans.name: Maria Cirila

texts.en:
Maria weaves and sells huipiles (traditional woven dress). She learned to weave when she was eight years old and says “it’s what we do, making huipiles at home.” Her huipiles are sold in the market in San Martin Jilotepeque, but she doesn’t actually leave her village of Pachay las Lomas. Her neighbors, or others who don’t know how to weave, buy them from her and take them to the market to sell them. She is requesting this loan to buy more thread for the huipiles and also to buy some pigs to raise to supplement her income. Maria can make a huipil in eight to ten days and can sell them for 350-400 Guatemala Quetzals (about US$45-50).

Maria is 31 years old and has four children, who range from one to nine years old. The older ones are studying and she herself studied up through sixth grade. She is married and her husband works in agriculture on their own land. Maria wants to make more huipiles and expand her business. She dreams of having a better house, buying more land and, more than anything, that her children get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Montgomery, Kiva Fellow.

Maria trabaja en el tejido y la venta de huipiles. Aprendió de tejer cuando tenía 8 años y dice “es que hacemos, haciendo huipiles de la casa.” Se vende sus huipiles en el mercado de San Martín Jilotepeque, pero ella no sale de su cantón de Pachay las Lomas. Sus vecinos, a alguien que no sabe como tejer, los compras y los lleva al mercado para venderlos. Está pidiendo este préstamo para comprar más hilo para los huipiles y también para comprar algunos marranos para criar para complementar a sus ingresos. Maria puede hacer un huipil en 8 a 10 días y puede venderlos por 350-400 Quetzales (aproximadamente $45-50). Maria tiene 31 años y tiene cuatro hijos de un año hasta 9 años. Los más grandes están estudiando y ella misma estudió hasta el sexto grado. Es casada y su esposo trabaja en agricultura en sus propios terrenos. Ella tiene ganas de hacer más huipiles y aumentar su negocio. Sueña con tener una casa mejor, comprar más terreno y, más que nada, que sus hijos sigan adelante.

loans.use: to buy thread for weaving huipiles and to purchase pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr:
Bintou D. is married and has 4 children. She would like this loan to improve the living conditions, health, and education of her family by engaging in the rearing of goats and sheep. She intends to buy goats and sheep, which she will then re-sell, particularly around the time of holiday festivals. She will reimburse this loan in a single payment at the end of six months

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Bintou D. est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle veut ce prêt pour améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille, en s’activant dans l’embouche caprine et ovine. Elle compte acheter des chèvres et des moutons qu’elle va revendre surtout à l’approche des fêtes. Elle va rembourser ce prêt en une seule échéance au bout de six mois.

loans.use: To buy and re-sell goats and sheep

loans.name: Karina Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Karina pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Lupuna”, ubicado en el Jr. La Gloriosa Mz.C Lt 1 AA.HH. Ulises Reategui, distrito de Yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 29 años de edad, es madre de una pequeña menor de edad que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja en la madera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300, decide invertir en la venta de golosinas.

En la actualidad, Karina cuenta con una bodega en casa. Se levanta temprano para cumplir con los deberes del hogar, apoyar a su pequeña hija y atender el negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000, el cual será cancelado en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de abarrotes como un saco de arroz, una vitrina para la venta de pan, un saco de azúcar, 2 cajas de leche gloria, un paquete de fideos, una bolsa de detergente y verduras.
   
Karina se volvió una mujer trabajadora, exitosa y con muchas ganas de vivir. Agradece al banco comunal por brindarle la oportunidad de realizarse como mujer y de progresar en la vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karina belongs to the La Lupuna Communal Bank, which is located in the Jr. La Gloriosa Mz.C Lt 1 AA.HH, Ulises Reategui, in the Yarinacocha District of Ucayali Department. She is 29 years old and the mother of one young child who is still dependent on her. She is married, and her husband is a woodworker. With her first 300 sole loan from Manuela Ramos, she bought sweets to sell. Karina currently has a small store in her home. She wakes up early to do chores, take care of her daughter and attend to her store. With this loan of 2,000 soles, she will buy dry goods like a sack of rice, a glass counter for bread, a sack of sugar, 2 boxes of Gloria brand milk, a pack of noodles, a bag of detergent, and vegetables.

Karina has become a hard-working, successful woman who enjoys life. She is thankful to her communal bank for giving her the opportunity to fulfill her dreams as a woman and advance in life.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dry goods (rice, sugar, milk) and a glass display counter

loans.name: Mrs. Thon Kon Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thon K. is the group leader of four in Mean Chey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a pig breeder and her husband, M. Sok Sokhom, is an electrician. Since her pig breeding business is going well, Mrs. Thon K. is requesting a loan to buy four more piglets for breeding. Mrs. Thon K. is 39 years old and the mother of two children, who are attending the local school.

All the members in this group have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. These allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy four more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Joel tiene 37 años de edad,  padre soltero con dos hijos que están viviendo con su madre y él vive en la casa de su madre, en compañía de sus hermanos. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a la actividad de la agricultura, hace un año se planteó la meta de poner cabinas de Internet en su pueblo, en vista que no hay ese tipo de negocio en su terruño. La agricultura la realiza esporádicamente, entonces eso le va dar tiempo a atender el negocio que piensa aperturar.
Ha visto que le ira muy bien porque no tendría competencia, ya lo tiene todo preparado, la antena y las cabinas lo único que le falta es un poco de capital para los CPUs y darle por inaugurado su negocio, considera que no tendría ninguna dificultad. Es un nuevo cliente de MFP. Con el dinero comprará 3 CPUs de segunda para que le alcance. Para nuevos le faltaría mucho más.
texts.en:
Joel is 37 years old. His two children live with their mother, and Joel lives in his mother's house along with his brothers. From the time he was young he has worked in agriculture. One year ago he came up with the idea to set up internet booths in his town, realizing that there was no business like this in his area. Agriculture is sporadic, so this gives him time to work on his new business. He thinks it will go well as there is no competition now, and he has everything prepared, the antenna and the booths. All that is missing is a little bit of capital to launch his business and he doesn't see any difficulty. Joel is a new client of MFP. With the money, he will purchase 3 used computers so he can begin. For new computers it would cost much more.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase second hand computers for his internet booths

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando tiene 48 años, es conviviente, tiene 6 hijos menores que están en estudios  primarios. Hace 10 años se dedicaba a la compra y venta de quesos juntamente con su esposa, pero ahora el negocio se lo delegó a su compañera porque ha encontrado un trabajo como albañil en la construcción de una piscina temperada y ahí el viene prestando sus servicios, al término de la obra considera que volverá a su misma rutina del negocio. Nos comenta que la venta de quesos en muy rentable, porque con cada uno gana de 2 a 3 soles, pero también dice que es bueno contar con un trabajo donde se tenga un sueldo fijo, y si por él fuera, le gustaría trabajar todo un tiempo como albañil y su esposa dedicarse al venta de los quesos, sería doble ingreso a su economía familiar. Es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado será posible incrementar su capital para la compra de quesos y mantequillas de la ciudad de Junín y transportarlos a la capital para su comercialización.
texts.en:
Rolando is 48 years old, married and has six young children that are in primary school. For 10 years he has been dedicated to buying and selling cheeses together with his wife, but now he has delegated the business to his partner because he has found a job as a bricklayer in the construction of a heated pool and he provides his services there. At the end of the job he plans to return to his routine business. He told us that selling cheese is very profitable because each one earns 2 or 3 soles (US $0.60- $1.00 ) but he also says it is good to have a job with a fixed salary and if he could he would like to work all the time as a bricklayer and his wife could dedicate herself to selling cheese, which would double the household income. This is his 5th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the requested money he will increase his capital to purchase cheeses and butter from the city of Junín and transport them to the capital to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheese and butter to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith tiene 21 años, es soltera y vive con sus padres. Esta joven siempre ha buscado una manera de ayudar a sus padres y contribuir en los gastos del hogar y desde hace un año se inició en la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, hasta la fecha le va muy bien, ya que en su centro de estudios puede vender sus productos de belleza a sus compañeras de clase y también a sus  maestras, quienes muy gustosas colaboran con Judith. Sus pedidos cada vez son mayores, y en este negocio, lo más rentable para ella es aprovechar las ofertas, ya que compra los productos y luego los pueden vende a precio real, ganado montos  significantes. Judith aun es joven, pero es muy madura para asumir los pagos de su préstamo, los cuales están garantizados con su trabajo. Con el dinero que solicita adquirirá los productos en oferta del catálogo para incrementar su stock.
texts.en:
Judith is 21 years old, unmarried, and lives with her parents. This young woman has always looked for ways to help her parents and contribute to the household expenses. A year ago she began selling cosmetics out of a catalog and has been doing very well. She has been able to sell her beauty products at school to both her classmates and teachers, who are happy to work with Judith. Each time her orders are larger. In this business the most profitable strategy for her is to take advantage of sales and increase her inventory. Once the sale is over she can sell the sale merchandise at full price, earning significant profits. Although Judith is young, she is very mature and ready to assume the payments of her loan, which will be repaid using revenue from her business. With the money from the loan she will purchase sale merchandise from the catalog and increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and increase her inventory

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 52 años vive sola en una casa alquilada ya que es soltera y no tuvo hijos. Se dedica a la venta D. artículos plásticos desD. hace 10 años, los compra para luego venderlos en una D. las plazas donD. se venden artefactos D. segundo uso más conocidas D. la ciudad D. Puno.
Gracias a su trabajo ha podido mantenerse todos estos años es por eso que quiere seguir creciendo y progresando en él, ya que hoy en día las cosas no están tan fáciles pero felizmente el esfuerzo D. Juana da buenos resultados ya que las ventas son buenas. Este es su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad D. artículos D. plástico y así incrementar su capital para lograr mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Juana is 52 years old and lives alone in a rented house as she is single and has no children. She has been selling plastic goods for the past 10 years. She buys these items to resell them in one of the best-known used goods markets in Puno. Because of her work she has been able to support herself all these years and she wants to continue growing and building her business as things are not so easy these days. Happily, Juana's efforts have had good results and her sales are good. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma; she has always been very punctual with her payments. She will use this loan to buy more plastic goods and thus increase her capital to make more money.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Simplice

texts.fr: Mr Simplice A. le 01 Mars 1963 à Tsévié ; il est marié avec cinq (05) personnes à charge. N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller loin dans ses études, il est vite entré en apprentissage dans une maison de vente et de réparation de réfrigérateurs usagers. Après la fin de son apprentissage, il ouvrit son propre atelier de réparation et de vente de réfrigérateur. Grâce à son savoir faire, il a gagné la confiance de sa clientèle. Il sollicite un financement pour acheter les matériels de travail et des congélateurs usagers à réparer et à revendre. Cela contribuera énormément à accroître son chiffre d’affaires et ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mr Simplice A. was born on March 1st, 1963 in Tsévié. He is married and is responsible for supporting five people. Not having had the opportunity to advance very far in his studies, he quickly began an apprenticeship in a shop specializing in the repair and sale of used refrigerators. At the end of his apprenticeship, he opened his own shop reparing and selling refrigerators. Thanks to his expertise, he has earned the trust of his clientele. He is requesting a loan to purchase work materials and used freezers to repair and resell. This will greatly contribute to the increase of sales and profit for his shop.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The repair and sale of used refrigerators

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria es socia del Banco Comunal “El Comercio”, en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 50 años de edad, ella es Viuda, sin embargo se esmera por cuidar a 01 de sus 05 hijos (los demás tienen sus propia familia). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 05 años, su negocio es el la compra y venta de Telas; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo que pudo adquirir mercadería (Tela de diferente calidad) de la ciudad de la Paz – Bolivia.  
Actualmente ella viene comercializando su mercadería en la ciudad de Arequipa y Puno a donde llevas dichos productos; es por esta razón que necesita mas capital para ampliar su negocio; y viene solicitando un nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 03 cuotas, con el préstamo ella podrá adquirir mas mercadería (Telas) de Bolivia para venderlos al por mayor; su anhelo es tener en el futuro su casa propia en la ciudad de Desaguadero o Arequipa y continuar trabajando  constantemente hasta tener una gran empresa.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a member of the community bank “El Comercio”, located in the Desaguadero district of Chucuito, Puno, Peru. She is 50 years old and is widowed and still cares for one of her five children (the rest have their own families). She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for the last 5 years. Her business is to buy and sell material and cloth. Her first loan was for 300 soles which she used to buy merchandise (different quality cloth) from the city of La Paz, Bolivia. Today she sells her merchandise in the cities of Arequipa and Puno. She has to transport her products there and this is why she needs more capital to increase her business. She is asking for a loan for 3,000 soles, which she will repay in three installations. With the loan she will buy more material from Bolivia and sell it to wholesalers. In the future she hopes to have her own home in Desaguadero or Arequipa and to continue working constantly until she has a large business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy material/cloth

loans.name: Awo

texts.en:
Awo M. is thirty-nine years old. She is widowed and the mother of twins (a boy and a girl) who are currently in school. Her husband died through a lorry accident two years ago, so the responsibility of her family rests on her. She has been a local manufacturer of coconut oil for eight years now. Coconut oil is produced from coconut. The coconuts are processed through several stages to obtain the oil which is used to prepare many local dishes like “banku," “waakye,” and fried fish. She produces and supplies to food vendors to prepare their meals. However, her production is on the low side. As a result of low working capital, she cannot afford a machine for processing the coconuts.

Awo wants to use this loan to buy more coconuts from coastal areas like Cape Coast and an electric milling machine to increase her output efficiency. She believes this will help expand her business so she can raise more income to support her family and their education. Awo belongs to a village bank called God is alive. She would be grateful for assistance.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and a milling machine

loans.name: Dolma

texts.en:
Dolma L. lives in Thikhidewol, Lalitpur. There are three members including herself in her family. Her husband, Mr. Keshab Bahadur L., went to Dubai to work. She has one son who is in pre-primary school.
Mrs. L. is a grocery shopkeeper in the town of Thikhidewol. She sells different types of grocery items in her shop such as rice, maize, noodles, snacks and cold drinks. Now Mrs. L. is requesting a loan for Rs 10000.00 to expand her business by purchasing different varieties of grocery items for her shop.
Mrs. L. wants to utilize her income to provide a better education for her sons. She also wants to upgrade the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Azamat

texts.en:
G. Azamat is a young man who, little by little, reaches his goals through perseverance and dedication. Thanks to his personal strengths and desire to provide a better future for his family, he has progressed from salesman to becoming his own boss. Approximately two years ago, Azamat rented a place which had deteriorated badly, with terrible conditions, and there he started his business. Since then, he has expanded his grocery and now it is one of the best known groceries in his community.

Azamat is now requesting a loan of $400 US with a term of 12 months, to increase the stock of foodstuffs in his store. Azamat is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while, to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to diversify stock

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: La señora Reyna Isabel P. Martines , tiene la edad de 30 años , habita en le barrio el edén , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , ella es madre soltera , a su cargo tiene un hijos , el cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , desde hace cinco años trabaja como agricultora , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y las plagas que le afecta a su cultivo,  los planes hacia un futuro es poder darle mejor condiciones de vida a su hijo y diversificar el cultivo . Con el financiamiento va comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder obtener una buena producción.
texts.en:
30-year old Señora Reyna Isabel P. Martines lives in the Eden neighbourhood of Ticuantepe. She is a single mother and has a son who works and contributes to household expenses. She has worked in agriculture for five years. The greatest difficulty she faces is the lack of credit and the pests which affect her crops. She would like to be able to provide a better standard of living for her son and to plant a variety of crops in the future. With the loan she will buy fertilizer and other agricultural products to put on her fields to ensure a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other agricultural products to put on her fields

loans.name: Karla Elizabeth

texts.es: La  Sra. Karla S., labora para la Fabrica de Muebles Alexandra, desde hace tres años, desempeñandose como Supervisora de Produccion, ella tiene 24 años de edad, esta casada y ya tiene dos niños, una esta en la Escuela y la otra tiene un mes de Nacida, su esposo trabaja como Tapicero,  juntos han logrado sacar adelante a sus hijas, en el lugar donde trabajan les permiten llevar sus hijos y así Karla puede trabajar y cuidar de ellos.  Tienen su propia casa muy pequeña pero comoda la cual han levantado con mucho esfuerzo, karla necesita el credito para poder construir el Baño sanitario y la Pila, el que actualmente usan ya esta muy dañado y el agua la tienen que guardar en recipientes plasticos. Karla es muy agradable y carismatica, muy educada y su sueño es ver crecer a sus hijos y poder apoyarlos con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Karla S. has worked for the Alexandra Furniture Factory for three years as a Production Supervisor. She is 24 years old, is married and already has two children: one is in school and the other is one-month old. Her husband works as an upholsterer. Together, they have been able to get their children ahead. Where they work, they are allowed to bring their children so Karla is able to work and take care of them. They have their own home, which is small but comfortable, which they have improved with a lot of effort. Karla needs a loan in order to build a bathroom and the foundation. What they currently use is very damaged and the water must be kept in plastic containers. Karla is likeable, charismatic and educated and her dream is to see her children grow and be able to support their education.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement, bricks, sand, paint, and a toilet.

loans.name: Torise

texts.en: Torise I. is 44 years old, and is married with 8 children. She has 3 years of experience in the field of fruits and vegetables farming. She sells to the people in her village and the general public for 4 days each week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~120 USD). SPBD loans are Torise’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase of weed killing spray, chemicals, seeds and bush knives for the plantation

loans.name: Silvia Patricia

texts.es: Silvia Patricia es una pequeña productora de arroz como cultivo tradicional en la zona, junto a su marido ha venido desarrollando esta labor por mas de 5 años, con la apertura de la construccion de un trillo arrocero se motivo a solicitar financiamiento para participar como socia de este proyecto, segura que le permitira aprovechar al maximo su produccion de arroz, lo que le permitira mejorar sus condiciones de vida familiar, ya que es madre de 2 pequeños hijos, los que pronto asistiran al colegio, su mayor sueño es disponer de un bien colectivo que le permita obtener beneficios como socia del mismo.
texts.en:
Silvia Patricia is a small-scale rice farmer, a traditional crop in the region. Together with her husband, she has done this work for more than five years. When construction began on a rice thresher, she was motivated to request financing in order to be able to participate as a partner in this project. She is sure that this will allow her to take maximum advantage of her own rice production, which will allow her to improve her family's standard of living, because she is the mother of 2 young children who will soon be starting school. Her biggest dream is to have a good collective available to her which will allow her to benefit from being a member of the collective.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 30% share in the construction of a rice thresher

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is a 25-year-old married man living with his wife. In 2002, he decided to open his own phone-accessories shop.

Today, Wissam is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy additionA. supplies for his shop to satisfy the needs of his customers.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies for his shop

loans.name: Jasmila

texts.es: La señora Jasmila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Laureles II”, Distrito Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 31 años, 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella.Con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos económicos y motivada por una ella misma decidió iniciar  en sus ratos libres la venta de ropas interiores, de la línea Leonisa, donde sus clientes lo piden por catalogo mensualmente, poco a poco fue haciéndose de su propio  stock, para esto ya contaba con mas capital y también ahora se dedica a la venta de aretes, collares y anillos.Hoy continúa con su negocio ubicado en su misma casa, donde sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y amigos, nos cuenta que le va muy bien, ya que tiene clientes fijos.Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará para incrementar su stock de ropas interiores como: calzones, bikinis, brasieres, pijamas, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de muraños, argollas, perlitas y muraños, que utiliza para  realizar sus aretes, pulseras, collares y anillos.Jasmila, tiene un carácter alegre y un carisma para vender a sus clientes,  comenta que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos como organización ayuda a las mujeres a desarrollarse y progresar con la misma oportunidad que el varón.
texts.en:
Sra. Jasmila is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Laureles II”, which is located in the District of Banda de Shilcayo, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 31 years old, married, and has 2 dependent children. In order to earn more money, she started selling undergarments in her free time. She sells a line of products called Leonisa, in which her customers order by catalog every month. Little by little, she has increased her stock and added items such as earrings, necklaces, and rings. She continues to operate her business from her home. Her main customers are neighbors and friends who know her well and have become her regular clientele.

With her loan of 800 soles, Sra. Jasmila will buy undergarments to add to her inventory such as panties, bikinis, brassieres, and pajamas (for women, children and men). Some of the money will be used to buy pearls and beads used for making earrings, bracelets, necklaces, and rings.

Sra. Jasmila displays her charisma and cheerful disposition as she conducts business with her clients. She says that Manuela Ramos helps provide women with the same opportunities to develop and succeed as the men.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase undergarments & supplies for making jewelry

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
“To become successful in life, we must stay patient and hard working” this is the guiding principle of Marivic.  She is a hard working mother and a loving house wife of Rafael. They live peacefully in the rural community of Barangay Salamague, Lamut, Ifugao with their six children. The couple wanted to give their children the best education they could afford for them to become successful in the future and achieve their ambitions in life. Their children are in college, high school and elementary level.  

Their major source of income in the village is through farming. Her husband cultivates 1.5 hectares of farm lot where he plant rice and corn while Marivic is engage into vegetable and rice cake vending in their village as alternative source of income. With this, she would like to borrow a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP9, 000 as additional capital to further improve her vending business and to have an increase  in income.  She hopes to purchase bigger volume of vegetables and fruits that she will sell.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Dudu

texts.en:
Dudu A. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and onions and is requesting a loan to purchase cooking oil to sell. Dudu is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has four children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

About BRAC: BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purcase more food products

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad S. is a 37-year-old trader. He and his wife are in business together, and they also have three children, all of whom attend school. Mohamad is seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 in order to pay school fees and related expenses for his children.

loans.use: Pay school fees and expenses

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a 52 year-old divorced woman with five children. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. She works hard to be able to provide for her family. Hannah is a trader in the palm oil production business. She buys fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil and supplies to retailers in her community. She also sells at the local market. Hannah has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bulk palm nuts.

loans.name: 02.08.1.6 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Linh T. Thị (30) is a 41 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá . Linh is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02.08.1.6 Nam Ngạn (02.08.1.6 Nam Ngạn).

Linh is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To making a living, Linh owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling rice products in the local community. Linh has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Linh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Linh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,963,500 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Linh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Ngô Thị Hoa (31) is a 22 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

2. H. Thị Hường (32) is a 44 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

3. N. Thị Mai (33) is a 50 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Linh T. Thị (30) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá . Linh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.08.1.6 Nam Ngạn (02.08.1.6 Nam Ngạn).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương. Linh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Linh kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.
