Vào 2008, Linh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Linh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1.963.500 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. Ngô Thị Hoa (31) là 22 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

2. H. Thị Hường (32) là 44 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

3. N. Thị Mai (33) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La señora Sofía es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” desde hace 14 años atrás, del distrito de Santa Rosa, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 04 hijos. Ella estudió hasta cuarto de secundaria, tiene su tienda de abarrotes.

Sofía nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  arroz,  azúcar, fideos, panetón,  etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es abrir una bodega grande y así poder vivir feliz sin problemas con mi familia. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro que gana y las reuniones con las socias
texts.en:
Sofía, 39, has been a member of the “Generación 2000” communal bank, which is in Santa Rosa district, El Collao province, Puno department, for the last 14 years. She lives with her life partner and has 4 children. She finished 10th grade and has a grocery store. Sofía tells us that she used her first, 300 new sol, loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement to increase her capital. She is now requesting 3000 new soles with which to buy rice, sugar, pasta, panettones (a Christmas dinner staple), etc. Her dream for the future is to open a large store so that she can live with her family happy and problem-free. What she likes best about her communal bank is the savings she earns and the get-togethers with her fellow members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, pasta, sugar, panettones (a Christmas dinner staple)

loans.name: Faten

texts.en: Faten has worked as a home-based tailor since 2000. A mother of 2 children, she started her small business to help her husband with the family's income. She is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy a new sewing machine and tailoring supplies to make more products for her clients and make a good profit.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and tailoring supplies.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 36, married, and has six children aged 4-10 years. All her children go to school. The family resides in and owns a five-roomed house where Margaret stays with six people. She takes care of additional family members.  The family has access to electricity, but not to piped water at home.  They have three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include paying utility bills, school fees for her children, and medication.  

Margaret owns a stall selling second hand clothes in Kitawuluzi. She works seven days a week, serving an average of 10 customers a day. She has had her business for over fifteen years. Her main challenges are transportation of used clothes and defaulters. She sells both on retail and wholesale. She has been with MCDT for six years, and has taken fourteen loans, working the whole time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second hand clothes. She hopes to see her business grow bigger, and to start importing clothes herself.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Luz Amanda

texts.es:
Luz Amanda C. S. tiene 46 años y vive con sus dos hijos de 19 y 6 años en el barrio Américas Central, que queda hacia el sur occidente de Bogotá, cerca del Estadio Metropolitano de Techo, lugar donde juega La Equidad, un equipo de fútbol bogotano. La señora Luz maneja una tienda de víveres y abarrotes que se llama Distrilac El Paisa, haciendo referencia a los paisas, los habitantes de Antioquia, la región que circunda a Medellín.
Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y quiere invertir esta suma en la compra de gaseosas y productos desechables, como vasos y platos para venderlos en su tienda. Inició su negocio con la venta de gaseosa al por mayor que distribuía a tiendas pequeñas y supermercados. Pero por las recomendaciones de sus vecinos en el sector, quienes le comentaban que por la ubicación de su casa, sería buena idea complementar su actividad con la comercialización de víveres y abarrotes, Luz abrió su tienda hace un año con mucho éxito y con muy buena acogida, en parte gracias a la proximidad del estadio que le incrementa las ventas. Su tienda es la fuente principal de ingresos y  espera que su negocio crezca más para poder comprar la casa donde actualmente funciona. Ella se siente muy feliz porque su hijo ingresó a la universidad al obtener una Beca de estudios debido a sus buenas calificaciones.
texts.en:
Luz Amanda C. S. is 46 years old and lives with her two children, aged 19 and 6 respectively, in the Américas Central neighborhood, which is located to the south-west of Bogotá, near the Metropolitano de Techo stadium, home to the La Equidad team, which is a soccer team from Bogotá. Luz runs a general store called the Distrilac El Paisa. This name refers to the Paisas, habitants of Antioquia, the region around Medellín. This is Luz's first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she wants to use it to buy soda and other groceries like plastic cups and plates to sell in her store. She started her business selling soda wholesale, which she distributed to small shops and grocery stores. Her neighbors and peers, however, recommended that thanks to the location of her home, it would be a good idea to set up a general store in addition to her other business. Luz opened her store a year ago with great success and a positive reception, thanks in part to her close location to the stadium, which has allowed her to further expand her sales. Her store is now her largest source of revenue and she hopes this business grows even more, so she can buy the house she lives and works in. She is also very happy right now because her son just started college on a full merit scholarship.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soda and other groceries like plastic cups and plates to sell in her store

loans.name: Shenna Mae

texts.en:
Shenna Mae M. is from the village of Casinglot, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 24 years-old and married with a baby.  To make a living, Shenna Mae is starting a business venture selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. 

In 2010, Shenna Mae joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shenna Mae is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as working capital. She plans to use the revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide working capital.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty makes a living selling shoes and bags at retail prices to her customers. She is requesting a loan of N120,000 to purchase more shoes and bags to sell.

Betty loves this business because it is highly profitable and she has the opportunity to meet one-on-one with her customers. She hopes to grow her business.

Betty is 37 years old and married with two children. Her eldest child is 9 years old while the youngest child is 5 years old. Her children are still in primary school and they are making good progress and this gives her joy.

Betty says thank you to all Kiva lenders in anticipation of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen E. lives in the town of Hda. Imang, Brgy San Pablo Cadiz Negros Occidental.  She is married and has 3 adult -aged children. To making a living, Helen owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari sari store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Helen has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 1994, Helen joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 29,500 Php from NWTF. Helen is now requesting a new loan of 29,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the 13th loan taken out by the borrower from NWTF. Helen plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calls of not just of a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Bessy Carolina

texts.es:
la sra. Bessy Carolina C. cuenta con una Pulpería denominada pulperia "Vanesa" ubicada en la Colonia Gracias a Dios de la Ciudad de Danlí, tiene 1 año de realizar esta actividad económica lo que le hace tener experiencia en el manejo de su negocio. Bessy es una persona muy conocida en el lugar por su espíritu de superación, solvencia moral y de buena conducta, se ha sabido ganar la clientela lo que le ha generado mayor demanda de sus productos ya que las ventas las realiza de forma de contado y al crédito generándole de esta forma clientela permanente en todo el año.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia y asi tener mas surtida su pulperia.
texts.en:
Bessy has a general store called "Vanesa." It's located in "Colonia Gracias a Dios" in the city of Danlí. She's been doing this for a year, which has given her experience in running a business. Bessy is very well known for her high spirits, honesty, and good conduct. She has learned how to win customers and has created great demand for her products by offering both cash and credit sales. She will use the money from this loan to buy more merchandise to be able to offer a greater variety in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Zinunula Omunaku, Mityana Group

texts.en:
M. Meseche is a serene, 53-year-old, happily married man with fifteen children, all above the age of 15. He also takes care of four orphans.

To shoulder the financial responsibility of taking care of these children and orphans, Miseche owns a small tea-packaging business in Miseebe, Mityana. He took root ten years ago and, with this business, he has in a way managed to provide for his family's needs.

Miseche’s dream is to expand his tea-packing business into a wholesale franchise. With this loan, he wants to buy tea-packaging bags and also pay for his own trademark logos.

loans.use: To buy tea-packaging bags and boxes and also pay for his own trademark logos

loans.name: Zahera

texts.en:
Zahera N. is a young woman from Jenin, a city in North Palestine. Zahera is the mother of two sons, ages three years and one and a half years old. Zahera's husband, Ahmad, is a disk jockey for parties and weddings in Jenin.

Zahera opened her own business -- a headscarf (hijab) store -- two years ago. Zahera sells headscarves and accessories for headscarves, The store is located in the city center of Jenin and has regular customers. The store is prospering over time and Zahera wants to respond to the demand by providing a larger variety of accessories for hijabi women (women who wear a headscarf) and other items that they request. Therefore, she took a $1000 loan from FATEN.

In the photograph, her husband, Ahmad, appears in Zahera's store, because she doesn't want her picture to be published online.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida’s aspiration is to build a sustainable business to meet the needs of her family; she was thus encouraged to join KIVA partner, ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap Inc.) in the Philippines, in 1995.

The previous loans Adelaida received from ASHI were carefully invested in her sari-sari (variety) store. Since then, her business has been performing well and earning her sufficient profit. She is grateful that she has been able to educate her children using proceeds from her business as it continues to expand. She needs a loan to help enhance her business to increase her profit.

Now requesting her tenth loan, Adelaida is requesting 45,000 pesos as supplementary capital for her sari-sari (variety) store, to be used to pay for an inventory of groceries for her enterprise. Her business has been very helpful in achieving her dreams for her children. For her, it is pleasure to see achievement in her business and family; with her children growing she will want to see them having the best in life.

Adelaida is happy that her living conditions are better than in the past because she was able to generate more income from her business. She is also happy because she is able to nourish and support her husband to meet the needs of the family. She would like to send her best wishes to all her lenders around the world. She hopes that they will support her again in the future.

Adelaida’s future goals are to purchase a new tricycle (three-wheeled vehicle) for her husband to earn more income for their family. With her hard work and determination, she is hopeful that her businesses will continue to be more productive and that it will improve the overall standard of living for her whole family.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es: La solicitante cuenta con 2 años de experiencia en confeccion de casacas y polos al por mayor y menor. La cliente desea incrementar su negocio tiene 2 maquinas industriales y mas adelante desearia trabajar con personal y poder realizar su sueño de contar con su propio taller. Solicita el prestamo para compra de materia prima (telas) e  insumos
texts.en:
The applicant has 2 years of experience making jackets and polos wholesale and retail. The customer wishes to increase her business and has 2 industrial machines and later wishes to work with staff and be able to make her dream come true of having her own workshop. She needs the loan to buy raw material (fabrics) and supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies.

loans.name: Srey Pov's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Pov K. is 35 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its twenty members who are located in Kraom village, Takeo province. Each member of this village loan will use the loan to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Srey Pov K. is a farmer who owns 1-hectare (2.5-acres) of land that she uses to cultivate rice. Her husband is a fisherman and also helps his wife on the farm. With these two businesses, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. This couple has three children who are all students in the local school.

In order to support their farm crop, Mrs. Srey Pov K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Sandra Luz

texts.es:
Sandra es una joven de 28 años de edad,  comerciante de una pulpería que inicio con fondos propios de su trabajo anterior, como domestica, y ahorros que su esposo dio para comenzar. 

Tiene dos hijos el cual aun están pequeño. Y tiene la oportunidad de cuidarlos en casa.
Las dificultades es que tiene poco inventario, lo que las ventas han sido pocas, es por eso nace la iniciativa de poder obtener financiamiento para lograr la inversión de productos como: granos básicos, lácteos, golosinas, gaseosas, jugos, productos enlatados y otros para lograr obtener mejores ventas. 

Como objetivo es poder mantener estable su pequeña pulpería ya que es de gran ayuda económica para su familia. Ya que su esposo alquila parcela para sembrar chiltoma y tomate y a veces tarda para sacar la cosecha. 
Y hay que pagar los gastos básicos de agua y luz, alimentación que se ayudan con sus ganancias de su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Sandra is a young woman, 28 years old. She has a small grocery store that she started with her own funds from her previous job as a domestic servant, and with savings that her husband gave her to get started. She has two children that are still young and she has the opportunity to take care of them at home. The difficulty she has is that she has very little inventory, so she doesn’t make a lot of sales. This is why she has taken the initiative to secure a loan to invest in products such as: basic grains, dairy products, sweets, soft drinks, juices, canned foods, and others, so that she can achieve better sales. Her goals is to keep her store economically stable because it is of great help to her family. Her husband rents a piece of land to plant sweet peppers and tomatoes and sometimes it takes a long time before they are ready to harvest. They still have to pay the basic costs, like water, electricity, and food, so the earnings from her business are very helpful.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, dairy products, sweets, canned foods, cereals, and other items so that she can achieve greater sales

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married woman with six children: five boys and a girl. Two attend school while others are adults. She rents a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Hadija has been running her business of selling fruit and coconuts for the last fifteen years. She sells from home and at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, Hadija wants to purchase more coconuts, bananas and mangoes. She hopes that someday she will open her own stall. Her main aim of working with Yehu is to access loans and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more coconuts, bananas and mangoes to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita E. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 66 years old. Anita is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Anita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Anita has been engaged in farming for over 20 years. She also has some piglets that she is raising. She also manages a sari-sari (variety) store where various products are sold.

Anita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Anita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs and feed for the pigs. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Anita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Les Vaillants De Romeo Group

texts.en:
The “Les Vaillants de Romeo” group has 15 male and female entrepreneurs. They are all excited about receiving this loan to expand their current businesses. The group has a wide range of businesses from sneakers and various footwear to restaurants and vegetables to a bakery. 

Emmanuel is the group coordinator. He has a wife and seven children. This hardworking dad is the owner of one of the only bakeries in his community. He specializes in fresh bread but he also makes pastries and cakes upon request. He became interested in and motivated others to join Esperanza because of the good things he heard that it was doing in his community and other nearby areas. He is looking to grow his business by purchasing larger quantities of baking goods. He dreams of having a larger home and a more profitable business. 

On behalf of Emmanuel, Les Vaillants, and Esperanza we thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy baking materials

loans.name: Afr. Mus Agency Pri. Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the African Muslim Agency Primary School in Makeni. This school was built by missionaries in 1991 to help educate orphans in and around Makeni City. The school has a total of 25 staff and 301 pupils.

This is not the first loan that teachers of the African Muslim Agency Primary School have benefited from SMT/Kiva lenders. Previous SMT/Kiva loans have made a lot of improvements in the lives of these dedicated teachers. Some invested in business, others paid school fees for their children, others bought pieces of furniture such as chairs, etc. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are again seeking for a new loan of SLL 10,800,000 to enable them further develop themselves. 

Alpha M. Tarawalie is the leader of the group. He is 38-year-old. He was born in Makama, an outskirt of Makeni. He married a student and they have four children – two in secondary schools and two in primary schools. Alpha has been a teacher for seven years now. He will use this loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
This is Chona M., 50, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Vergel M., a driver, and she is mother to five youngsters. Two of the children are currently enrolled in high school while the three others are in elementary. By the grace of God, Chona has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually support her children and send them all the way through college.

Chona operates a variety store and a woodworking business. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling the items at a piece rate.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP11, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She will also invest a portion of the loan to buy woodworking supplies. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Chona dreams to be able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She will also invest a portion of the loan to buy woodworking supplies.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 32-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is married with five children aged 12, 8, 6, 4, 2 years and his wife is a peasant farmer. He lives with his family of seven people in his own residential house. John operates a retail shop and has been in the business for the last five years. Before that, John was a farmer full time. 

He adds that price fluctuations are his main challenge but he hopes to see his shop grow in the near future. The purpose of the loan is to enable John to purchase sugar, salt, cooking oil and other domestic items to sell in his shop.

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, salt, cooking oil and other domestic items

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Este es el segundo credikiva de Guillermo R. y con el comprará una nevera para conservar las carnes y verduras en buen estado  y volver a comprar antes de que se encarezcan los insumos que requiere  para hacer los pasteles de fin de año. Guillermo está muy contento porque las fiestas de fin de año le generaran un mayor volumen de ventas y una mejor rotación de su capital, y además porque comprará  en mayor volumen el aceite, el arroz, la sal, los condimentos  y las verduras  que requieren para producir en una mayor cantidad sus comidas. 
Si quiere conocer la historia de Guillermo usted puede ingresar al siguiente enlace:
http://www.kiva.org/lend/178874
texts.en:
This is Guillermo R.’s second Kiva loan.  He will use it to buy a refrigerator to keep meats and vegetables in good condition and will buy more before the ingredients he needs to make end of year cakes become scarce.

Guillermo is very happy because end of year festivities generate larger sales volume and better capital rotation and also because he will buy larger quantities of cooking oil, rice, salt, spices and vegetables that he needs to produce larger amounts of his dishes.

If you’d like to know Guillermo’s story, you may visit the following site: http://www.kiva.org/lend/178874

loans.use: He will buy a refrigerator to keep the meats and vegetables in good condition and will buy more before ingredients he needs to make end of year cakes become scarce.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, 51, is a farmer from Agusan del sur. She does coconut farming and food processing as her source of living of her family. She’s a mother of 4 children, the eldest is 20 years old. She needs additional capital to finance her farm.  

She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and requested a loan of 4,000 Php. She will use the loan to purchase farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a single lady aged 46 and a mother of three children aged 25,16, and 10 years. She has been supplying construction material for the last 13 years, a business which earns her Kshs 18,000 monthly. She intents to use the loan to expand her stock so as to boost her income. She was introduced to Kadet by a friend who benefited and this is her first loan. She plans to use the expected profits to expand the business even further. She hopes to own her  own house in future.

loans.use: Expansion of construction supplies inventory

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen C. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 20 years old. Karen is married. To make a living, Karen owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and raising pigs for sale. Karen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Karen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Karen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Karen is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP that will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Karen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Afiafi

texts.en:
Afiafi L. is a 63-year-old woman living in the town of Asau.  She is engaged and has 8 adult-aged children.  To make a living, Afiafi plants and harvests vegetables for sale.  Afiafi has been engaged in this business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 200 WST a month.

In 2008, Afiafi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is requesting her first loan from SPBD, for 1000 WST to purchase fertilizer such as manure.   Afiafi plans to use the additional revenue generated from her farm to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Shaheen's Group

texts.en:
Shaheen is the wife of S. A. and lives in a city called Arifwala in Pakistan. Arifwala is known for its agriculture industry. She owns a two-room house there and lives with her family in the area Zia Nagar. 

A very caring lady, Shaheen carries out her responsibilities as a housewife by staying at home. She takes care of her family and fulfills all of their requirements. She makes the utmost effort to keep her family happy and her family respects her a lot for her good nature and feelings towards them. Her husband works in the transportation business. He has a vehicle named Shahzore which he uses to deliver items from one place to another. He has been in this business for many years and he has a good reputation for his work among his clients. 

Shaheen has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy tires for his conveyance because his old tires have become rough and need replacement. Shaheen is hopeful that through this investment her husband will be able to continue his transportation business and provide good service to his clients.

loans.use: To buy new tires to improve her husband's transportation business

loans.name: Mrs. Chab Roeun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eight people living in Ta Su village, Takeo province. They will use their portions of the loan in various ways to improve their family's lives.

Mrs. Chab R. is the village bank president selected by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Ten Chan, are farmers who own a small piece of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family. Mr. Ten Chan is also a palm sugar seller in the local market. Mrs. Chab R. wants to start a new business, but she does not have enough money to finance it. Therefore, she is asking for a loan to buy some piglets for breeding. She will use the rest of the loan to buy more palm sugar. Mrs. Chab R. is the mother of a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: to buy some piglets for breeding

loans.name: Racile

texts.en:
Racile A. is from the village of Serran, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 41 years old. Racile is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Racile owns & operates a business running a sari-sari (variety) shop.   The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Racile has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Racile joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Racile is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods & snack foods. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Racile from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie is a 38-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store and a pig fattening business. She lives in Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. Rosie is borrowing PHP 29,000 to buy feed for the pigs and stock for her store. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rosie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to buy stock for her general store and pig feed

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es: Bernardina, es una noble mujer D. 51 años. Vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo Roberto, D. 54 años y sus 3 hijos mayores. DesD. hace dos años, se dedica en la venta D. verduras, en un puesto dentro D. un mercado D. su barrio, ubicada a media hora D. su casa en carro. Para abastecer D. verduras y tubérculos, acuD. a las 4 D. la mañana al mercado mayoristas D. Lima (la parada), D. donD. compra al por mayor, y eso D. las 7 D. la mañana, arriba a su puesto, en las que  atienD. hasta las 2 D. la tarD. con la ayuda D. su hija. D. esta manera, Bernardina capta buenas utilidades, con los que paga sin preocupación el alquiler D. su puesto. Le gusta su negocio, sobre todo el tener un puesto repleto D. verduras y tubérculos frescos. Por eso, en esta temporada  le urge abastecerse D. varios sacos D. papa, por lo que constantemente varia D. precio, para ella su objetivo es ampliar su negocio. Ingresa a su noveno crédito con MFP, y se compromete  en pagar todas sus cuotas D. manera puntual. D. obtener el crédito que solicita, va proveerse  D. más verduras y tubérculos, para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en: Bernardina is a noble woman who is 51 years old. She lives in a house that is her own, together with her husband Roberto, 54 years old, and their 3 grown children. For the past two years she has had a produce business, selling from a stand in her neighborhood market. It is located thirty minutes away, by car. In order to acquire the produce and tubers that she needs, she sets out at 4am to the wholesalers market in Lima (La Parada), where she makes her purchases in wholesale. At 7am she arrives at her stand and she sells until 2pm with her daughter’s help.  This is how Bernardina is able to acquire good earnings, with which she is able to pay the rental fee of her stand without any problems.  She loves her business, especially when the stand is stacked with fresh vegetables and tubers. It is urgent for her to supply her business with various sacks of potatoes, a product that is always varying in price. Her objective is to expand her business. This is her ninth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to making her payments in a timely manner. With the loan she requests, she will acquire more vegetables and tubers to supply her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and tubers to supply her business

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 32-year-old married man with two children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in produce and selling video and football shows for eight years. He started buying produce on a small scale and now buys on large scale, and he has rennovated his cinema hall. His hardships are price fluctuations and providing shade for his inventory, and his vision is a well-established produce store and an educated family. Godfrey needs the loan to buy maize for selling.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 59 years old and married with three children between the ages of 9 and 12 years old. Jean Damascene sells general merchandise (tomato sauce, soap, beer etc).  His business is well organized. He has two years of experience. Jean Damascene works from 6am until 7pm every day.

Jean Damascene has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase more goods like rice, sugar, body lotion, soap, beer, tomato sauce etc. With his profit, he will increase his business and renovate his house.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like body lotion, soap, beer, tomato sauce etc.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Hay un lugar conocido como la comunidad de Arin este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En esta comunidad de Arin conocimos a la señora Justina de 33 años de edad, tiene su pareja y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos, vive con su pareja en su casa propia que cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la provincia de Calca, que pertenece al departamento del Cusco. Esta zona tiene como actividad principal la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Justina se dedica a la venta de verduras y también elaborar jora de maíz y vende en diferentes mercados de los diferentes ciudades como Calca, Urubamba y Cusco. Ya son 25 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Posteriormente vende sus muebles a personas que le hicieron pedidos hace tiempo.   

El crédito que ha solicitado Justina es de 1,000 nuevos soles a Asociación Arariwa, será destinado para pagar a los ayudantes que le ayudaran a desgranar el maíz. Justina es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa que siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida y poder tener lo que quiere.
texts.en:
In the city of Calca in the department of Cusco, there is a place known as the community of Arin.  This place is known for his beautiful landscapes, its cuisine, and the warmth of its people.

In the community of Arin we meet Justina, who is 33 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives with her partner in their own house which has water and light services.  It is located in the province of Calca, which is in the department of Cusco.  This area's main activity is farming, livestock, and tourism.

Justina works selling vegetables and also makes "jora de maíz" (a fermented corn drink), which she sells in different markets in different cities, like Calca, Urubamba, and Cusco.  She has done this work for 25 years and it is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  She used to sell furniture to people who placed orders.

She is asking for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Asociación Arariwa, which she will use to pay assistants who helped her shell corn.  Justina is a hardworking and earnest woman who has always known how to succeed to improve her life and be able to have what she wants.

loans.use: to pay the assistants who helped her shell corn.

loans.name: Chabuca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUNAY TIKA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Chabuca; ella tiene 24 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también realiza el servicio de llamadas y la venta de recargas para celulares, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar y fideos y también para pagar las líneas de los celulares.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Chabuca is a member of the "Munay Tika" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Chabuca is 24 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business.  She also provides a call service and sells top-ups (minutes) for cell phones.  She works from 6.00am to 5.00pm and, through her business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Chabuca would like to expand her grocery store business.  She is requesting this loan to buy products for her grocery store such as rice, sugar and noodles.  She will also pay for cell phone lines.  

Chabuca is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store such as rice, sugar and noodles, and to pay for cell phone lines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase of high-grade manure for his farm

loans.name: Ida

texts.es:
La señora Ida es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Solidarias del Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos.
Son 33 ciclos que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo.  Generalmente todo es por pedidos, que luego entregara a los clientes al crédito y en otros casos al contado.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles comprará una buena cantidad de productos como: 4 perfumes de mujer, 3 perfumes de hombres, 2 talcos, jabones líquidos, 3 coloretes,  2 cremas anti arrugas.
Para poder sacar pedidos, ella visita a sus clientas puerta por puerta, gracias a este negocio, Ida puede ayudar económicamente a su esposo.
"Gracias a Manuela Ramos por brindarme toda la ayuda necesaria para poder seguir trabajando".
texts.en:
Sra. Ida is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Solidarias” (Supportive Women) which is in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 60 years old, married, and has four children.

Ida has participated in 33 loan cycles with Manuela Ramos. She sells beauty products through catalogs. All of her sales are generally made through orders. When she delivers her products, Ida extends credit to her customers but in some cases she accepts cash.

With this loan of 2500 PEN, she will buy a large quantity of products including four women’s perfumes, three men’s colognes, two talcum powders, liquid soaps, three blushes, and two anti-wrinkle creams. In order to generate orders, Ida visits her customers by going door-to-door. Thanks to this business, she is able to help her husband with the finances.

She would like to say, “Thank you to Manuela Ramos for providing all the help I need to continue working.”

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, colognes, talcum powders, liquid soaps, and anti-wrinkle creams.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 40-year-old single mother of five children living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is vested with the responsibility of looking after her family and her dream is to educate her children up to university level. For ten years, Rebecca has been rearing pigs and chickens, and this has helped her pay school fees for her children. Her major challenge is the hiking [cost of] feeds, and her dream is to own 1000 birds as she currently has 200 birds.

Rebecca needs this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Ham

texts.en: Ham has been riding a motorbike in Siem Reap for a long time now. With his smile, it makes it easy for him to find more clients every day. He could earn about $3 per day. His wife is a fish seller in a market near her house. From day to day, his wife could also earn about $3 profit per day. They have responsibility for their six children. With the aim of improving his business, Ham would like to borrow some funds to support his family better than before. He would like to borrow about $500 to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 36-year-old woman. She is married and has three sons and four daughters. Amani lives in Rafah city in Palestine.
Amani's husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee, Amani wants to finish the construction of the family house they started years ago. Since her husband makes a decent salary and paying for the construction expenses will exhaust the family financially, she took out a $2,000 from FATEN to cover the expenses and have them repaid on a monthly basis to FATEN.

Amani is a religious conservative woman. Her husband is photographed instead at FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To finish construction of the family house.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 36 years old; she is married to David who is a farmer. They are blessed with three children. She has been in the farming business for the past six years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.


She is applying for her 1st loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Mary will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children up to university level. Her hopes and dreams are to export her farm produce.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es:
En  la ciudad de Managua el  señor Víctor Manuel  se dedica arduamente a laborar como vigilante en una empresa de esta cuidad  dedicándose  a esta labor desde hace 6 años .es casado con 5 persona a su cargo  a la  que tiene que  proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen. 
Una de las necesidades que el señor atraviesa hoy en dia es que necesita ampliar su casa de habitación para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda debido a esto  ha tomado la decisión  de iniciar la obra de mejora . es por este motivo que acude a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como zinc, arena, cementó, para iniciar la mejora de la vivienda realizando  la ampliación de un cuarto por medio de esta obra brindara mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos y esposa .
Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta obra le proporciona a su familia un techo digno donde vivir y con todas las condiciones necesarias
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Señor Víctor Manuel works hard as a caretaker for a city company. He has been doing this work for 6 years. He is married with 5 dependents who he has to provide with the necessary conditions for them to develop. 

He needs to enlarge his house to improve the living conditions in his house. For this reason he has decided to start the improvement work. It is for this reason that has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan in order to buy building materials such as zinc, sand, cement to start his home improvements by enlarging a room. In this way he can provide his wife and children with better living conditions.

Most importantly through the realization of this building work, he can give his family a decent roof to live under with all the necessary living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Gbedokpo Suru Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBEDOKPO SURU est composé de trois personnes qui vendent ensemble dans le même marché. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mélanie Akoua est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Mélanie Akoua est âgée de 47 ans et est une veuve qui vit seule. Mélanie Akoua a quatre enfants tous scolarisés, dont trois restent encore à sa charge. Mélanie Akoua n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer ses besoins et nourrir ses enfants, Mélanie Akoua vend des produits divers (conserves, savons, farine de manioc, etc.) dans un marché du Bénin. Mélanie Akoua s'approvisionne au Bénin. Mélanie Akoua exerce cette activité depuis six ans. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Mélanie Akoua sollicite un crédit, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBEDOKPO SURU.
texts.en:
The group GBEDOKPO SURU is comprised of three persons who are sellers together at the same market. This is the first time the group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their business. The group's representative, by the name of Mélanie Akoua, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 47 years old and a widow who lives alone. She has four children, all in school. 

Mélanie Akoua never attended school. To support herself and make sure her children are fed, she sells a variety of goods (canned foods, soaps, cassava flour, etc.) in a market in Benin. Her supplies come from Benin. She has been in this business for six years. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and increase her revenues, Mélanie Akoua and the other members of the group GBEDOKPO SURU are requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soaps, and cassava flour

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is widowed and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past six years, Beatrice has been working hard to manage her garment shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Beatrice has requested a loan of 1,800,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and it will help Beatrice to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Beatrice hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Beatrice is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Beatrice who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 53-year-old single lady. She sells cereals and lesos (African fabric) in Mombasa. She has been in this business for the last two years. 

Florence was recently introduced to KADET, and this marks her first borrowing to finance her business. Her business is doing well, and with this loan, she plans to add more stock of a variety of cereals and lesos into her business. The anticipated profits generated from the business will be directed into the repayment of the loan and gradual expansion of her business. Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: To add more stock of a variety of cereals and lesos (African fabric).

loans.name: Banco Comunal Nuestra Esperanza Group

texts.es: Éste banco comunal se llama Nuestra Esperanza, lo conforman 8 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes actividades la señora Ángela se dedica a la venta de tortillas, sus ventas las realiza desde su casa todos los días realiza un arduo trabajo para proporcionarle a su familia los el alimento diario. Sus metas son expandir su negocio realizarle mejoras a su local, tanto ella como las demás socias están muy entusiasmadas con este crédito que cada una de ellas realizara. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de maíz, leña, comal,  bolsas, servilletas entre otros productos.
texts.en: This communal bank is called "Nuestra Esperanza" and it is comprised of eight entrepreneurs who have different business activities.  Mrs. Ángela sells tortillas from home and every day works hard to put food on the table for her family.  Her goals are to expand the business and renovate her sales location.  She and the other members are excited about their loan.  This one will be used to buy corn, fireword, an earthenware pan, bags and napkins, among other items.

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood, an earthenware pan, bags, napkins

loans.name: Sabira

texts.en:
Sabira is an extremely hard-working and energetic woman. She is married and the loving mother of six children. Her husband and two sons help her with the primary business of her family, livestock breeding. She has been engaged in animal husbandry for the last 20 years. She purchases cattle and feeds them for a certain period; then sells cattle in the market. 

Sabira would like to get a loan of 1500 AZN to purchase cattle and expand her business. She hopes that the lenders will support her in the business. AqroInvest Credit Union has been a fundamental part of Sabira´s business, having provided a loan which has been used to purchase calves and cows. This will be her 2nd loan and she has a good credit history.

loans.use: purchase three cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Mayaqui Sartasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MAYAQUI SARTASIÑANI” iniciará su decimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal German Busch, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Agustina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio de chompas, venta de ropa, tienda de barrio, heladería, confección de traje, plomería, artesanía de mantas y chalinas, venta de comida, venta de zapatos.

La señora Agustina,  indica que hace cuatro años trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de vecinos. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de ferretería que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su esposo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de herramientas) que de las personas que le traen a su tienda  y posteriormente lo venderá en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The A.C. “MAYAQUI SARTASIÑANI” group began its 11th cycle with Pro Mujer in the area of the province of Germán Busch. They have 11 members and a board of directors headed by Agustina. The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied and among them are sweaters, selling clothing, neighborhood grocery, ice cream shop, seamstress, plumbing, handicrafts of blankets and scarves, food sales, and shoe sales.

Agustina says that she has been working with Pro Mujer for 4 years and that she joined the bank at the invitation of neighbors. Currently she has a hardware store and has been working for some years, learning the business from her husband.

The loan that she is asking for now will be used to increase her capital, to buy tools, that will bring people to her store, so she can sell the tools in her business. This form of work permits her to generate income to support her family as she lives in a partnership and has 4 children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the discussions of health.

loans.use: to buy tools to sell

loans.name: Sokny

texts.en: Sokny, 32, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Sokny and her husband sell palm sugar to their new and existing customers. Sokny is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more palm sugar to resell. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more palm sugar to resell

loans.name: Jaime Arturo

texts.es: El señor Jaime Arturo es un emprendedor quien tiene su propio negocio en el cual vende snacks, tintos y minutos a celular. El horario de trabajo del señor Jaime Arturo es de 7:30 a.m. a 7:00 p.m. de lunes a sábado.  Aunque el señor Jaime Arturo tiene dificultades para caminar debidas a una enfermedad que le dio cuando niño, el señor Jaime Arturo trabaja arduamente para generar sus propios ingresos. El señor Jaime Arturo requiere de la compra de surtido tal como snacks, dulces y galletas, que le permitan aumentar sus ventas y así sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida. El sueño del señor Jaime Arturo es poder organizar su vivienda propia.
texts.en: Jaime Arturo is an entrepreneur who has his own business where he sells snacks, coffee, and cell phone minutes. Jaime's work schedule runs from 7:30am to 7:00pm, Monday through Saturday. Although Jaime Arturo has difficulty walking due to an illness he had when he was a child, he works very hard to earn his own income. Jaime Arturo needs to purchase supplies such as snacks, sweets, and cookies that will allow him to increase his sales and thus his income, and improve his quality of life. Jaime Arturo's dream is to be able to have his own house.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as snacks, sweets, and cookies

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 34 years old, married, and has seven children. He has two businesses: rental houses and brewing beer. He believes his businesses are improving each day, though he faces a challenge of some of his customers defaulting. His family goal is to educate his children. His business goal is to expand his businesses to new areas.

Alex needs a loan to renovate his rental houses and to buy ingredients for brewing local gin.

loans.use: to renovate his rental houses and to buy ingredients for brewing local gin.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es:
El Sr. Dionicio es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 54 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Delsiveria de 52 años de edad. Tienen 3 hijos todos ya mayores de edad, que trabajan de forma independiente.
Dionicio comenta que tiene una despensa muy bien surtida en su propia casa, dice que le va muy bien debido a los buenos precios que tiene y sumado a eso la amabilidad con que atiende a los clientes. Respecto a su clientela dice que ya la tiene bien formada, lo que lo ayuda a tener un buen ingreso.
El solicita el crédito para poder abastecer su local, con todo tipo de insumos, como ser bebidas, comestibles, lácteos, panificados y demás tipo de productos. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
54-year-old Dionicio is from Santaní city, and is married to Delsiveria (52). They have 3 adult children who work independently.

Dionicio has a well-stocked pantry at home, and says he is doing very well due to their good prices and friendly service they offer to their customers. He has already formed a good customer base, which helps him earn a good income.

This loan has been requested to enable Dionicio to stock his shop with all kinds of produce, such as drinks, food, dairy, baked goods and other products. 

Dionicio gives thanks to the foundation for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, perishable goods, dairy and baked produce and other items to sell in his store.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 37 years old and single. She owns and runs a retail shop and this has been her source of income for the last two years. She earns a monthly income of Kenya shillings 12,000.

She is requesting her first loan with KADET LTD, which she plans to use to buy cereals, wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for resale in her retail shop. With the anticipated profits, she will expand her business.

Her hopes is to own a wholesale store in the future.

loans.use: to buy cereals, wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Merlyn has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Merlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Merlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Sharlet

texts.en: Sharlet is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a retail business where she sells bananas, tomatoes, onions and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to have a well stocked business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert M. joined Life in Africa in 2005. He started as a volunteer working with visual images. His hard work and dedication has earned him a full time paid position as Visual Images Manager at the WE Center.

Gilbert has a passion for computers and he wishes to pursue a higher education majoring in computer studies. In order to accomplish this goal he has devised a plan to open a business.

This will give him the necessary funds to complete his education. The business he has chosen is a secretarial service.

He has already secured a space for this business and has one computer in place. The location of the space is near the University and services such as this are in high demand by the students which will offer a strong customer base to support the business. The services to be offered include photocopying , scanning , typing and printing , plus spiral and book binding. Eventually he is also going to venture into CD writng and music recording.

Gilbert has already saved Ushs.900,000 and he is seeking a loan in the amount of 800,000 to get the business up and running. To start this business, he is seeking a loan in the amount of Ushs.800,000. He will be able to repay this loan in 10 months.

Loan amount 800,000

Photocopier 1 - 1,000,000 - 1,000,000

Paper 10 reams @7000 ----------70,000

Files 10 @1500 ----------------15,000

Diskettes 10 pkts @5500--------55,000

Pens --------------------------10,000

Pencils------------------------10,000

Rulers--------------------------8,000

Empty video tapes------------- 32,000

Rent 4 months @90,000---------360,000

Labour 1 month @ 70,000 -------70,000

Transporting-------------------15,000

Empty CDs--------------------- 30,000

Black books--------------------15,000

Maintenance 1 month @10,000----10,000

Total ----------------------1,700,000

WE Team to benefit:

loans.use: Buying materials for setting up a secretarial bureau.

loans.name: Malelega

texts.en: 24-year-old sole financial provider for her family Malelega is the only girl in a family of 6 six brothers. Since been a member of the South Pacific Business Development Program Malelega has helped fund for the development and running of the family plantation, which is the sole provider for the family’s livelihood. Malelega is at the market three times a week selling taro to earn money to pay back her loan with SPBD and also provide food and supplies to harvest the plantation. What she earns from selling the produce from their plantation is also enough to put aside for a rainy day. She earns 300 tala (US120) a week. Her loans have helped her improve the state of her family. She lives with her parents, brothers and their wives. She has applied for the next loan to purchase addtional planting materials for her taro plantation.

loans.use: To purchase addtional planting materials and organic fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is a single mother who supports herself and her sixteen-year-old son through her shoe and textiles sales business. She has operated her business since her son was one year old. Her little sales kiosk is located at the large central market in Kharkiv. Svetlana has learned much in her 15 years as an entrepreneur. She knows her products and has a reputation for offering good service and for being kind and considerate toward her customers. Her desire is to maintain an inventory of good quality products at prices that her customers can afford.

Svetlana has been an excellent client with Nadiya Ukraine. She has received 15 loans in all and has paid each one back with no delinquencies. She is grateful for the financial assistance, which has been instrumental in the growth and stability of her business.

Svetlana has requested a loan for $1200 to add to her available purchasing capital. Springtime is a very busy shopping time in Ukraine. The already busy markets get even busier as many shoppers get out to buy things for spring and summer. Svetlana would like to be able to maintain an adequate product inventory during this time so that this will be a profitable season for her and her small business.

Світлана – сама виховує 16-річного сина. Вона займається бізнесом з продажу взуття та тканин ще з того часу, коли її сину виповнився один рік. Її маленький кіоск розташований на великому центральному ринку м. Харків. Світлана багато чого навчилася за 15 років роботи. Вона чудово розуміється на торгівлі; гарне обслуговування, дбайливе та привітне ставлення до покупців надають їй перевагу серед інших підприємців на ринку. Світлана хоче придбати якісний товар за доступними оптовими цінами для подальшої роздрібної торгівлі. В Світлани – чудова репутація в „Надії України”. Вона отримала 15 позик, сплативши кожну з них без жодного прострочення. Вона дуже вдячна за фінансову підтримку, яка сприяла розвитку та стабільності її бізнесу. Світлана просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб поповнити власний робочий капітал. На ринку завжди багато покупців – напередодні весни/літа їх стає ще більше. Світлана прагне придбати необхідний товар для того, щоб задовольнити потреби клієнтів та отримати прибуток, який допоможе їй й надалі підтримувати власний малий бізнес.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Sadriddin

texts.ru:
Sadriddin M. has been an active client of MLF MicroInvest for over 3 years. He has been in business for no less than 7 years. He is married and has 3 children. Sadriddin M. started his shoes selling business with only $200 in startup capital. He personally buys and delivers goods from his suppliers. Now his business value has grown to $800. He needs $600 loan to increase the volume of the goods sold to use the profits to pay for his mother’s medical expenses.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Муйдинов Садриддин, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 3 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 7 лет. Он женат, имеет 3 детей. Свою деятельность начал с продажи мужской обуви, его актив составлял 200$. За товаром ездит сам. Сейчас его активы составляют 800$. Ему необходимо 600$ для увеличения товарооборота, а полученную прибыль потратить на лечение своей матери.

loans.use: To increase the volume of the goods sold

loans.name: Maria Genara

texts.en:
Maria Genara U. P. is 61 years old and runs a bakery or panadería with her husband. They've been working the shop together since he had a bicycle accident about ten years ago that ended his prior career and forced them to search for a new way to make a living. They start early. At about 11pm they start up the oven. At 12:30 am the baking starts, and by 6:00 am they're ready to sell to the neighbors. If Maria looks tired in this picture, it's because she is. This photo was taken at about 1:00pm.

Maria will invest this loan in flour, sugar, and firewood. She'll go through about 100 pounds of flour in three days. She goes through about 80 pieces of firewood every two days at a cost of about U.$5.50.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar, and firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy merchandise for resell.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija H. is married with two children and is now expecting a third one. She runs a shop at her home, selling different consumables, including food items. With the profits she looks after her family and can cater to the household needs. She is in need of $900 to help her expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Sharon's Group

texts.en:
Sharon N. currently sells firewood. She will use the loan to increase her stock of firewood in order to increase her sales and profits.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To expand her stock

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela belongs to al Banco Comunal Banco Del Futuro (Del Futuro Community Bank), located in Carretera Federico Basadre Km. 8.600 of AA. HH. Nueva Magdalena Mz 1 Lt 12, Callería district in Ucayali department. She is 62 years old and has 3 children (all of them of legal age) who always support her.

Estela used her first S/. 300 loan, from Manuela Ramos, to invest in a small soda fountain. Nowadays she still has the soda fountain and 4 internet booths as well as a small chicken rotisserie joint. Estela gets up very early to check the time the staff comes in. In the afternoon she only takes a couple of hours off to rest because she has to open one of her businesses at night and keep it open until very late, but her children help her with it.

With the S/. 2,000 loan, which Estela will repay within 5 months, she will buy a modem for the Internet and the rest of the loan will be used to remodel the chicken rotisserie joint. Estela has a routine that is quite hectic because of the several businesses she has, but her age does not hold her back and she can manage all the businesses properly; she considers herself to be successful and happy for having been able to support her children. She is also very thankful to Manuela Ramos for all the support she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer

La señora Estela pertenece al Banco Comunal Banco Del Futuro, ubicado en Carretera Federico Basadre Km. 8.600 del AA. HH. Nueva Magdalena Mz 1 Lt 12, distrito de Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 62 años y es madre de 3 hijos mayores de edad que siempre la apoyan. Estela con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en una pequeña fuente de soda. En la actualidad ella continúa con la fuente de soda, además tiene 4 cabinas de Internet y una pequeña pollería. Se levanta muy temprano para controlar el ingreso de su personal, en las tardes sólo descansa un par de horas porque uno de sus negocios tiene que abrirlo en la noche quedándose hasta altas horas de la noche para poder cerrarlo, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará un modem para su Internet y el resto de su préstamo lo utilizará para refaccionar su pollería. Estela tiene una rutina de vida muy agitada por los diversos negocios que posee y a pesar de su edad no es impedimento para manejarlos adecuadamente hasta el punto de considerarse una mujer exitosa y feliz por haber sacado sola adelante a sus hijos y además está muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo que le brinda.

loans.use: Compra de activo (modem) y refracción de local

loans.name: Khasanhuja

texts.en:
Khasanhuja K. sells women's clothing in the central market of his city. The business is successful and provides a stable income for his large family. But Khasanhuja would like to offer a better variety of goods to his customers.

Twice a month, he travels to a neighboring city to buy his goods. With this loan, he will purchase a wider range of women's clothing to sell in his shop.

Khasanhuja is 24 years old. He is not yet married, however he is the main bread-winner in his family that includes his parents and younger sister. He thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.

loans.use: Purchase a wider range of women's clothing

loans.name: Bayram

texts.en: Bayram K. is a 39 year old shop owner who has been in business since 2002. He lives with his wife, two sons, and daughter in the southern Bilasuvar region of Azerbaijan. They are Internally Displaced Persons living in a settlement. Bayram is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to be repaid over 18 months to increase the inventory in his shop.

loans.use: To increase the inventory in his shop

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro R. is not married but he is a single father to an 8 year old boy. The boy is currently in hospital fighting a bout of leukemia. He started his business so that he can continue his studies and to support his son, who requires constant hospitalization, medicines and medical support. Seeing as he is a single father he did not have the support to help with the boy, so he took on a business. He is works only on the weekends so that he can take care of his little one. He started the busines sin April 2000, importing used clothing from the US, and that which he sold to his neighbours and family members from the garage of his house. With faith and perseverence his business started to grow, and now he has even expanded into selling new clothing in the local market.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of $975 that he will repay in a term of 6 months to refurbish his business and to purchase an air conditionner in preparation for the upcoming summer season. In this way he will be able to provide his clients with comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Alejandro Ramírez no esta casado sin embargo es padre de un niño de 8 años; quien actualmente se encuentra hospitalizado debido a que padece de leucemia. Inició el negocio para seguir estudiando y sacar adelante a su hijo, el cual constantemente requiere hospitalización, medicina y cuidado, Debido a que es papa soltero no tenia quien le ayudara a cuidarlo, decidió emprender un negocio, donde solo trabajara los fines de semana para poder cuidar a su menor. Comenzó en Abril del año 2000, importo ropa de U.S.A de segunda mano, la cual empezó a vender a sus vecinos y familiares en el porche de su casa, con fe y perseverancia su negocio fue creciendo, actualmente tiene su negocio de ropa nueva en el tianguis solidaridad.

Solicita un crédito por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su negocio y comprar aire acondicionado, ya que se aproxima la temporada de calor y es necesario contar con ella. De esta forma le brindara mas confort a sus clientes.

loans.use: To refurbish his business.

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
